story:
Story of My Book

What’s Your Plus is a book for college students that details strategies for succeeding without getting overwhelmed, stressed or burnt out. It also talks about how to come out ahead with more to show than just a degree, like long-term connections, key skills, amazing internships, and so much more.

My name is Vihan Khanna, and I am the author of What’s Your Plus. I wrote this book because I wish a college cheat sheet sort of book like this was available to me when I was starting college.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover useful strategies for attaining maximum success in college and your daily life. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for getting the most out of everything I do in life. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you ace college and come out ahead.

In this book, you'll learn about getting the most out of college and being able to do what you love after you graduate:

The story of Angie Carrillo - How she took to heart what she read in The 4-Hour Workweek by Tim Ferriss and completely transformed her life to attain her ideal lifestyle

Insights from Tim Draper - Tips for students and early-stage entrepreneurs from a globally-known venture capitalist

The Journey of Mark Cuban - How he went from sharing a two-bedroom apartment with six guys after graduating college to becoming a billionaire

You will love this book if you are about to start college and it seems super daunting to you, or if you are a recent graduate looking for a job that you love.

What’s Your Plus is a non-fiction book that speaks to students and recent graduates who are looking at college or the job market for the first time.

The Book - What’s Your Plus

The book is written in 3 Parts...

Part 1 contains the introduction + three additional chapters. This part talks about how to effectively manage your time and your schedule. Read stories from people like venture capitalist Tim Draper, Serial Entrepreneur Mark Cuban, and entrepreneur and mentor Juan Acosta.

Part 2 contains Chapters four and five. This part talks about school life balance and work life balance. Learn from Vihan himself about his experiences in college, learn from his friend about his experience in college, hear from Angie Carrillo about how The 4-Hour Workweek by Tim Ferriss shaped her life.

Part 3 contains Chapters six and seven. This part talks about working a regular job by day and being an entrepreneur by night. Read about jobs you can have with a ton of flexibility while in college. Learn about how to turn your side hustle into a career, and see how digital artist Summer Silvery turned her love of doodling into a full-time career.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

 

  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Vihan Khanna is a senior at Montclair State University, the second largest college in New Jersey with graduates such as actor Bruce Willis and poet Allen Ginsberg.

He wrote this book because he wanted to share with current and future college students what he has learned about getting the most out of college from his own experiences, research, and from others.

Vihan is a caring person who is always willing to help others and also often tends to put others before himself. In his spare time, Vihan volunteers with the Boy Scouts of America as an assistant scoutmaster of the troop with which he became an Eagle Scout.

For more information you can connect with Vihan at Vihan.Khanna@gmail.com and through Facebook at Facebook.com/Vihan, on Instagram @TheVihanKhanna, or on LinkedIn at linkedin.com/in/VihanKhanna

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into my campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #MakeVihanAnAuthor and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo from the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Vihan Khanna

story:
I'm raising funds to translate, edit and self-publish the new edition of my book ''PATH'' in three more languages: Spanish, Portuguese and French. It is currently available in English and will be available in Russian in October 2016. 

First I need to hire a translator for each language mentioned above. Then I would have to hire an editor for each language to review the translated text. Being multilingual myself, I understand the challenge of maintaining an original meaning during the translation and having an editor to review the text in each language is a necessary step. After that I will have to hire another person who would take the Word files and convert them to a different formats with all that is required by Create Space and Kindle. Thus I need to hire three different people for each language. I have already managed to cover the cost of the Russian version of my book and the new edition in English (which both will be available in October 2017) but to do it in three more languages will require your support. 

Thank you!

story:
Breve reseña

Primero que mi nombre es Mónica Álvarez soy madre del pequeño Santiago de 4 años de edad. Santiago nació un 13 de julio del 2010, el bebe mas hermoso que su madre pudo tener en sus brazos, pero la felicidad fue opacada con una terrible noticia el había nacido con una malformación ano rectal y tendrían que hacerle mínimo 3 cirugías y al parecer le tendrían que hacer estudios de todo por que si ya había tenido una malformación era muy probable que acarreara muchas otras situaciones. Su primera cirugía fue el 14 de julio al día de nacido y le hicieron una colostomía para que pudiera obrar, estuvo internado 9 días y desde ahí empezaron todos los cuidados, los gastos y los estudios con el cardiologo, neurologo, traumatologo, endocrinólogo, terapistas, etc. en el seguro y particular por que obviamente uno como padre siempre quiere una segunda opinión y la necesidad de saber lo mas pronto posible como ayudar a tu hijo. Inicio sus terapias a los 2 meses de nacido, estimulación temprana, patrón cruzado, equino terapia, etc. Mensualmente tenia cita con el cirujano pediatra, neurologo, cardiologo, terapista, endocrinólogo y con el tiempo también clases de lenguaje. A los 13 meses le hicieron su segunda cirugía en el cual estuvo internado 12 días, con la gracias del creador todo salio excelente. Tomaba medicina anti convulsiva, para el hipotiroidismo y antibiótico para evitar las infecciones. a los 20 meses le hicieron su tercera cirugía para la cual estuvo internado 14 días y en ayuno 9. Santi es un guerrero, un luchador incansable, nunca se a dejado vencer y a luchado siempre con una gran sonrisa. Ha sido muy enfermizo entre las diarreas, las gripas y obviamente no puede todavía ir al baño adecuadamente debido a su situación, luchamos cada día por que se valla acostumbrando hacer del baño correctamente, no le gusta es una sensación nueva para el, dice que es feo hacer popo por la colita,  ya no usa pañal siempre lo hemos tratado como un niño normal y obviamente va a una escuela normal, sigue tomando medicinas para el hipotiroidismo, gracias a dios ya no toma medicina anti convulsiva el neurologo finalmente lo dio de alta y solo lo revisa semestralmente. Pero periódicamente tiene consulta con todos sus doctores, come de todo, claro esta que tiene que llevar un balance y comer sano para que pueda obrar correctamente. 

Santi nació con malformación ano rectal, fue diagnosticado con hipotiroidismo, pie plano, tuvo problemas neurologicos, con un soplo en el corazón convencional que le pedimos a dios a los 6 o 7 años se le cierre solo. Es un estuche mi bebe. 

Estoy aquí pidiendo de su apoyo para poder realizarle todos los estudios correspondientes, con todos los especialistas el cirujano, el neurologo, el cardiologo, la terapista, ahora el traumatologo que lo veo desde los 3 años por que desgraciadamente a raíz de todos los cuidados que necesito, de todos los doctores que visitamos, de todas las terapias que se pagaron hoy estamos mas en banca rota que nunca y no nos a importado los sacrificios yo como madre deje de trabajar 2 años para cuidarlo y dedicarme a el en cuerpo y alma, hasta que ya no pudimos mas con los gastos. Estamos aquí pidiendo apoyo para culminar con todo los estudios y terapias que le faltan en especial la de lenguaje que el requiere y pagar su escuela. Mi esposo y yo trabajamos de sol a sombra y solo para cubrir pagos de doctores y requerimientos especiales, pediatra, medicinas, vitaminas y terapias  pero desgraciadamente ya no podemos sostener esto mas. Este dinero se va directamente para pagar la terapia de lenguaje anual, la equino terapia anual, los estudios neurológicos (electroencefalograma), los estudios del cardiologo, los estudios del endocrinologo, el cirujano especialista, todas las consultas y todas las medicinas y vitaminas que le den o tratamientos y la escuela, y así nosotros podamos liquidar nuestras deudas y darle a Santi una vida de calidad, que a dios gracias este angelito a venido a llenar nuestra vida de alegría.

Nosotros hemos luchando, seguiremos luchando por este niño que no se rinde y que día a día logra alcanzar mas metas que nos demuestra lo fuerte y luchador que es cada día con una sonrisa y con un logro. 

Yo les pido que difundan mi campaña, que nos ayuden a lograr nuestra meta que por mas que nosotros a veces perdemos la esperanza y la fe siempre hay un rayito de luz que nos dice ustedes pueden y mientras nosotros luchemos y lo apoyemos yo se que el todo el amor, el apoyo tanto nuestro como de nuestros amigos y familiares el lo siente, lo ve y ahora lo empieza a entender.

Gracias de antemano por apoyarnos y les pido que nos ayuden en esta lucha sin fin. Que piensen que si hoy es por nosotros mañana sera tal vez por ustedes y que se haga una cadena solida de humanidad. El demostrar al mundo que existe gente humilde y que esta dispuesta apoyar sin recibir nada a cambio mas que la satisfacción de una sonrisa o de un agradecimiento.

Bendiciones para todos.

story:
Hi,

I am Dan C. Ionescu and I need your help to create an amazing book. The book will encourage people to eat healthier, have a well balanced diet and live better. My book offers simple solutions to start eating better and includes the required 5+ portions of fruits and vegetables in your diet.

Read this page carefully to get more details.

Fact 1: At least 2.8 million people each year die as a result of being overweight or obese (World Health Organization  - who.int)

Fact 2: Healthy diets rich in fruits and vegetables may reduce the risk of cancer and other chronic diseases. Fruits and vegetables also provide essential vitamins and minerals, fiber, and other substances that are important for good health. (Center Of Disease Control and Prevention cdc.gov)

Fact 3: The average American gets a total of just three servings of fruits and vegetables a day (Harvard School of Public Health - harvard.edu)  and other nations have the same problem! People eat less vegetables and fruits than they should.

Most people are overwhelmed by the amount of information put out by the health industry. They know the best way to feed their family is to eat at least 5 portions of fruits and vegetables each day for good health but they don’t know how to do it. It may seem hard to follow the food guidelines but in fact it is really simple: by adding salads in your diet! 

Salads are extremely versatile: they can be eaten as a side dish, starter or as a main course, they can be enjoyed all day long – from breakfast to supper and yes, a salad can replace a high calorie snack, are full of nutrients providing your body the vitamins, minerals, essential amino acids, good fats and all the chemicals which are good for you, and finally salads taste great. Also a salad usually requires just minutes to prepare so even the busiest people can make a salad.

The goal of my book is to show people that salads can not only be healthy but also delicious and exciting. The book will contain the most delicious salad and dip recipes from all around the globe. Each recipe will be paired with a high quality photo because it is true that "A picture is worth a thousand words".

This book will show how easy it is to eat fruit and vegetables and enjoy a healthy life. Healthy foods should not be bland; in fact salads are also tasty and healthy.

I am writing this book to make people more aware that salads can be a full meal, can provide their daily fruit and vegetable requirements and, to offer them recipe choices. There will be a lot of recipes to suit all taste preferences and to cover breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks.

About the book, “Salad cookbook. Over 150 Delicious Salad, Dressing, and Dip Recipes With Easy to Find Ingredients”

The book will show readers how easy and delicious it is to have a healthy diet and how simple salads are to prepare.

We eat with our eyes first, so each recipe will include an appealing image showing what the end result should look like. 

The book will feature chapters about: how to choose the ingredients, what kitchen equipment you need, my best tips and tricks.

After the introduction the reader will find the recipes paired with images. The book will start with the most popular salads (which are found on most restaurant menus but a lot of people don’t know how to make them at home, although it is very simple) and will move along to some of the less known salads which I like to call the hidden gems.

The book contains plenty of salad recipes which can be prepared with common ingredients. Everyone will be able to find a few salads they will love.

Why Am I Writing this book?

I was overweight a large part on my adult life and my diet wasn’t always as balanced as it is today. I have to admit I was one of the people not eating the required daily 5+ portions of fruits and vegetables and I considered salads to be a fad and boring.

But one day I started asking the right questions like: Why am I an active person yet nearly obese? What is wrong with my diet? And, How can I eat more fruit and vegetables and become more healthy?

On that day I also started looking for answers, and things began to change. I read everything I could put my hands on about food, healthy eating and cooking and now I want to pass on all that I learned to change from being nearly obese to being healthy.

To make a long story short, I discovered that eating fruit and vegetables is not only healthy it is delicious too. And the easy way of adding more fruit and vegetables is with the help of salads. Salads are extremely versatile and there are countless variations.

To show overweight and health concerned individuals how simple it is to eat healthier I started writing the “Salad cookbook. Over 150 Delicious Salad, Dressing, and Dip Recipes with Easy to Find Ingredients”.

I think that everyone can benefit by having a salad book in their library.

What makes the “Salad cookbook. Over 150 Delicious Salad, Dressing, and Dip Recipes With Easy to Find Ingredients” Unique?

My book will show readers the easy way of moving towards a healthier diet without compromising on taste.

Only the tastiest recipes will be included in the book. Also the recipes will be beginner friendly so even people with no kitchen skills will benefit from this book.

The book will contain enough recipes and dips so everyone should find some they like.

Where Your Contribution Will Go

Writing and publishing a book is not cheap. There are a lot of costs and work involved. I want to publish the book and make it available for the public.

The funds raised on IndieGoGo will help me cover the costs of publishing a professional-level book, which includes:

  • a studio flash lighting kit for taking the salad pictures regardless of existing lighting conditions
  • decors,  attractive serving plates, silverware, napkins and table accessories and so on to make the images look amazing
  • professional editing and proofreading
  • publishing costs
  • ingredients for the salads
  • professional photography costs
  • art & design, converting the book into the proper format for publishing
  • printing

I would like to focus on writing a great book. This means hiring people to do the photography, cover design, formatting, editing, proofreading, publishing, and book promotion.

If we receive funding beyond our goal the extra money will be invested in enhanced book promotion. I can deliver a great book and as many people as possible should have access to it.

More importantly, you'll be helping to create a valuable resource for all the people who want to lose weight, live healthier and feed their children better. And this book will teach you how to take advantage of locally grown produce to make delicious and healthy salads so that you can maintain a healthy lifestyle.

Here's How You Can Help

1.  Contribute financially

Over on the right you'll see a bunch of perks, starting at $5.

Just pick the one that you like best and click the link, IndieGoGo will take you through the simple process of making a contribution. It's easy, and you can use any major credit card or your PayPal account. So choose a perk on the right and let's get started!

help to create an amazing book. The book will encourage people to eat

Fact 1:
At least 2.8 million people each year die as a result of being overweight or
obese (World Health Organization  - who.int)
Fact 2:
Healthy diets rich in fruits and vegetables may reduce the risk of cancer and
other chronic diseases. Fruits and vegetables also provide essential vitamins
and minerals, fiber, and other substances that are important for good health.
(Center Of Disease Control and Prevention cdc.gov)
Fact 3:
The average American gets a total of just three servings of fruits and
vegetables a day (Harvard School of Public Health - harvard.edu)  and other nations have the same problem!

information put out by the health industry. They know the best way to feed
their family is to eat at least 5 portions of fruits and vegetables each day
for good health but they don’t know how to do it. It may seem hard to follow
the food guidelines but in fact it is really simple: by adding salads in your
diet!  
Salads are extremely versatile: they can be eaten as a side dish, starter or
as a main course, they can be enjoyed all day long – from breakfast to supper
and yes, a salad can replace a high calorie snack, are full of nutrients providing
your body the vitamins, minerals, essential amino acids, good fats and all the
chemicals which are good for you, and finally salads taste great. Also a salad
usually requires just minutes to prepare so even the busiest people can make a
salad.
The goal of my book is to show people that
salads can not only be healthy but also delicious and exciting. The book will contain the most delicious
salad and dip recipes from all around the globe. Each recipe will be paired
with a high quality photo because it is true that "A picture is worth a thousand words". 
This book will show how easy it is to
eat fruit and vegetables and enjoy a healthy life. Healthy foods should not be
bland; in fact salads are also tasty and healthy.
I am writing this book to make people
more aware that salads can be a full meal, can provide their daily fruit and
vegetable requirements and, to offer them recipe choices. There will be a lot

choose the ingredients, what kitchen equipment you need, my best tips and
tricks.

story:
What's the story?

Fourteen-year-old budding artist Beatriz lives with her mother, a factory seamstress, in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico. After her mother disappears, Bea sets out to find her unknown father in Mexico City. Along the way, she meets self-defense surfer Sharky, sweet and generous Jesus Angel, and hacktivist Jaguar. The four friends discover a dark secret poisoning the country of Mexico. Art, revolution, and a hint of the supernatural entertwine in a magical realist tale of adventure and the human heart.

Download the first four chapters here to get a sense of my prose style. It's a rough draft, don't forget!

Who's the writer?

I'm a high school English teacher, a mother to a toddler, and a former little girl who wanted to write novels. As a child, teen, and student, I loved writing, but life brought many responsibilities that pushed me away from such a "selfish" goal as making art.

One fine day, almost three years ago, I was in Mexico visiting my husband's family when the idea for Walking Girl came to me. It hasn't left me alone since; in response to its demands, I've made 15 pages of notes, done hours of research in libraries and online, and written the first four chapters. But I haven't made much progress since the birth of my son in September 2012. What I need is time!

What's the plan?

As a teacher, I have the luxury of a built-in, 10-week-long summer break. As a mother who is the primary provider for my family of three, I need the income that comes with working during that break.

I set my funding goal at $5500 to compensate for the income I will lose due to not teaching summer school this year. Even if I don't reach the funding goal, your contributions will help get my family through the summer with body and soul together.

I will write (and research) for at least 4 hours a day, 6 days a week, for 7 weeks -- the same amount of time I would otherwise be teaching. My deadline to finish the first draft of Walking Girl is August 25th, 2014.

Every donor will receive an e-book (PDF) copy of the completed rough draft as "proof-of-purchase" and a mention in the Acknowledgments. Every donor contributing $40 or more will also receive another e-book once I've revised the novel, plus a paperback copy if (when?) it gets published. My gift to donors contributing $200 or more is a hand-bound copy of the revised and finished novel. I learned bookbinding and repair while working at Carleton College Library many years ago, and am excited to have the chance to use that skill again! The most generous donors will also be mentioned in the novel's Dedication, and will be invited to a celebratory dinner if Walking Girl is accepted for publication.

There may also be stickers... stay tuned!

Why should you help?

The world needs this story, this story needs to be written, and I can write it!

  • Young people need more stories with female protagonists! In Walking Girl, the adventure and the personal journey are central, not romance.
  • I waited a long time for the Muse to give me a really good idea. You may know the feeling. I got very lucky when Walking Girl  came to me, but I need even more luck (and bucks) to make it real.
  • While I haven't yet written a novel, I have written a Master's thesis (over 100 pages)! I've also knitted a number of nice sweaters. Less-tangible major projects include running a high school arts magnet program for a year (so far), raising a child for almost two years (so far), becoming fluent in Spanish in three years, and teaching teenagers for eight years.
  • My family, friends, and students all know that I am creative, organized, and smart (with words especially). I keep my promises and finish what I start!

story:
Siren Life

We're a grass-roots magazine that strives to introduce artisans and budding authors to new audiences via special interest issues of our monthly publication 

All content is 'of the sirens, by the sirens, for the sirens'

Out of the clouds

To date, our magazine has only been digital, in a daily blog format as well as full-layout e-magazine format available online or as a PDF. From the get-go, subscribers have clamored for a print version, but the costs were too darn prohibitive.

  • Funding will go towards getting these suckers out of the clouds and onto the page
  • More than just a donation, your funds are really an investment, which you may use for or own use or transfer to a loved one
  • Funding will be used to cover printing costs.

Newbies deserve a break

The bulk of the artists we feature are not the rich and famous. They are generally those who are the beginning of their artistic careers and could use all the help they can get. La Vie Sirene exposes their work and advertises for them at no charge, in order to get the word out without overtaxing those who fall into the 'struggling artist' category.

We've published 8 issues to date, and have cultivated a thoughtful and loyal following

Crossing our Fingers

Frankly, the magazine is a ton of work and as it is available for free (along with ads), does not generate the funds needed to cover basic costs. We look to this campaign to change that

    Be part of the family... or at least the fun

    If you're not able to donate cash, not to worry; you can still get in on the action by volunteering as a proofreader, or sharing our articles and artists via social media.  All are welcome to join our madcap group of volunteer contributors, known as the LVS Magpies

story:
Short Summary

  • I’m an independent filmmaker creator of “Real Time”, film that brought me a Guinness World Record™, being the first movie in film history to have been filmed as one long sequence without any camera cuts: an 86 minutes sequence shot.

    Since I was a teenager I devoted myself to photography.

  • I am currently presenting a photo exhibition called “Feminine Minds & Sensitivity” in different cities of Mexico and Europe. In it, the conceptualization of each set emerges from the mind of every actress portrayed, becoming co-authors. I have been working on this collection in the past six years in countries as Romania, Bulgaria, Czech Republic and Mexico and now I have the dream to publish it on a beautiful art book.
  • With your fantastic help I’ll see my dream come true: to dedicate this book to my beautiful mother, who is my inspiration. Each photo you’ll see in this book is a tribute to all the gorgeous women portrayed and I want to bring a book copy to each one of them.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I will edit my photo book using a $6,749 full color editorial package that it will place the book on web stores as Amazon and Barnes & Noble. I’ll also hire a professional editorial designer to make it look awesome! And I'll cover the shipping costs to send the book to the models on it in different countries. I’m not looking to re-cover my production costs, shooting hours, post-production work on the images and beers drunk in this period, because I did it with all my love.
  • If you help me, you can get The Book! Or at least, I’ll send you a set of 8 different signed photos of this collection in different sizes, from large photo prints to small postcards. I also can offer you a free photo session if you come to Veracruz State, or if you bring me wherever you are!

  • If I don’t reach my goal, I’ll get a smaller package to publish my book. I’ll print it anyway!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Don't be shy and tell your friends, your family and everyone you know in real life or on social network: Like it and Share it!
  • Feel free to help promoting the Feminine Minds & Sensitivities on  and all the share tools found on Indiegogo!

story:
THE STORY

My third-great uncle, William Scoresby, was an Arctic explorer, whaling ship captain, naturalist, inventor, mechanical engineer, clergyman, social activist, lecturer and author. He explored new territory in the Arctic, wrote the first book of polar science, and kicked off the quest to find the Northwest Passage. Charles Darwin took his books with him on the H.M.S. Beagle, and in the 19th century Scoresby was as famous as John James Audubon or Marie Curie.

Though he is all but forgotten today, his discoveries are now helping scientists understand climate change in the Arctic. Information from his voyages 200 years ago is providing new insight for scientists to predict future changes in our environment.

My new book about this incredible adventurer will show how his exploration and scientific innovation continue to shape our world.

I plan to take a 10-day research trip to three British cities connected with Scoresby--Whitby, London and Liverpool--and uncover new clues about his life for this book.

Scoresby was born in 1789 in Whitby, a quaint coastal town in northeast England. When he passed away in 1857, he donated all of his personal letters, diaries, logbooks and other papers to the Whitby Museum. I’ll spend at least a week reading and analyzing this huge but mostly unorganized collection to learn more about who Scoresby was. I’ll be looking for correspondence with contemporary explorers and scientists, including Darwin himself. In London and Liverpool, I’ll visit maritime museums and walk the same streets as Scoresby did almost two centuries ago.

Ultimately, the materials I find on my trip will enrich the biography I’m writing, and reveal new stories about my own family. I’m looking forward to sharing his exciting and inspiring life with the world.

THE TEAM

Kat Long, author/expedition leader

I’m a writer and editor at National Geographic Adventure. My stories focus on many of the themes that I’ll touch on in the new book: Arctic exploration, environmental challenges, nature and wildlife, and science and discovery.

Previously, I covered science news for The Wall Street Journal and Scientific American. My freelance articles have also appeared print and digital publications like The Washington Post, Smithsonian, Slate and Hakai Magazine. My first book, The Forbidden Apple, was a New York Times Book Review Editor’s Choice.

Shannon Leigh O’Neil, researcher/first mate

Shannon, a professional researcher and editor, will accompany me as an assistant on the trip. She is already familiar with the Scoresby narrative and skilled in archival research (especially reading 19th-century handwriting!). Shannon will provide an extra brain to help maximize our brief time at the Whitby Museum.

THE BUDGET

Every dollar contributed to this campaign will go toward my research trip. I plan to travel lightly and cheaply using public transportation, inexpensive lodging and a lot of free Wi-Fi. Here is a breakdown of the estimated expenses:

Airfare: $1,400

Lodging: $450

Transportation in and between cities: $500

Car and driver hire for one day: $200

Pub fare and groceries: $550

Museum admissions and miscellaneous/unexpected expenses: $400

Indiegogo processing fees (approximate): $500

What happens if I get more than I ask for?

I will invest the extra money in further research and outreach efforts. One plan is to offer a multimedia lecture about my book at museums, libraries and schools. The extra money from the campaign will help defray the cost of travel.  

What happens if I get less than I ask for?

Your generous pledges will help me to travel for a longer period and visit more places in the U.K., but I’m prepared to fork over the remaining funds if needed.

TIMELINE

The research trip will be planned for February 2017. Naturally, it takes time for a book to go from research notes to manuscript to publication, and there are many steps along the way. I will continue to write the biography and the book proposal to secure the publishing deal. I’ve already had interest from a literary agent.

STAY IN TOUCH

Learn more about the project and get updates on Facebook, Twitter and my website, katlong.com.

FAQ

Questions? Just ask!

THANK YOU!

Ultimately, the materials I find on my trip will enrich the biography I’m writing, and reveal new stories about my own family. I’m looking forward to sharing his exciting and inspiring life with the world.
THE TEAM
Kat Long, author/expedition leader
I’m a writer and editor at National Geographic Adventure. My stories focus on many of the themes that I’ll touch on in the new book: Arctic exploration, environmental challenges, nature and wildlife, and science and discovery.
Previously, I covered science news for The Wall Street Journal and Scientific American. My freelance articles have also appeared print and digital publications like The Washington Post, Smithsonian, Slate and Hakai Magazine. My first book, The Forbidden Apple, was a New York Times Book Review Editor’s Choice.
Shannon Leigh O’Neil, researcher/first mate
Shannon, a professional researcher and editor, will accompany me as an assistant on the trip. She is already familiar with the Scoresby narrative and skilled in archival research (especially reading 19th-century handwriting!). Shannon will provide an extra brain to help maximize our brief time at the Whitby Museum.
THE BUDGET
Every dollar contributed to this campaign will go toward my research trip. I plan to travel lightly and cheaply using public transportation, inexpensive lodging and a lot of free Wi-Fi. Here is a breakdown of the estimated expenses:
Airfare: $1,400
Lodging: $450
Transportation in and between cities: $500
Car and driver hire for one day: $200
Pub fare and groceries: $550
Museum admissions and miscellaneous/unexpected expenses: $400
Indiegogo processing fees (approximate): $500
What happens if I get more than I ask for?
I will invest the extra money in further research and outreach efforts. One plan is to offer a multimedia lecture about my book at museums, libraries and schools. The extra money from the campaign will help defray the cost of travel.  
What happens if I get less than I ask for?
Your generous pledges will help me to travel for a longer period and visit more places in the U.K., but I’m prepared to fork over the remaining funds if needed.
TIMELINE
The research trip will be planned for February 2017. Naturally, it takes time for a book to go from research notes to manuscript to publication, and there are many steps along the way. I will continue to write the biography and the book proposal to secure the publishing deal. I’ve already had interest from a literary agent.
STAY IN TOUCH
Learn more about the project and get updates on Facebook, Twitter and my website, katlong.com.
FAQ
Questions? Just ask!
THANK YOU!

Route 57

Say hello to the twelfth edition and second print edition of Route 57! Students, alumni and staff from the University of Sheffield come together every year to bring you fantastic fiction, non-fiction, poetry and drama. All funds raised go straight back into making next year's issue. Last year we beat our funding target and this year the team are just as ambitious.


The Book

All editions of Route 57 are available online so our writers are accessible to all.

Get a print copy, however, and you’ll enjoy 220 pages of cutting-edge creative writing, typeset and designed by Swiss studio Go! Grafik. The Go! Grafik team have created a modern, minimalist aesthetic two years running, and have illustrated 10 select lines from the book with striking illustration. These original illustrations have been made into risograph postcards and posters, so you can spread the Route 57 marque far and wide.

This edition includes poetry about Sheffield geography and characters, but also features translated Iraqi and Spanish writers. Route 57 is becoming a global commentator while keeping its local inspirations at heart.

Perks include: risograph postcards, book bundles from established contributors and multiple copy discounts. 90% of the money raised from this campaign will go directly towards the design and print for the 2017 edition, with the remainder going to indiegogo and banking charges.



Spread the word

Our goal is to introduce poets, authors, dramatists and social commentators to a wider audience. Get a copy of issue 12 and you are ensuring that new writers are supported in Sheffield, with an exciting and attractive physical anthology. You don’t have to buy a copy to help out. Support our campaign by sharing this page on social media, or connect us with people in the advertising or arts scene in Sheffield. All interest is welcome!


Thank you for supporting Route 57!

This is our tenth birthday! Professor Adam Piette founded the journal in 2006 and has since handed the baton over to staff and students, many of whom are integral to the creative scene of the university, or gain crucial industry experience by bringing Route 57 to print. Previous issues are available to view here.

Also a big thank you to the poets and writers who have donated their books as perks for this campaign, and to all contributors to issue 12! Thanks also to Marianne Thurgood, Fionn Coughlan-Wills, Elizabeth Law, and Damian Woodall, the English MA students who have shaped and edited the publication.


Launch, postage and multiple copies

We will be launching the 2016 issue on 25th April with a reading in Jessop West, University of Sheffield, at 5pm. Everyone is welcome. If you can't attend, the book will be available from the foyer of Jessop West, and many many other venues throughout Sheffield. Don’t hesitate to email us if you have questions.


Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to help the campaign. Spread the word through social media and to people who might be interested. Remember: without your help in reaching our goal there will be no 2017 issue.

story:
Groomed looks at the unfortunate narrative of childhood sexual assault that is a reality for countless American children. The emotional book challenges readers to learn from the stories of survivors to create safer, more loving communities.

My name is Samantha Leonard and I am the author of Groomed. I wrote this book to connect with other sexual assault survivors and advocates for survivors and shed light on the issue of childhood sexual assault.

My hope is that by reading this book you will gain a new understanding of what childhood sexual assault means, the grooming process and how it effects survivors. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion that I have for changing the culture around sexual violence. Then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to educate readers on tangible ways to support themselves, our children and the survivors among our communities.

In this book, you'll learn about the sexual grooming process and ways to:

  • Speak with survivors

  • Spot the signs of sexual predator

  • Respond empathetically if someone discloses an assault to you

  • Prevent assault

You will love this book if you or someone you love has been effected by sexual violence or if you are interested in healing survivors and communities.

Groomed is a fictional book based on real stories that speaks to those effected by sexual violence and the #metoo movement who are interested in learning more about the status quo of childhood sexual assault and ways to be a catalyst for change.

The Book - Groomed

The book is written in 6 main parts that break down the grooming process used to manipulate children....

  • Part 1 describes how sexual groomers select victims. Here, I  begin to tell a fictional story based on real experiences of survivors and point out ways to minimize children's vulnerability to abuse.
  • Part 2 explains how sexual groomers gain victims' trust. This section continues to detail a fictional account that illustrate ways survivors trust is gained and concludes with red flags to look for in the adults that children interact with.
  • Part 3 looks at how sexual groomers fill need(s) for their victim(s) and shares how that process played a role in the fictional story of abuse shared. Here, I also list warning signs often seen in children who are already being abused.
  • Part 4 describes how sexual groomer's isolate victims in a fictional story.  The section sums up with some valuable lessons communities can learn from these stories.
  • Part 5 details how sexual groomers sexualize the relationship they have formed. It then offers a fictional narration of how survivors have experienced that progression. Part five also lists reasons why survivors do not come forward and how law enforcement can better respond to survivors.
  • Part 6 depicts how sexual groomers maintain control over their victims. Then, a story of how that control plays out for victims are introduced. Finally, I discuss empathetic ways to respond to survivors that disclose their assault to you.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Summer
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Samantha Leonard is a first time author and a student at University of Delaware.

She decided to write Groomed because of her passion for justice and the impact she hopes to make on the culture around sexual violence.

Outside of publishing, Samantha is also a Sexual Assault Advocate on University of Delaware's campus and is beginning a Master's of Social Work program this summer.

For more information you can connect with Samantha at leonards@udel.edu

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Groomed and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Samantha Leonard

story:
Love, Light, Joy & Justice: How To Be A Christian Now

When I was kicked out of my evangelical denomination for our stance on marriage equality and the full inclusion of our LGBTQ siblings and neighbors, I thought everything was over. Stripped of all our funding and support, lies and hate were spread by the very people that called us "church family." In my grief, I thought everything was over. But, as it turns out, our journey was just beginning... and in many ways, we received a preview of what would befall our country and churches with the election of Donald J. Trump as the 45th President. 

  • What does it mean to live out loud Jesus' call to Love amidst the division and violence of empire?
  • What does it mean to stand in the Light in a world full of lies?
  • How might we work through our grief and choose Joy?
  • What does it look like to seek social Justice when so much is stacked against all of us?

In my first book, I share my story as a way to illumine a path forward for all of us. It was really important for me to get this word out quickly, and in our own way, so that we could offer free e-book previews and discounted paperback editions in order to help as many friends as possible navigate these divisive, concerning times.

Kids separated from their families and locked in cages... white supremacy on the streets of Charlottesville and Portland, and thousands of lies on the regular on our airwaves and social media... all done in the name of God?

How are we to be a Christian now? This book offers a simple way to leave behind what I call Left Behind religion and help us return to the ancient, better way of Jesus - which has been hidden in plain site all along.

Help Launch This Book Today

In order to spread the word, I need key supporters and friends like you to help raise some important marketing funds.

Today I need your help:

  • Can you support my first book project by joining in with a pre-sale contribution? See the different perks available!
  • And, can you take another 30 seconds and share this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or email?

Let's do this!

By supporting this project you will help me get this project into the hands of the thousands of Christians who get in touch with me throughout the year with advice (and I hope some wisdom) on how to follow Jesus and "church" together now. Your contribution will help us help so many more.

story:
Summary

I’m Nancy G. Shapiro, an author, workshop leader, and Professional Certified Coach. My expertise is guiding people through the maze of personal and professional transitions.

On countless occasions, I have been witness to the resiliency of the human spirit, and the ripple effect of one person’s commitment, purpose, and calm presence in the world. This is the spirit that weaves throughout my new book, THE BOOK OF CALM: Clarity, Compassion, and Choice in a Turbulent World. 

We are not powerless. We are capable of a greatness of spirit and an immense humanitarian and planetary compassion with equally far-reaching solutions.  

THE BOOK OF CALM, to be published by She Writes Press on October 24, 2017, is my contribution for a better world. Your generosity will help pass calm forward in ways none of us can imagine—one person, one family, one community at a time.

Our Goal & Your Gift

The goal for this campaign is $8,000. The largest portion will cover publicity fees for an extensive online and print promotional campaign that will help spread the word about the book. The balance will go towards technical support to create an online class based on THE BOOK OF CALM; printing costs for publicity materials including copies of the book; award contest fees; and a possible audio version of the book. I will be continuously exploring ways for the book to find more readers; any suggestions you may have will be greatly appreciated.

The Book of Calm Perks: 

$25: A Little Bit of Calm—A signed copy of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmark. Book mailed at end of October.

$50: Wisdom + Calm—A signed copy of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmark, PLUS a PDF of the Found Words • Found Wisdom at-home writing workshop. Book mailed, and workshop PDF emailed at end of October.

$75: Coaching + Calm—A signed copy of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmark, PLUS a 30-minute coaching session. The coaching session is transferable to family or friends. Book mailed at end of October, and coaching is available after October.

$100: A Little More Coaching + Calm—A signed copy of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmark, PLUS a 60-minute coaching session. The coaching session is transferable to family or friends. Book mailed at end of October, and coaching is available after October.

$150: Wisdom, Calm, and Coaching—A signed copy of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmark, PLUS a 60-minute coaching session, PLUS a PDF of the Found Words • Found Wisdom at-home writing workshop. The coaching session is transferable to family or friends. Book mailed, and workshop PDF emailed at end of October. Coaching is available after October.

$200: Share the Calm with Your Club—Book Club Special: a signed copy of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmark—for up to eight (8) members—PLUS a Skype visit with the author to a club meeting. Books mailed at end of October.

$250: Calm, Cool, and Collectible—Two signed copies of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmark, PLUS an 8 x 10 B&W limited edition print, signed and ready for framing by photographer Barry Shapiro, PLUS a 60-minute coaching session. The coaching session is transferable to family or friends, and will be available after October. Books and photograph mailed at end of October.

$500: Super Calm, Cool, and Collectible— Four signed copies of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmarks, PLUS an 8 x 10 B&W limited edition print, signed and ready for framing by photographer Barry Shapiro, PLUS a 90-minute coaching session. The coaching session is transferable to family or friends, and will be available after October. Books and photograph mailed at end of October.

The Impact

The impact of THE BOOK OF CALM is partly expressed by early readers of the book and coaching client testimonials. Here are four endorsements and three client testimonials as examples of the awareness tools and overall message of the book; more can be seen on my website, where a sample chapter can be read (nancygshapiro.com).

“Here is a book as necessary for today as breath. Shapiro is a great storyteller, and she guides us out of the dark woods of fear, self-doubt, and powerlessness and into the calm within chaos—huge subjects that she masters in a personal way so the reader can definitely say, ‘I can do it.’” —Perie Longo, Santa Barbara Poet Laureate and author of Baggage Claim

In THE BOOK OF CALM, Nancy Shapiro elegantly interweaves personal experience with the hard-won wisdom of growth and transformation. These gracious offerings are shared through meaningful stories, research, insights, and images. This is a generous book, with a quiet yet unmistakable call to nurture your own soul. —Elizabeth Rosner, author of Survivor Café: The Legacy of Trauma and the Labyrinth of Memory

“Nancy pours her heart onto the page with creativity and power. You will be amazed how the energy and potency of her words move you.”  —Dr. Vivian A. Feintech, MFT, DMin

“Nancy shares universal truths told so openly and honestly for all to experience and grow from—each in their own way. THE BOOK OF CALM is like a lotus flower, opening up, layer by layer, always turning towards the light.” —Nina Snegg, Smoking Cessation Expert 

•  •  •  •  •

“With Nancy’s illuminative guidance and tools, I tapped into a compassionate empowerment around managing the pressures of my business. With thoughts organized, decisions reevaluated, and clearer communication, I reprioritized my family, work, and personal life.”  —Ed F., Artist/Product designer

“Nancy feels the pulse of what’s really going on beneath the surface—a rare gift. I find her ability to help me unravel a complex issue, interpret the clues and trust my own wisdom hugely valuable.” —Mary v. d. W., Branding Expert and Artist

“Nancy’s incredible ability to listen on all levels is what drew me back to each coaching session. I felt heard, I felt ‘felt’ and seen, and understood on all levels – a profoundly novel and healing experience during a difficult transition. I highly respect her, her practice and ethos.”  — Dana K., naturopath

Risks & Challenges

When you read THE BOOK OF CALM you will know I’ve met some big challenges in my own life. When my publishing team kept emphasizing the importance of quality publicity for a book to reach its widest audience, I knew that my new job was to help the book land in the hands and hearts of as many readers as possible. When I was at a loss as to how to even begin this campaign, trusted friends offered their help.

So I’ve stretched far beyond my writing self because I have absolute faith in THE BOOK OF CALM. Its words flowed through me and onto the page, sometimes with my prompting, oftentimes without. This book has demanded to be heard over nine long years—one can’t argue with something larger than one’s self.

Other Ways You Can Help

THE BOOK OF CALM speaks often of interconnectedness. I strongly believe in the power of word-of-mouth recommendations, and am grateful in advance for any recommendations of the book to friends and family (and strangers!). Your generosity, whether through a contribution, and/or sharing of this campaign link is equally appreciated, as are any suggestions you may have for reaching more readers.

If you have a favorite independent bookstore in your neighborhood, or a favorite librarian, please let them know about THE BOOK OF CALM: Clarity, Compassion, and Choice in a Turbulent World; my publisher is She Writes Press, and Ingram Publisher Services (IPS) is the book’s distributor.

I’m happy to have online discussions with book groups, or any other group that may benefit from more calm. Thank you for your support!

May calm be with you, each and every day!

Read a sample chapter, contact me, and find out more about my work and THE BOOK OF CALM at: http://www.nancygshapiro.com

The largest portion will cover publicity fees for an extensive online and print promotional campaign that will help spread the word about the book. The balance will go towards technical support to create an online class based on THE BOOK OF CALM; printing costs for publicity materials including copies of the book; award contest fees; and a possible audio version of the book. I will be continuously exploring ways for the book to find more readers; any suggestions you may have will be greatly appreciated.
The Book of Calm Perks: 
$25: A Little Bit of Calm—A signed copy of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmark. Book mailed at end of October.
$50: Wisdom + Calm—A signed copy of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmark, PLUS a PDF of the Found Words • Found Wisdom at-home writing workshop. Book mailed, and workshop PDF emailed at end of October.
$75: Coaching + Calm—A signed copy of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmark, PLUS a 30-minute coaching session. The coaching session is transferable to family or friends. Book mailed at end of October, and coaching is available after October.
$100: A Little More Coaching + Calm—A signed copy of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmark, PLUS a 60-minute coaching session. The coaching session is transferable to family or friends. Book mailed at end of October, and coaching is available after October.
$150: Wisdom, Calm, and Coaching—A signed copy of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmark, PLUS a 60-minute coaching session, PLUS a PDF of the Found Words • Found Wisdom at-home writing workshop. The coaching session is transferable to family or friends. Book mailed, and workshop PDF emailed at end of October. Coaching is available after October.
$200: Share the Calm with Your Club—Book Club Special: a signed copy of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmark—for up to eight (8) members—PLUS a Skype visit with the author to a club meeting. Books mailed at end of October.
$250: Calm, Cool, and Collectible—Two signed copies of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmark, PLUS an 8 x 10 B&W limited edition print, signed and ready for framing by photographer Barry Shapiro, PLUS a 60-minute coaching session. The coaching session is transferable to family or friends, and will be available after October. Books and photograph mailed at end of October.
$500: Super Calm, Cool, and Collectible— Four signed copies of THE BOOK OF CALM with bookmarks, PLUS an 8 x 10 B&W limited edition print, signed and ready for framing by photographer Barry Shapiro, PLUS a 90-minute coaching session. The coaching session is transferable to family or friends, and will be available after October. Books and photograph mailed at end of October.

The Impact
The impact of THE BOOK OF CALM is partly expressed by early readers of the book and coaching client testimonials. Here are four endorsements and three client testimonials as examples of the awareness tools and overall message of the book; more can be seen on my website, where a sample chapter can be read (nancygshapiro.com).
“Here is a book as necessary for today as breath. Shapiro is a great storyteller, and she guides us out of the dark woods of fear, self-doubt, and powerlessness and into the calm within chaos—huge subjects that she masters in a personal way so the reader can definitely say, ‘I can do it.’” —Perie Longo, Santa Barbara Poet Laureate and author of Baggage Claim
In THE BOOK OF CALM, Nancy Shapiro elegantly interweaves personal experience with the hard-won wisdom of growth and transformation. These gracious offerings are shared through meaningful stories, research, insights, and images. This is a generous book, with a quiet yet unmistakable call to nurture your own soul. —Elizabeth Rosner, author of Survivor Café: The Legacy of Trauma and the Labyrinth of Memory
“Nancy pours her heart onto the page with creativity and power. You will be amazed how the energy and potency of her words move you.”  —Dr. Vivian A. Feintech, MFT, DMin
“Nancy shares universal truths told so openly and honestly for all to experience and grow from—each in their own way. THE BOOK OF CALM is like a lotus flower, opening up, layer by layer, always turning towards the light.” —Nina Snegg, Smoking Cessation Expert 
•  •  •  •  •
“With Nancy’s illuminative guidance and tools, I tapped into a compassionate empowerment around managing the pressures of my business. With thoughts organized, decisions reevaluated, and clearer communication, I reprioritized my family, work, and personal life.”  —Ed F., Artist/Product designer
“Nancy feels the pulse of what’s really going on beneath the surface—a rare gift. I find her ability to help me unravel a complex issue, interpret the clues and trust my own wisdom hugely valuable.” —Mary v. d. W., Branding Expert and Artist
“Nancy’s incredible ability to listen on all levels is what drew me back to each coaching session. I felt heard, I felt ‘felt’ and seen, and understood on all levels – a profoundly novel and healing experience during a difficult transition. I highly respect her, her practice and ethos.”  — Dana K., naturopath

Risks & Challenges
When you read THE BOOK OF CALM you will know I’ve met some big challenges in my own life. When my publishing team kept emphasizing the importance of quality publicity for a book to reach its widest audience, I knew that my new job was to help the book land in the hands and hearts of as many readers as possible. When I was at a loss as to how to even begin this campaign, trusted friends offered their help.
So I’ve stretched far beyond my writing self because I have absolute faith in THE BOOK OF CALM. Its words flowed through me and onto the page, sometimes with my prompting, oftentimes without. This book has demanded to be heard over nine long years—one can’t argue with something larger than one’s self.

Other Ways You Can Help
THE BOOK OF CALM speaks often of interconnectedness. I strongly believe in the power of word-of-mouth recommendations, and am grateful in advance for any recommendations of the book to friends and family (and strangers!). Your generosity, whether through a contribution, and/or sharing of this campaign link is equally appreciated, as are any suggestions you may have for reaching more readers.
If you have a favorite independent bookstore in your neighborhood, or a favorite librarian, please let them know about THE BOOK OF CALM: Clarity, Compassion, and Choice in a Turbulent World; my publisher is She Writes Press, and Ingram Publisher Services (IPS) is the book’s distributor.
I’m happy to have online discussions with book groups, or any other group that may benefit from more calm. Thank you for your support!
May calm be with you, each and every day!
Read a sample chapter, contact me, and find out more about my work and THE BOOK OF CALM at: http://www.nancygshapiro.com

story:
Short Summary

I Found Jesus Through Anxiety and Depression is all about the mental health stigma in society and faith circles alike. It begins with my personal journey and experience with the societal view of mental health and ends with information on all the pieces I touch on in my personal experience.

My name is Kay Smeal and I am the author of I Found Jesus Through Anxiety and Depression. I wrote this book because I found the silence around mental health stigma to be deafening. My hope is that by sharing my story I am creating the space for others to share their own stories and experience.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that you are not alone in this battle with mental illness. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for breaking the stigma around mental health and building up community not barriers. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you find the confidence and beauty that is contained in your own story.

In this book, you'll learn about the mental health stigmas and the shame and blame that comes alongside each. You'll hear stories such as...

My first encounter informing the church that I was struggling with Anxiety and Depression.

Finding acceptance with my diagnosis and realizing I am not my diagnosis.

My experience in an inpatient facility and hope for those who seek help in this way.

You will love this book if you struggle with a mental illness diagnosis, or know someone who struggles, and are feeling alone in the community that surrounds you.

I Found Jesus Through Anxiety and Depression is a nonfiction book that speaks to mental health warriors and supporters of those who struggle who want to look at the mental health stigma and the consequences of harmful thoughts in a new way.

The Book - I Found Jesus Through Anxiety and Depression

IF BOOK IS DIVIDED INTO PARTS:

The book is written in 2 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters [1-5]. Through my personal experience with facing the mental health stigma in churches head on and battle with the stigma around mental health medication, the reader will learn there are others out there who are facing the same situations they are.

Part 2 contains chapters [6-11]. In This Part readers will find information and resources on various mental health diagnoses and what comes along with many diagnoses. I dive into topics on support systems, in-patient facilities, and much more.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

-The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.

-The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

-The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

-The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

-The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

About the Author

Kay Smeal is a current graduate student at Perkins School of Theology. She graduated from Messiah College in 2019. She is also the author of Anxious Devotions for Anxious Christians: A 30-Day Devotional.

Kay Smeal wrote this book because she found the silence around the mental health stigma to be deafening. Her hope is that by sharing her story she is creating the space for others to share their own stories and experiences.

When Kay is not in class or leading her youth group, she can be found blogging, napping, or curled up with a good book with my dog Hank. Her favorite animal is a sloth. And she can always be found with a colored pen.

For more information, you can connect with Kay Smeal at anxiousdevotions@gmail.com and at @Kay_Smeal_Author.
 

The Impact

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

-You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

-Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

-You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

-You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

-You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

-And much more!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #JesusADKay and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

story:
The Norwich Radical

We're a non-profit publication established for the purpose of providing progressive analysis of politics and the arts. We are a broad coalition of activists, writers, students and workers coming from an array of political backgrounds. We believe a better media is possible.

Spare Change for Change

In uncertain political times we must keep fighting for a progressive and independent media. We've done so since 2014. Thank you to those who have read and supported us this far. We do need some help though.

Every year our site comes up for renewal on its platform, Wordpress:

  • keeping it  ad-free & independent costs us £85 p/year
  • renewing our domain costs £15.

We are volunteer-run and non-profit. Any money you can give will help keep us going for another year and reduce the financial impact on our editorial team. Indiegogo's minimum goal for a crowdfunder is £500, but they release funds that don't make that target - so we are aiming for £100 to cover our costs this year.

Going Forward

Any funds we receive beyond £100 will pay-forward for years to come, to ensure The Norwich Radical can continue the work it does.

We are actively working to find avenues which will reduce the financial impact on our editorial team. This includes the possibility of registering as a co-operative and working towards offering readers the choice to become members.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially, please considering sharing our campaign anyway. Give it a shout on social media if you can!

story:
¡El libro sigue disponible!

Si no llegaste a pedir tu copia del libro, aún podes hacerlo. Elige la versión que más te guste del lado derecho de la pantalla y será tuya.


LA PARÁBOLA ES UNA SIMPLE HISTORIA QUE CONTIENE UNA PROFUNDA SABIDURÍA



Breve resumen

En esta campaña planeamos recolectar fondos para auto-editar el nuevo libro de Leandro Taub "Cuentos para la mente oculta". Los tres libros previos los hemos publicado con editoriales. Vivímos esa experiencia. Esta vez nosotros haremos el libro y te lo enviaremos directamente a tu hogar.


¿De qué se trata Cuentos para la mente oculta?

Cuentos para la mente oculta es una serie de más de 100 cuentos cortos, basados en parábolas clásicas. Cada cuento va acompañado por una interpretación. Son metáforas para elevar nuestra conciencia y darnos herramientas para mejorar nuestra vida y la de nuestro mundo. 

Habrán dos ediciones del libro:

  • La edición simple está compuesta únicamente por los textos.

  • La edición ilustrada incluye un dibujo junto a cada cuento, realizada por el artista Javier Delfino.


Beneficios especiales por adquirir el libro a través de Indiegogo
Quienes adquieran el libro por Indiegogo contarán con algunos beneficios especiales:

  • Estarán en los agradecimientos del libro (este beneficio ya no está disponible).

  • El precio que pagarán por el libro será menor al precio de venta público.

  • y... recibirán recompensas especiales por apoyarnos (a continuación).


¡Hay recompensas especiales!

Como recompensa por adquirir el libro Cuentos para la mente oculta a través de Indigogo puedes recibir: 

  • Tener una sesión individual con Leandro (en persona o por Skype).
  • Recibir un dibujo original del artista Javier Delfino.


¡Hay libros para todos!

Sabemos que no todos tienen el dinero para comprar el libro. Por eso estará también disponible la versión e-book del libro, a un precio económico y accesible para todos. Así que, quien no tenga el libro físico, al menos puede tenerlo en pdf para leerlo en su e-book, en su computadora o en su celular. 


¿A dónde va el dinero recaudado?
Con el dinero recaudado vamos a financiar la edición del libro que consiste en corrección ortotipográfica, corrección de estilo, diseño editorial, corrección editorial, diseño de portada-solapas-contratapa, diseño de interiores, maquetación y el proceso de impresión. La cantidad de libros que imprimiremos dependerá de la cantidad de libros pre-vendidos más los libros que esperamos distribuir una vez finalizada la campaña de Indiegogo.


¿Cuál es nuestro sueño? 


El Equipo


¿Quién es Leandro Taub?

Leandro Taub (1983, Argentina) es un artista multidisciplinario y futurista que trabaja para unir y completar al mundo. Lo hace a través de servicio y aprendizaje diario, visto como protección y mejora. Leandro investiga ¿Quien somos? ¿Cuál es el motivo que nos trajo? ¿Para qué? ¿Qué es esta vida? ¿Cómo funcionan los vehículos que estamos utilizando? entre otras preguntas acerca de nuestra existencia.Se ha desempeñado como escritor, actor, director, productor, conductor, conferencista, músico y dibujante, entre otras disciplinas. Entre sus obras se destacan los libros La mente oculta, Santo Diablo y Sabiduría Casera. Ha recorrido mas de treinta países en su búsqueda y estudio, escribe diariamente para medio millón de personas a través de sus páginas en Twitter, Facebook, Instagram y YouTube, y lleva mas de 20.000 libros vendidos en tres lenguas y trece países. Ha sido citado y entrevistado por cientos de diarios, revistas, programas de televisión y programas de radio de Argentina, Chile, Colombia, Venezuela, Uruguay, Bolivia, Peru, El Salvador, Mexico y España por su filosofía y forma utópica de vivir. Actualmente reside entre Jerusalem, Los Angeles, Berlin y Buenos Aires.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Te pedimos por favor que difundas esta campaña. Ayúdanos a que llegue a la mayor cantidad de personas posibles. ¡Logremos que genere ecos! Compártelo en Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Tumblr, email. 
Apreciamos tu ayuda. 


¡HAY CONCURSO DE REFERENCIAS!

¿Cómo funciona? Muy simple: debes estar logueada/o en indiegogo, entrar a la página de Cuentos para la mente oculta y compartir la campaña en tus redes sociales desde los botones que aparecen a la derecha: Facebook, Twitter, email o directamente puedes copiar el link. Indiegogo guarda la información de referencias de cada uno y nos informa cuántos aportes llegan desde cada link compartido. Con esta información podremos darte premios extra.

Cada $ 100 que alcances con referidos te contactaremos para actualizar tu crédito. Recuerda compartir la campaña siempre logueada/o en tu cuenta de Indiegogo, desde el sitio de Cuentos para la mente oculta, para que tus referidos se incluyan dentro de las estadísticas. Con el total de aportes generados a través tuyo podrás decidir cómo queres canjear ese crédito en recompensas.


¡GRACIAS!
