Te pedimos por favor que difundas esta campaña. Ayúdanos a que llegue a la mayor cantidad de personas posibles. ¡Logremos que genere ecos! Compártelo en Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Tumblr, email. Apreciamos tu ayuda. 






¡HAY CONCURSO DE REFERENCIAS!
¿Cómo funciona? Muy simple: debes estar logueada/o en indiegogo, entrar a la página de Cuentos para la mente oculta y compartir la campaña en tus redes sociales desde los botones que aparecen a la derecha: Facebook, Twitter, email o directamente puedes copiar el link. Indiegogo guarda la información de referencias de cada uno y nos informa cuántos aportes llegan desde cada link compartido. Con esta información podremos darte premios extra.

Cada $ 100 que alcances con referidos te contactaremos para actualizar tu crédito. Recuerda compartir la campaña siempre logueada/o en tu cuenta de Indiegogo, desde el sitio de Cuentos para la mente oculta, para que tus referidos se incluyan dentro de las estadísticas. Con el total de aportes generados a través tuyo podrás decidir cómo queres canjear ese crédito en recompensas.


¡GRACIAS!

story:
La Novela

Tres personas están a punto de librar una entrañable confrontación luego de que la policía haya descubierto una serie de cadáveres brutalmente mutilados. Una busca la inexorable relación entre el asesino y los cuerpos encontrados. La segunda se ve inmersa en una lucha interior entre proteger al amor de su vida, por un lado, o seguir su propia brújula moral y delatar el crimen que guarda como un secreto que le quema las entrañas, por el otro. La tercera trata a toda costa enterrar hasta el último resquicio de aquello que condujo a su vida a un terrible punto de inflexión y a un laberinto de dolor que parecía no tener final… hasta ahora.

El Autor

Marcos David González Fernández (México 1979) es autor de la novela La sombra del sicario (2017).  Psicólogo de profesión y Máster en Evaluación y Medida de la Conducta, ha prestado sus servicios profesionales en la Procuraduría General de Justicia del Estado en el Departamento de Atención a Víctimas del Delito. También ha sido colaborador en revistas como The Fiction Review en su décima edición con un artículo titulado «La psicología del sicario y la narco-narrativa» (2018), y en La Redacción (2019).
            Ahora está de vuelta con Muerte en el crepúsculo, una novela negra que no debes dejar pasar.

Una Muestra

«Faltaba una hora para que dieran las 18.00.
          La luz del día comenzaba a languidecer lentamente, como si por momentos todavía se aferrara a las cosas y se abrazara de sus formas arrastrándose tortuosamente hacia el horizonte, deformando las sombras en las calles, en los muros, en los sitios en los que estas se proyectaban cada vez más tenues. Olivia estaba sentada en un asiento del metro.
          El metro era infalible.
          La manera de camuflarse en un vagón rebosante de gente no tenía parangón con ningún otro medio de transporte. Ella miraba el paisaje de edificios y casas por las que la vía del metro se abría paso por momentos antes de volverse a ocultar bajo tierra, en los dominios subterráneos.
          Podía sentir dentro de su bolso el peso del arma con la que haría justicia. Sintió ganas de introducir la mano y apretar la ergonómica cacha. También llevaba una mochila con un disco de acetato. No se trataba de un cantautor de su preferencia musical, pero había crecido escuchando su música. Era parte de un pasado enterrado bajo capas y capas de nostalgia por tiempos mejores, antes de que todo se torciera y se echara a perder. Debía llegar por lo menos media hora más temprano que el señor Federico, profesor de historia, y hacer los arreglos necesarios.
           Conforme se acercaba al lugar indicado pequeñas inyecciones de adrenalina fueron secretadas por su páncreas, abriendo aún más el océano de sus propias expectativas en su cabeza. Todo debía salir según el plan: entrar, esperar a su presa, ver en sus ojos un genuina sorpresa al encontrarse sin ninguna opción que no fuera la de entregar su aliento y salir tal como había llegado.
           El altoparlante del vagón del metro anunció la escala que ella estaba deseando escuchar y segundos después el metro fue perdiendo velocidad hasta detenerse por completo. Ella se levantó de su asiento y apretó contra sí el bolso y la mochila. No quería que algún ladronzuelo le arrebatara la posibilidad de materializar un sueño que había tenido desde hacía casi diez años, porque en el metro nunca faltaban los ladrones y carteristas que buscaban algo de dinero fácil.
          Ese era el único riesgo de viajar en metro pero era un riesgo que tenía que correr para perderse en el ingente mar de personas que usaban aquel medio para transportarse; para ir a sus trabajos; para volver a sus hogares junto a sus seres queridos de forma rápida; para descansar y esperar el nuevo día; ¡el nuevo amanecer!
          Olivia salió del vagón e inmediatamente fue tragada por una multitud de personas que bajaron del mismo vagón para salir de la estación, rumbo a sus destinos. Así, ella también estaba a punto de encontrarse con un destino que había nacido hacía tanto tiempo y que le había cambiado la vida por completo sin que nada pudiera hacer al respecto.
          Hasta ahora».

El Objetivo

En esta campaña preventa nos hemos propuesto alcanzar el equivalente a 55 reservas, es decir, 880€, recibiendo quienes participen el libro en su casa sin gastos de envío (en España) antes de que entre en circulación... existiendo incluso la opción de reservar el libro con tu nombre en los agradecimientos por un poco más del precio de venta, como detalle exclusivo.

También, usando la opción BACK IT, podéis realizar donaciones a la edición; opción a través de la cual no se os pedirá dirección de envío porque no conlleva contraprestación de ningún tipo.

Media

Por otro lado, independientemente de que colaboréis realizando vuestra reserva o no, en ocasiones no se puede, sería una inestimable ayuda que os hicieseis eco de esta campaña a través del boca-oreja o por redes sociales... la Cultura, Distrito 93 y Marcos David González  Fernández os lo agradeceremos.

story:
Milestones: 

  1. Partnering with USC Gould School of Law's Small Business Clinic to donate 50% of all book royalties after publication to help small businesses in Los Angeles get through COVID 
  2. "Underdog" will be featured in USC Law Magazine's Spring edition (confirmed by USC Gould's communications office)
  3. 100% of Underdog book royalties will go to USC-affiliated organizations.
  4. Earned over 10 endorsements from USC Gould School of Law and USC Marshall School of Business faculty, staff, alumni and professors. 
  5. Reached $3000 (60%) of contributions toward Underdog's publication goal of $5000! 
  6. Reached $4000 (80%) of contributions toward Underdog's publication goal of $5000! 
  7. Reached $4500 (90%) of contributions toward Underdog's publication goal of $5000! 

 

Upcoming Events:

  • Planned book talk at Goizueta Business School during Professor Benn Konsynski's class (date TBD)
  • Planned book talk at The Shipley School about my publication journey and inspiration behind the book (Fall 2020)

 

When I raise $5,000 (i.e. 130 signed copy pre-orders), I will publish my book as a Softcover & Digital Ebook. The sum will go toward my Cover Design, Copy-Editing & Proofreading, Layout Production, and Marketing Costs, as well as the books I will sign and ship to you when I publish! 

 

 

Story of My Book

Underdog: 12 Inspirational Stories for the Despondent Law Student is my story as a law student at the University of Southern California (USC) who was on the verge of dropping out of the JD program after 1L year. The book is a compilation of interviews with 12 gritty lawyers, classmates, professors, and close friends whose stories inspired me to continue my legal education.

My name is Jesse Wang, and I am the author of Underdog. I wrote this book because after my first year in law school, I felt completely lost and defeated. I was told continually by professors and career counselors that my GPA was not competitive and that I had to rethink my career aspirations as an aspiring attorney.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that grades are never the end all be all. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to realize that creative thinking, resilience, and grit are, in fact, the most important factors to attaining success both professionally and personally. I learned these incredible lessons through the help of several colleagues, mentors, and legal technology startup founders who encouraged me to keep pushing and to never shy away from an opportunity because of a number on my transcript.

Underdog tells the stories of twelve people, including law students, professors, and attorneys, who faced incredible adversity throughout their lives, but were able to persevere using their grit and creative thinking. This includes the story of a Big Law associate who, after years of feeling overworked and burnt out, decided to establish their own company. It includes the story of a technical writer who, after experiencing an intense bout of depression after getting fired from his dream job, was able to find solace in creative writing, which landed him a job at Google. It also includes my own story: how I—after coping with a seemingly endless barrage of defeats and failures throughout my 1L  year—was able to summon the inner strength to continue my legal education and persevere.

 



For anyone out there who is feeling lost, desperate, or hopeless, I hope this book brings you comfort and faith in yourself because we will push through, we will find a way, and we will succeed. We might be the Underdogs, but it’s never over until we say it is.

You will love this book if you’ve ever been told that your chances at having a successful career were truncated due to a low grade point average, if you’ve ever felt lost in whatever academic program you decided to pursue because you thought everyone else was too smart, or if you’ve ever shied away from applying for your dream job or starting your own company because you were afraid of failure or that others would ridicule you. This story is for the underdogs who lost faith in themselves somewhere along the way because someone—a professor, counselor, or parent—told them that they weren’t enough—that they should give up and try something else. If you fall into any of these categories, I know this book will speak to you.

Underdog speaks to the despondent law students who came out of their first year of law school with grades that didn’t match how hard they worked or how intelligent they are. It speaks to those who want to grapple with the relationship between long-term career success and the grades they receive in school in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Underdog inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What's stopping me from applying to the job of my dreams?
  • Are the people who make it to the top really only those who graduated first in their class? 
  • Are law firms really only looking at grades and nothing else?
  • If I don't perform well my first year of law school, what are my options?

 

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing grit, resilience, and creative thinking will change us all for the better.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go toward the following:

 

 

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are placeholders!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. When I publish, you will receive the following:

  • A personally signed copy of my book
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book
  • And more...

I'm also pledging all royalties earned from book sales after Underdog's publication to go toward the Barbara F. Bice Public Interest Law Foundation. For more information on Gould's commitment to public interest causes, click here. 

About the Author

Jesse Wang is a JD/MBA candidate at the University of Southern California (USC). He wrote this book, because he wanted to learn from colleagues who had experienced hardships early on in their careers and what attributes they possessed that allowed them to ultimately find success. He was curious, in particular, about what actionable steps he could take as a law student with below-median grades to find success in an ever-growing and increasingly competitive profession.

Growing up, he never considered himself the smartest kid in the class. In grade school, he tried testing into the “gifted” class six times and failed every time. But he still made it all the way to law school, and attributes that largely to his support network, resourcefulness, and creativity. Much of Jesse's inspiration for this book draws from the research of Angela Duckworth, Jordan Peterson, and Nassim Taleb.

For more information, you can connect with Jesse at:

jcwang@usc.edu and

Twitter: @wangesque

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #Underdog and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

 

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jesse Wang

story:
Who We Are and What We Are Doing

Marshay Artrell Mitchell is an artist, poet, model and world traveler. She is moved by the impact her poetry and art has on others. For her, creating and sharing poetry is an honor and a joy because she wants to create an experience that is uplifting and enjoyable for those reading her poems, observing her art or listening to her read her stories. Through poetry, Marshay often feels like a storyteller, a student, a teacher, and an uplifter!  Click here to learn more about Marshay.

Kris Parfitt Travers is a writer, artist, traveler and founder of Story Launch Media. Her purpose in life is to generate a tsunami of inspiration where all people experience their greatness being expressed and acknowledged, and for them to inspire the greatness in others being expressed and acknowledged.

She and Marshay have similar desires to create extraordinary experiences through the written and spoken word that inspire others to be uplifted. Click here to learn more about Story Launch Media.

Marshay has wanted to publish a book of her poetry and Kris wants to publish books of stories, poetry and art. It's a perfect partnership - these two women are intentionally cultivating inspiration through Marshay's book of poetry.

They are inviting their communities to support the project by pre-purchasing a book -  or two, or more - to help raise the funds necessary to create, print and publish this project.

What We Need and What You Get

We are crowdfunding for $3025. This amount will be used to support the cost of creating, printing and publishing a first-run print of approximately 400 books. 

Knowing there will be fees and taxes associated with crowdfunding, we are asking for more than we need to print 400 books. We hope that those supporting this project understand this need and will still contribute to the cost of the project.

The impact of your funding will be four-fold!

  - Marshay will be a published poet!

  - Story Launch Media will have published its first book!

  - Our community members will know that they supported a creative gift that will uplift thousands of people!

   - And you will be the first to receive this accomplishment before it is picked up by bookstores and offered for sale on Amazon!

We know everyone has a price for what they will pay for something extraordinary! So we have come up with incentives for people to pre-order a book.

The cost of one book and having it mailed to you will be $25. Our incentives start there and go up to $100. Incentives include a personalized note in the front of the book signed by Marshay!

Or for $5 more you can have your name mentioned in the acknowledgements shared in back of the book.

For even $5 more you can have all the above PLUS be invited to the pre-launch party!

And for a bit more extra you can receive more book amounts to give as gifts.

The final package offers the experience of being an Intentional Cultivator* for the project and having your name listed as such in the first few pages of the book!

*We define an Intentional Cultivator as someone who purposefully applies oneself to developing an exceptional person or thing.

You are welcome to pay more than $100 if you would like to support the project!

We also respect that some people aren't able to contribute financially, but can contribute time or effort! We would greatly appreciate the efforts of sharing this campaign with your own communities, or finding a place for Marshay to read her poetry before or after the book launches. And so much more!

Please contact Kris at hello@storylaunchmedia.com for details.

INCENTIVES

Pay $25 and you will receive a book mailed to you once it is released. This cost  pays for the retail price of the book and the cost of the postage to ship the book to you. The additional $3 fee that will be tacked-on at check-out is the handling and shipping supplies cost.

Pay $30 and you will receive a personally signed book mailed to you once it is released.

Pay $35 and you will receive a personally signed book mailed to you once it is released and your name will be also mentioned in the acknowledgements at the back of the book.

Pay $40 and you will receive a personally signed book mailed to you once it is released, your name mentioned in the acknowledgements and an invitation to attend the pre-launch book party.

Pay $50 and you will receive two books personally signed and mailed to you once they are released, your name mentioned in the acknowledgements and an invitation to attend the pre-launch book party. This cost  pays for the retail price of the books and the cost of the postage to ship the books to you. The additional $5 fee that will be tacked-on at check-out is the handling and shipping supplies cost.

Pay $75 and you will receive three books personally signed and mailed to you once they are released, your name mentioned in the acknowledgements and an invitation to attend the pre-launch book party. This cost  pays for the retail price of the books and the cost of the postage to ship the books to you. The additional $5 fee that will be tacked-on at check-out is the handling and shipping supplies cost.

Pay $100 and you will receive four books personally signed and mailed to you once they are released, your name mentioned in the acknowledgements and an invitation to attend the pre-launch book party AND your name will be listed as an Intentional Cultivator* in the first few pages of the book.This cost  pays for the retail price of the books and the cost of the postage to ship the books to you. The additional $5 fee that will be tacked-on at check-out is the handling and shipping supplies cost.

Pay $500 and Marshay will create and customize a poem especially for you, or a loved one, or for a special occasion. Plus, you will receive five books personally signed and mailed to you once they are released, your name mentioned in the acknowledgements and an invitation to attend the pre-launch book party, and your name also listed as an Intentional Cultivator* in the first few pages of the book. This cost  pays for the retail price of the books and the cost of the postage to ship the books to you. The additional $5 fee that will be tacked-on at check-out is the handling and shipping supplies cost.

*We define an Intentional Cultivator as someone who purposefully applies oneself to developing an exceptional person or thing.

Marshay, Kris and Story Launch Media are so very thankful, appreciative and in awe of the power of our communities. Thank you so much for considering supporting this milestone accomplishment!

story:
Je suis Hubert Jadotte. Juriste. Ancien inspecteur de Police. Un passionné de lecture et d'écriture. Un auteur qui s'annonce prolifique vu les œuvres existantes et des publications éparses. Ma publication la plus récente est éditée chez Edilivre France ; elle s’intitule La lune est une île, poésie disponible sur Amazon. Mes œuvres varient en des essais en sciences sociales, en littérature, etc. et abondantes en poésie.

Mon projet consiste en la publication de l'important ouvrage titré Police, Justice et Sécurité publique en Haïti / Comment désarmer l'insécurité? Il s'agit d'un essai de 372 pages sur la sécurité policière, judiciaire et sociétale. Le livre postule pour un type de citoyen qui prend son pays, son avenir et celui de ses enfants très au sérieux et qui incite l'Etat par le biais de son gouvernement à devenir un agent régulateur actif, réactif et proactif conformément aux aspirations de la population, grâce à une nouvelle méthode de vigilance vers la responsabilisation. 

La campagne est un appel vibrant à l'appui de la publication du livre. Notre constat révèle que la sécurité au XXIe siècle devient une valeur globalisante. Le monde en fait n'est autre qu'un village où les hommes se déplacent incessamment. Mais quand c'est l'insécurité qui fait la loi dans n'importe quel pays de la planète, la menace concerne, qu'on le veuille ou non toute la population mondiale active. D'où soi-même, ses amis ou ses proches ne sont nullement exempts. C'est pourquoi, j'exhorte tous à supporter spontanément les initiatives visant à désarmer les insécurités, et en l’occurrence la présente campagne. Je dis les insécurités dans le sens de la délinquance, la pauvreté, le chômage, la faim, la corruption, etc. 

Cette publication sera pour moi un vrai tremplin au point de vue de notoriété. Cela va être l'essence nécessaire au décollage de l'engin. Ce sera pour mon pays un outil qui jouera un rôle majeur dans son relèvement dans la mesure qu'elle trouverait la presse suffisante. Cette contrée d'une curiosité étonnante. Curiosité même pour moi qui suis natif de cette terre. Venir en aide à ce projet c'est participer à la concrétisation de plusieurs rêves à la fois et mieux encore des rêves grandioses. 

Fort de cela, les contributeurs et les contributrices à cette campagne partent en champion. Champion d'une cause noble, juste et passionnante. Soyez enthousiastes et généreux. Des contributions désintéressées peuvent parfois se révéler des garanties pour les intérêts communs.

Les fonds recherchés pour cette campagne s'élèvent 5700 dollars américains répartis comme suit : $4000 pour l'impression de 1000 exemplaires du livre. $ 1700 pour les opérations de la publication, à savoir des tournées de conférences-débats et vente-signature à travers les principales villes du pays, dont Port-au-Prince, Cap-Haitien, Gonaïves, Port-de-Paix, Jacmel et Cayes, pour les frais de voyage, d'hôtels, consommation.  A raison de deux soirées par ville, excepté (concernant les frais de séjour) Port-au-Prince et Port-de-Paix, respectivement ville de résidence et ville d'origine de l'auteur. Y compris la couverture médiatique tant locale que nationale.

Il sera, on ne peut plus, fascinant pour moi de débattre avec cœur sur les perspectives de voir mon pays parvenir à atteindre un seuil de sécurité qui attirera même les personnes les plus précautionnées à venir visiter un jour ou un autre ce joyau tellement maltraité. Et aussi prendre de manière irréversible le chemin de la stabilité, de la confiance, du développement, et une destination alléchante et heureuse pour le monde entier. Du vrai bonheur!

 

Au cas où cette campagne n'atteindrait pas l'objectif poursuivi, les fonds recueillis seront déposés dans un compte spécial, en attendant la remobilisation d'autres fonds complémentaires. Puisque même la nature dans son aspect peu clémente ne tolérerait pas qu'un pareil ouvrage reste dans les tiroirs. Lorsque l'objectif ultime de remobilisation sera atteint, une nouvelle campagne restitutrice à ce moment-là sera lancée en vue d'honorer toutes nos promesses de contreparties. Ce qui confirmera qu' « il n'est jamais trop tard pour bien faire »!

 

C'est une évidence, dans ce monde globalisé aucun effort pour la sécurité générale n'est personnelle à un Etat ou à un peuple, même si des grands de ce monde viendraient en désaveu. Donc tout contributeur, même si on ne sent à l'instant même la nécessite d'adhérer se dira l'instant plus tard, cela vaut la peine de contribuer à cet intéressant projet. 

Pour moi qui attends le moindre vent pour s'impulser et ce pays situé en plein cœur de l'Amérique centrale pour se renaître, du coup une valeur-ajoutée mondiale. Quel que soit le chantier, il faut commencer par la base! Et voila, vous avez devant maintenant une bonne base : versez-y votre pierre. Elle me sera précieuse ! Etant sédentaire en Haïti, et commencé par être édité en France, est déjà une bonne chose. Soutenez donc la bonté et la beauté et ce sera pour vous l'arroseur arrosé! 

Cette campagne qui permettra l'impression de 1000 exemplaires, sera le tout début du succès de ce livre. D'autant que c'est le minimum qu'une imprimerie réalise. L'argent de cette première impression facilitera d'autres impressions du livre, selon l'engouement des lecteurs et bien d'autres publications de label Hubert Jadotte, votre serviteur. Ce sera cela le tremplin, grâce à toutes ces précieuses empreintes : les vôtres chers contributeurs et contributrices!

 

Il existe toujours des risques. J'en ai réfléchi mûrement moi et mon équipe que je salue très chaudement. Cependant, l'ouvrage est très très vendable et même alléchant. Mon graphiste a déjà prévu un best seller au niveau local. Mon plus grand risque en effet, c'est celui de ne pas atteindre l'objectif de la campagne. Mais là encore, je serais plus proche du but, car il me sera plus facile de dire à des proches et des amis ou institution : écoutez, pour la publication de "Comment désarmer l'insécurité ?"  je dispose de x montant recueillis de la générosité des « Indiegoguistes ». Qu'est-ce qu'on peut apporter à titre de contribution en vue d'arriver au but ?

 

Chers amis, il n'y a pas moyen de ne pas pouvoir aider à cette campagne. Aidez-moi s'il vous plait, surtout ceux-là qui pour l'instant sont incapables de contribuer financièrement, à la partager au max. C'est aussi une précieuse participation à sa réussite. Faites du bruit autour de vous sur la campagne. Et d'une façon ou d'une autre, je vous remercie déjà chaleureusement. Cette formidable plateforme hors du commun, extraordinaire qu'est Indiegogo détient comme vous le connaissez autant que moi des puissants outils à cet effet. Utilisez-les en m'aidant à partager au maximum cette campagne pour sa réussite. Réussite qui sera aussi vôtre. Car, il n’y a pas de bienfait dont le bienfaiteur ne bénéficie d’une bénédiction de Dieu. J'en suis d'ores et déjà très reconnaissant à votre auguste égard. A très bientôt !

story:
Our Story

We published our first print issue in March 2010 under the moniker "Asterisk San Francisco," a bi-monthly, 64-page square format free publication distributed exclusively in SF. For years, we focused on the city's inspiring culture from small mom & pop businesses to emerging artists and iconic communities.

We told hundreds of stories with sustainability, community, and compassion at heart. In 2013, we took on a new format and name; The New Asterisk. Our new quarterly magazine was sold in bookstores and newsstands nationwide and internationally in 14 countries; telling more stories beyond our 49 square mile borders. As we scaled, our approach to storytelling remained unchanged. We've been lucky to have such a supportive community of writers, photographers, creatives, and readers, to whom we are deeply grateful.

We hope to continue our journey with you! Whether you're a first time reader or a long time lover, welcome to The New Asterisk family.

 

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT!

Once we reach our goal, we'll be able to work on our follow up issue, pay our contributors and start planning for our next publication year. 

Surpassing our goal will allow us to have the best Live Magazine Event later in the year with commissioned works from artists in a range of disciplines, activating our creative community in the Bay Area. 

We ship worldwide! Get the new issue on your coffee tables by mid-August. 

 

ISSUE XI - Happiness

We started putting together this issue back in 2016. Happiness was scarce and it seemed to be getting worse every day with depressing news cycles and social media dragging people's emotions. After much contemplation, we had to freeze the issue while our community worked on the changing face of our collective existence in these trying times. Now, more than ever, we need a reminder of our optimistic vision for the future. Let us uplift our community, spread love, and work hard to create a just world in the spirit of San Francisco. A world of acceptance, equality, compassion, and creativity. To us, this is the essence of San Francisco.

Join us on our journey to craft a better future, together!

issue highlights

Pursuing Perfection - Essays

Butt Photography - Essay

Explore: Catalina Island

Artist Features: Carissa Potter + Keith Magruder

Navigating Happiness

Peacocking

Cactus Kitchen

Laughing with Chey Bell

Music Feature: Abbot Kinney

Explore: Cambodia / Vietnam

 

PERKS & MORE

Our goal with this campaign is to activate our readership and reach new people as we go Bi-Annual with the start of Issue XI. Here are some perks we hope you'll love:

  • Asterisk Fan $35 - Get the new issue - XI  Happiness 
  • Asterisk Supporter $60 - Get the new issue - XI  Happiness and Asterisk Enamel Pin + Flexi*
  • Asterisk Lover $110 - Get the new issue - XI  Happiness, Asterisk Enamel Pin + Flexi and 12 Issues of The New Asterisk Leaf**
  • all perks will be mailed mid-August 2018. Leaf will be mailed monthly from August 15.

Get an exclusive Asterisk Enamel Pin with your issue! Instantly become a member of the Asterisk Club, where you'll get exclusive announcements, previews, deals on events, products, community partnerships, and more. Plus, you'll get free entry to our next Live Magazine Event (a $35 value).

**Introducing The New Asterisk LEAF. Our Story
We published our first print issue in March 2010 under the moniker "Asterisk San Francisco," a bi-monthly, 64-page square format free publication distributed exclusively in SF. For years, we focused on the city's inspiring culture from small mom & pop businesses to emerging artists and iconic communities.
We told hundreds of stories with sustainability, community, and compassion at heart. In 2013, we took on a new format and name; The New Asterisk. Our new quarterly magazine was sold in bookstores and newsstands nationwide and internationally in 14 countries; telling more stories beyond our 49 square mile borders. As we scaled, our approach to storytelling remained unchanged. We've been lucky to have such a supportive community of writers, photographers, creatives, and readers, to whom we are deeply grateful.
We hope to continue our journey with you! Whether you're a first time reader or a long time lover, welcome to The New Asterisk family.
 

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT!
Once we reach our goal, we'll be able to work on our follow up issue, pay our contributors and start planning for our next publication year. 
Surpassing our goal will allow us to have the best Live Magazine Event later in the year with commissioned works from artists in a range of disciplines, activating our creative community in the Bay Area. 
We ship worldwide! Get the new issue on your coffee tables by mid-August. 
 
ISSUE XI - Happiness
We started putting together this issue back in 2016. Happiness was scarce and it seemed to be getting worse every day with depressing news cycles and social media dragging people's emotions. After much contemplation, we had to freeze the issue while our community worked on the changing face of our collective existence in these trying times. Now, more than ever, we need a reminder of our optimistic vision for the future. Let us uplift our community, spread love, and work hard to create a just world in the spirit of San Francisco. A world of acceptance, equality, compassion, and creativity. To us, this is the essence of San Francisco.
Join us on our journey to craft a better future, together!

story:
Hallo! Ich bin Nilpferdson,

das erste Nilpferd der Welt. Vor langer Zeit erblickte ich in Ägypten das Licht der Welt. Als ich alt genug dafür war, begab ich mich auf eine Weltreise und lernte andere Tiere kennen.

Weil ich mit meinen dicken Füßen so schlecht schreiben kann, hat Niklas mir geholfen meine Erlebnisse niederzuschreiben und zu einem Buch zusammenzufassen. Er begleitet mich schon seit meiner Geburt.

Und weißt du, damals gab es noch keine Kameras. Daher musste ich mir alles, was ich erlebt hatte, merken. Allerdings verhält es sich mit dem Malen und Zeichnen wie mit dem Schreiben: meine Füße sind einfach nicht dafür gemacht. Daher hat mir Verena Geiger (www.verenageiger.de) geholfen, meine Erinnerung zu verbildlichen.

Dieses Buch, in das ich viel Zeit und Arbeit gesteckt habe, möchte ich euch gerne vorstellen. Es gibt da nur einen kleinen Haken. Da ich den ganzen Tag schwimme, esse, reise und mit meinem besten Freund Erdmannson in alten Zeiten schwelge, habe ich leider keine Geldbörse. Selbst wenn ich eine hätte, wäre da nichts drin. Glücklicherweise konnte ich mit der Hilfe von vielen Unterstützern den Druck Finanzieren. Das heißt du kannst dir jetzt schon das Buch reservieren. Im November wird es versandt und dann hast du ein passendes Weihnachtsgeschenk für viele Kinder! (Mehr dazu erfährst du weiter unten)

Aber ich möchte Euch natürlich nicht den Nils im Sack verkaufen (wie man bei uns so schön sagt), hier ist eine kleine Leseprobe:

"Alles begann in Ägypten, einem weit entfernten Land:

Vor langer, langer Zeit lebten einmal zwei verfeindete Familien an dem Fluss Nil. Die Familie der Nilse und die Familie der Pferde. Warum die beiden sich bis aufs Haar nicht leiden konnten, wusste niemand so genau. Der Grund dafür war noch viel älter als die Geschichte selbst. Zu jener Zeit verliebten sich eine wunderschöne Dame der Pferde und ein stattlicher Mann der Nilse ineinander. Die beiden kümmerten sich wenig um die Feindschaft ihrer beiden Familien. Denn miteinander waren sie sehr glücklich. Nach einiger Zeit erfüllte sich auch ihr innigster Wunsch. Sie bekamen ein Kind. Das erste Nilpferd, wie wir es heute kennen. Sie nannten es Nilpferdson."

Und so geht es weiter: www.nilpferdson.de/leseprobe

Das Projekt

Seit vielen Jahren sind Niklas und ich dabei, die Geschichte zu schreiben. Jetzt haben wir es endliche geschafft! Mit Verena haben wir eine wunderbare Illustratorin gefunden. Gott sei Dank!

Schaut mal wie Niklas' meine Vorstellung malen konnte:

Das hat dann Verena aus unserer Idee gezaubert (erst als Skizze und dann mit Farbe):

Alles zur Entstehungsgeschichte kannst Du hier nachlesen: 

https://nilpferdson.de/von-der-idee-zum-buch/

Die Zeitung ist auf mich aufmerksam geworden:

Zeitungsartikel Gießener Anzeiger

Sogar das Fernsehen hat sich für meine Geschichte interessiert! Wenn Du den Beitrag sehen willst, ist hier der Link:

Fernsehbeitrag auf der ARD Mediathek

Das Buch und sein Inhalt

Hier könnt Ihr Illustrationen aus dem Buch bewundern:

Finanziert über Kickstarter

Innerhalb von 100 Minuten wurde das Finanzierungsziel erreicht!

5000 € waren nötig, um den Druck zu finanzieren. Das haben wir mit Hilfe der vielen Unterstützer erreicht.

Sei mit der erste, der sich ein Buch gesichert hat und hole dir dein "Nilpferdson und Erdmannson"!

Versand spätestens November 2021

Unser Ziel ist es, dass Ihr das Buch bis spätestens November 2021 in den Händen haltet. So kann ich Euch - und Ihr vielleicht anderen - eine große Freude zu Weihnachten bereiten.

Der Versand ist nach Deutschland, in die EU und in die Schweiz möglich. Der Versand wird zuzüglich zum Buchpreis berechnet.

Die Belohnungen

Das Hardcover-Buch "Nilpferdson und Erdmannson" 

Weitere Belohnungen

5 weitere unbedruckte Postkarten zum selber versenden (zusätzlich bestellbar)

Eine "Unterstützer" Tasse je 20 € (Optional zufügen bei Kauf eines oder mehrerer Bücher)

 

Wer wir sind?

Verena ist die kreative Hand hinter dem Projekt. Sie hat den Figuren und der Geschichte ein Gesicht gegeben. Alle Illustrationen wurden von ihr von Hand gemalt!

Niklas ist der kreative Kopf hinter dem Projekt. Er hat die Geschichte aufgeschrieben. Er hat allen Figuren Leben eingehaucht und das Projekt vorangetrieben.

 

Vielen Dank und viel Spaß beim Lesen!

Herzlichen Dank an alle Unterstützer, die es mir ermöglicht haben, bis hierher zu kommen! Besonderer Dank gilt:

- Meiner Mutter, meinem Schwager und meiner Schwester für die vielen Stunden, die offenen Ohren und die vielen Tipps

- Johannes und That Works Media (https://thatworksmedia.com) für das Schneiden der Videos

- Das KIZ Wolpertshausen für jegliche Unterstützung

- Jonas für die Korrekturen

- Stefi für die Werbemittel

- Julia für das stets offene Ohr

 

Viele Grüße

Niklas, Verena und "Die Gang"!

Risiken und Herausforderungen

Das Buch ist fertig designed und das Layout steht. Der Druck konnte glücklicherweise vorfinanziert werden.

Ich konnte keinen Verlag finden, daher findet alles in Eigenregie statt. In das Verlagswesen und den Bücherverkauf habe ich mich eingelesen und sehe in diesem Zusammenhang keine Probleme.
In den aktuellen Zeiten ist manches ungewiss. Ehrlicherweise muss ich sagen, dass es zu zeitlichen Verzögerungen kommen kann und Du dich eventuell etwas länger gedulden musst als geplant.
Sollte das Buch im Laufe der Kickstarterkampagne doch noch durch einen Verlag veröffentlicht werden, kann auch das zu Verzögerungen führen.

story:
Hi, I'm MaNishtana.

After two (b"H) successful crowdsourcing campaigns, we're back at it again for those stragglers, latecomers, or folk who plain didn't know this project was a thing and want to be a part of it. Come on in, join the fun, contribute, get your name in the book and some spiritual credit in your account!

Original post text is below:

 

Hi, I'm MaNishtana.

For over a decade I've done work focused on racial and religious identity, least of which including the insistence that Jews are a multiethnic, multiracial people who can be found across the globe. And now I'm aiming to produce a traditional Torah commentary that feels just as diverse. One that is firmly traditional/Orthodox, but with a modern and non-myopic lens on race and gender. One which engages with our texts with a viewpoint beyond the standard right-wing and/or Ashkenormative frame that dominates most other Orthodox Jewish commentary.

Of course, that's not to say that it will be left-leaning just to be left, either.

There's no "liberal agenda" here, and the discussions on socially sensitive topics will be frank and presenting what the traditional view or rulings are, yet thoughtfully approached in a [hopefully] non-condescending/patronizing manner.

It's not meant to be some enchiridion of heretofore unheard of gems of inspiration, but a compilation of the usual sources and interpretations, yet with a particular focus on those that have been maybe forgotten, and perhaps some sparks of my own occasionally.

My publishing goal is Chanukah 5781/2021. Feel free to shoot at me on Twitter (@MaNishtana) if you have questions or want more deets!

story:
Story of My Book

Oil Paper Family follows the story of my grandfather, Young Bok Kim, through his childhood as a farm boy in rural North Korea in the 1930s living beneath three oppressive regimes, and his eventual escape to South Korea during the Korean War. 

My name is Melanie Kim and I am the author of Oil Paper Family. I grew up lingering over these stories of my grandfather’s life. There were stories of his childhood and his school, blooming azalea mountainsides and lazy afternoons eating melons in the shade of a river shack. But there were also stories of Japanese colonialism, war, near-death experiences, and loss. 

I wrote this book because of how my grandfather looked while he was telling me the stories of his life. Immense pain and sorrow, guilt and joy were etched into the lines of his face. When he held my hand and told me about his siblings and his mother, when I saw so much passion and life and resilience... I don’t know how I could not write this book! 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the individual experiences of the older generations who lived through Japanese Imperialism, WWII, Korean War, and communist rule. I hope you come to feel as I do: that though my grandfather’s story weaves into the rich tapestry of my Korean heritage, his story is not just Korean; it is a story of humanity and resiliency and strength. And finally, I hope that this book inspires you to ask and take the time to listen to the stories of a loved one. I hope that you get to hold their hand when they’re crying, when they laugh, when they tell you something that they’ve never told anyone else. I hope you get to see that beautifully intimate moment when they are talking about that person that they love best in the entire world. 

In this book, you'll learn about the life of a man who deeply loved his family, who was passionate about his education, and was bent on survival. You'll follow him through decades of conflict and war, joys and burdens. You'll hear stories such as...

  • Young Bok’s experiences in school beneath the Japanese colonialist system, specifically in a conflict with his friends over the rule against speaking Korean
  • The work of Young Bok’s mother (whom he always called a “superhero”) to tend to the farm, raise silkworms, weave clothing, and raise seven children
  • The cold early morning in 1950 when Young Bok woke with a crumbled handful of soybean cake in his hands and a pouch of paper money warm against his chest, remembering the day before when he had watched his entire family make their way back towards their northern hometown, while he struck out alone towards the south. 

Oil Paper Family is a creative nonfiction book that speaks to anyone interested in stories of human resilience or a part of history that is not well addressed in the US. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5,000), I will publish a paperback and ebook.
When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book ($6,000), I will also publish a hardcover edition.
When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book ($8,000), I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author 

Melanie Kim is a student at Brown University studying Medical Anthropology.

Melanie started writing this book because of the way that her grandfather inspired her with his stories. It has been her long-time dream to write a book, though in her early years the genres ranged from short stories on living chocolate chips to fantasy to historical fiction. Her all time favorite books are Louisa May Alcott’s Little Women and Madeleine L’Engle’s A Wrinkle in Time. 

Melanie loves making handmade cards, watching Kdramas and Marvel movies, and exploring parks or hidden places to sit. She loves people watching, retelling stories of her unconventional injuries, and going on hikes with family, friends, and Lilo, her mini labradoodle. 

For more information, you can connect with Melanie Kim at melkims19@gmail.com, on Facebook, or @melaniekim_writing on Instagram.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #OilPaperFamily and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Melanie Kim

I grew up lingering over these stories of my grandfather’s life. There were stories of his childhood and his school, blooming azalea mountainsides and lazy afternoons eating melons in the shade of a river shack. But there were also stories of Japanese colonialism, war, near-death experiences, and loss. I wrote this book because of how my grandfather looked while he was telling me the stories of his life. Immense pain and sorrow, guilt and joy were etched into the lines of his face. When he held my hand and told me about his siblings and his mother, when I saw so much passion and life and resilience... I don’t know how I could not write this book! My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the individual experiences of the older generations who lived through Japanese Imperialism, WWII, Korean War, and communist rule. I hope you come to feel as I do: that though my grandfather’s story weaves into the rich tapestry of my Korean heritage, his story is not just Korean; it is a story of humanity and resiliency and strength. And finally, I hope that this book inspires you to ask and take the time to listen to the stories of a loved one. I hope that you get to hold their hand when they’re crying, when they laugh, when they tell you something that they’ve never told anyone else. I hope you get to see that beautifully intimate moment when they are talking about that person that they love best in the entire world. In this book, you'll learn about the life of a man who deeply loved his family, who was passionate about his education, and was bent on survival. You'll follow him through decades of conflict and war, joys and burdens. You'll hear stories such as...

Young Bok’s experiences in school beneath the Japanese colonialist system, specifically in a conflict with his friends over the rule against speaking Korean
The work of Young Bok’s mother (whom he always called a “superhero”) to tend to the farm, raise silkworms, weave clothing, and raise seven children
The cold early morning in 1950 when Young Bok woke with a crumbled handful of soybean cake in his hands and a pouch of paper money warm against his chest, remembering the day before when he had watched his entire family make their way back towards their northern hometown, while he struck out alone towards the south. 

Oil Paper Family is a creative nonfiction book that speaks to anyone interested in stories of human resilience or a part of history that is not well addressed in the US. 

 
What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5,000), I will publish a paperback and ebook.When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book ($6,000), I will also publish a hardcover edition.When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book ($8,000), I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!

 

About the Author 
Melanie Kim is a student at Brown University studying Medical Anthropology.Melanie started writing this book because of the way that her grandfather inspired her with his stories. It has been her long-time dream to write a book, though in her early years the genres ranged from short stories on living chocolate chips to fantasy to historical fiction. Her all time favorite books are Louisa May Alcott’s Little Women and Madeleine L’Engle’s A Wrinkle in Time. Melanie loves making handmade cards, watching Kdramas and Marvel movies, and exploring parks or hidden places to sit. She loves people watching, retelling stories of her unconventional injuries, and going on hikes with family, friends, and Lilo, her mini labradoodle. For more information, you can connect with Melanie Kim at melkims19@gmail.com, on Facebook, or @melaniekim_writing on Instagram.
 
International Preorders
For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #OilPaperFamily and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Melanie Kim

story:
Story of My Book

Press Play: Music as a catalyst of change

From time, music has been used to build community and empower people. It is a strong force that has led movements and marched in rhythm with some of the biggest change-makers and innovators that have shaped the world that we live in. In the 21st century, music continues to play a pivotal role in inspiring positive change and empowering people to tackle some of the biggest social issues of our time.

My name is Nifemi Aluko and I am the author of Press Play. I wrote this book because I believe music is a powerful transformational tool that can drive positive change within individuals and communities.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that music plays a very important role in building a better and more empowered world. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for music and empowerment in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you use music to solve challenging problems in your personal life and community.

In this book, you'll learn about music and social change:

  • The role music has played and continues to play in facilitating social movements, fostering empowerment, and igniting innovation around the world
  • My journey as an engineer, entrepreneur, and music producer, and the transformative effect that music has had on me as a key gateway to boosting my creative confidence
  • How the various utilities of music can be used to empower people and address some of our most challenging issues seen through interviews of some of my favorite musicians
You will love this book if you enjoy storytelling, music, empowerment, entrepreneurship, and problem-solving.

Press Play is a non-fiction book that speaks to music makers and music lovers who are looking at music and positive change for the first time.

 

The Book - Press Play

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + six additional chapters. Here you’ll learn about music being used as a spark for social change beginning with some historical cases of music’s functions in our communities, our brains, and how it has been used to fuel social movements - and the musicians behind these movements. You will also learn about some of the major social challenges that we face as a human race and the approach that problem-solvers and music makers use to tackle these problems. Some interesting stories include how the Drums of Africa was an effective means of long-distance communication centuries before the advent of modern forms of communication. You’ll get insights on the effective use of music during the civil rights and anti-war movements in the US during the 60s and 70s, along with music’s role during the Pan-African liberation movement that spanned from Africa to the Carribeans.

Part 2 contains Chapters 8 - 14. [In this section of the book, you’ll learn 7 principles that music and musicians use to empower people and change the world. From storytelling, youth empowerment, mental therapy, building empathy and community, to developing an identity and facilitating freedom of expression and creativity, the role of music similar to key innovative practices can be used to inspire change and bring create a better environment for all of us to live in. Seen through my eyes and stories of some of my favorite musicians, you’ll learn how music can be a fundamental agent of change. You’ll also learn about my unexpected but transformative journey that led to the publication of this book and how music was the creative gateway that got me there.

Part 3 contains Chapters 15 and 16. Here you'll learn how music can be fully utilized, along with the tools we have available to us in the 21st century, to bring change that we seek in our personal lives or within our communities. It includes how music, as a universal language, can be used to facilitate one of our biggest opportunities for change in the 21st century - radically fostering large scale empowerment globally. Music as the much-needed catalyst to uplift the most unempowered members in our society, reduce inequality, bring us together, and boost our collective consciousness by spreading love and positive energy.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this spring

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

 

  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Nifemi Aluko is the Founder and CEO of kpakpakpa Inc - an information and advisory company and assists business builders with enterprise expansion across the African continent. 

My passion for music and making things drove me to write this book. I was curious about the book publishing process and ventured on this book-writing journey from a series of events that started with a mixtape that I was putting together. I’m looking forward to the impact that the book could have on fellow adventurers, tinkerers, and explorers like myself.

Almost 90% of the music I make does not see the day of light (buried in the hard-drives of my laptops). I’m interested in so many things - technology, business, music, sports - that I hear “Nifemi, so where’s your focus” quite often.

For more information, you can connect with Nifemi at nifemi@kpakpakpa.com and on LinkedIn.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.


The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #PressPlay and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Nifemi Aluko

story:
Crinkling News is read and loved by tens of thousands of kids in schools and homes across the country each week. We have inspired young people to start newspaper clubs, launch their writing careers, voice their opinions, and establish their own papers.

We are developing the next generation's love for quality news and current affairs.

But we need your help

Despite steadily growing readership, we need funds to secure the newspaper's future. 

This is not a tale of woe or financial mismanagement, just urgency.

Crinkling News continues to attract new readers and subscribers every day. We have simply run out of seed funding just short of becoming a sustainable business.

We have worked hard to attract funding for the past year, but our time has been extremely limited because we put out a 16-page national newspaper each week with a very small team - and the deadline always takes priority!

We need the funds to invest in the business development we don't have the time or expertise to do. In other words, your generous contribution goes to making Crinkling News stronger and secure its future, not to prop it up.

With your help, we can get there!

We are so close to becoming a self-sustaining publication. But unless you help now, we will close next week.

Your generous donation will be used to take us that final step. It will bring in the key expertise needed to establish Crinkling News as the foundation for our kids' life-long love of quality news.

story:
Introduction

LusciousReads is a site for erotica readers and writers to post, share and review books in the genre. Already, a functional site has been created in phase one of the project. The review system is more diverse than Amazon or Goodreads, and the concepts of the community will eliminate bullying and "clique mentality."

How you can help

We need contributions to help fund the development. Although a basic functional site exists, an expert development team is necessary to add integration such as calendaring, discussion boards, as well as "prettying up" various parts of the site.

Goals

Some of the specific modifications we are working toward:

  • Being able to discuss books "outside of" the review process, including book clubs and discussion forums.
  • A calendar featuring upcoming events such as cover reveals, seminars, conferences, book releases and other giveaways. These can be on social media (such as Facebook events) or in real life (conferences and expos.)
  • We want to make LusciousReads more than just a collection of books on shelves. Now, we want readers and writers to interact and enjoy a diverse experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're an author, consider uploading your book details to LusciousReads. You'll get a good feel for the site, as well as being able to contribute ideas regarding making the site better. Also, your books will get more exposure.

If you're a reader, you can list your favorite author's book details as well. Also, feel free to use the review process to leave honest reviews for works you've read.

  "My name’s Alice Green. It’s not my real name, but if you knew what was going on,
you’d understand why I need to be careful. Adults warn you your body will start going through “changes” when you get older.
  Yeah. That happened—a while ago.
  This is different.
  I’ve been infected with something I can’t fully explain—bio-luminescence—
fluorescent energy. I can’t control when it appears. It’s volatile, and that’s what scares me the most.
  I hope, for your sake, this never happens to you or to anyone you care about.
  I hope you will never wake to discover this fire burning beneath your skin—this spark of living, breathing color crackling through your veins."


Fluorescence is an upcoming 4-part YA book series about a group of teenagers who are Implanted with glowing alien DNA which grants each of them unique and powerful abilities, but may also jeopardize the future of the human race.

Unlike other campaigns asking for funds to "finish books" Fluorescence Book 1 has been fully edited and completed and is currently IN PRODUCTION and distribution NOW; there's no risk of the project being abandoned or unfinished because it's already done!



For art to thrive, it needs to be seen. Read. Touched. It’s about getting it into people’s hands.



But without a massive publishing house and a limitless budget, that's tough!

YOU can change that!


This series is UNIQUE and offers growth potential in a stagnant marketplace.


With a plot stemming from a unique and original sci-fi core, there's nothing quite like it on the YA market today. It fills a niche that hasn't yet been conquered in YA - sci-fi.

Each volume in the series is narrated by a different character, driving the story forward in a new and exciting way for readers. 

Fluorescence evolves from a quiet beginning into a gritty and unabashed look at real-life limitations and struggles these teenagers face while coping with a life-changing secret.


Q.  So if Fluorescence is so groundbreaking, why does it need funding?


A.  Good question! The answer to that is simple - funding = marketing. Marketing = the ability to build a fan-base and gain an audience, which in turn, can = success. Think about it: how many books/movies/TV Shows, etc. would you have found out about or purchased if you'd never seen a commercial/flyer/or other promotional blurb about it? Probably few to none.

No matter how good something is, if no one knows it exists, it can't make an impact. This doesn't mean it's not a good product, it often only means the marketing failed.

The success of this book, upcoming installments and myself as an author, relies solely on getting

Fluorescence in front of people! 

NOTE:  $25/$35 gets a signed book!
BUT If you don't actually SELECT/CHOOSE a perk from the RIGHT SIDE BAR before clicking "Contribute now" it won't let me send you the perk/book/etc.
  • Perks are guaranteed! You can get great things like eBooks, gorgeous high-gloss 11"x17" Posters, signed books, and LTD art prints, to YOUR NAME in the actual book! Every $ COUNTS!
  • The cover art illustrations were created by world-renown artist Fernanda Suarez! Her art has been featured in magazines, boardgames, books and websites all over the world! Some of her past work has been with Paizo Publishing and Plaid Hat Games!
 



I'm P. Anastasia. I’ve been a writer for as long as I’ve been able to write. Most of all, I’ve been a storyteller. After a long mid-life struggle with debilitating, art-killing, writer's block inducing depression, I decided to turn my life around.

Last year, I made the decision to move away from the tedious, unsatisfying and under-appreciated work I was doing for a living and finally take the plunge into what I’m here to do – tell stories that have never been told before. Stories that excite and inspire others.

The very basics required to produce a quality, polished novel are expensive.  Editors. Illustrators. ISBNs. Proof copies. Web hosting. Social networking. Promo materials... not to mention countless hours writing, re-writing, editing, researching, advertising, web design work, and hiring and interviewing editors and artists. I've had to invest nearly $5,000.00 of my own hard-earned savings just to get this project off it's feet.

With so much media bombarding us every day, getting books into people's hands is tough and yet CRITICAL for success! This is ESPECIALLY true for newly published authors. I need to be able to show people what a great idea I have. I want you to be able to pick up a copy of my book, say HI to me, and get a first hand look at how much work really went into this awesome story. This isn't something I can accomplish by sitting at home!

The following are a list of a few of the conventions I will attend if I meet my goal (So people will actually SEE my books!):

This is ONLY table/booth rate + hotel accommodations.

  • Lexington ComicCon 2015 ($150)
  • FandomFest 2015  ($150 + hotel = $400)

STRETCH GOAL CONS:

  • WizardWorld ComicCon 2015 ($325 + hotel = $575)
  • DragonCon 2015 (THE BIG ONE!) (Booth $550 + Hotel ($600) = $1,150)

    Extra costs:

Convention preparation and necessities:

  • Booth/table banner and signage ($150),
  • Shelving ($125)
  • Tablecloth ($50)
  • Gas ($30+per con)
  • Food
  • Paperback stock for conventions ($550)
  • Promotional items ($300+) to give away! (Bookmarks, postcards, biz cards)

Additional MARKETING (If funds allow):

  • Newspaper and magazine ads. ($35-$400 - depending upon distribution/market)
  • Convention programs ads. ($30-$250)
  • Facebook marketing and social media advertisements to promote the series. ($100/Month+ Targeted Ads)

The Impact

I'm taking a plunge. Following my dreams. As an entrepreneur with over 14 years of experience in freelancing, sales, and writing, I've stepped up to challenges and been successful in the past. I'm not one to back down simply because things get tough. I'll see this through as I've seen through all the previous challenges I've met!

 


Yes. There are risks. The main one being: If I am unable to get my book out there, it likely won't be successful. That's the bottom line. One of the biggest mistakes (besides not hiring the professional help of artists and editors) many authors make, is they fail to market their books effectively!

  • I'm going to attempt to sign up for a vendor table at DragonCon, but if for some reason, I don't get one (they sell out) , all related expenses will be put toward marketing and promotional materials, as well as additional stock to be submitted to various review websites and possibly an ad in the DragonCon program. This will STILL get these books noticed and into people's hands. FB ads, Google ad words, buttons, promotional flyers and other items. The possibilities are endless.

  • If I don't reach my goal, I may have to forfeit  DragonCon (it will depend upon scheduling), but hopefully, that won't be the case. It's one of the largest conventions on this side of the country and probably most influential and beneficial for marketing this series to my audience!

  • If I can afford to attend these conventions without having to move into a cardboard box, I'll not only get noticed, I'll be able to get a better feel for my market. What people want to see more of in the FUTURE. I'll be able to produce better merchandise, posters, and other items YOU want to buy! Things that will allow you to stay immersed in the universe I've created in this series.


If you can't donate MONEY, donate just a little bit of your time.
I'd be SO thankful!

 you don't CLICK a perk from the RIGHT SIDE BAR before 
clicking "Contribute now" it won't let me send you the 
perk. So please be sure to do this to ensure you get your 
item!   "My name’s Alice Green. It’s not my real name, but if you knew what was going on,you’d understand why I need to be careful. Adults warn you your body will start going through “changes” when you get older.  Yeah. That happened—a while ago.  This is different.  I’ve been infected with something I can’t fully explain—bio-luminescence—fluorescent energy. I can’t control when it appears. It’s volatile, and that’s what scares me the most.  I hope, for your sake, this never happens to you or to anyone you care about. 
 I hope you will never wake to discover this fire burning beneath your 
skin—this spark of living, breathing color crackling through your 
veins."
Fluorescence is
 an upcoming 4-part YA book series about a group of teenagers who are 
Implanted with glowing alien DNA which grants each of them unique and 
powerful abilities, but may also jeopardize the future of the human 
race. Unlike other campaigns asking for funds to "finish books" Fluorescence Book 1 has been fully edited and completed and is currently IN PRODUCTION and distribution NOW; there's no risk of the project being abandoned or unfinished because it's already done!  



For art to thrive, it needs to be seen. Read. Touched. It’s about getting it into people’s hands. 



But without a massive publishing house and a limitless budget, that's tough! 
YOU can change that!




This series is UNIQUE and offers growth potential in a stagnant marketplace.



With a plot stemming from a unique and original sci-fi core,
 there's nothing quite like it on the YA market today. It fills a niche 
that hasn't yet been conquered in YA - sci-fi. 




Each volume in the series is narrated by a different 
character, driving the story forward in a new and exciting way for 
readers. 
Fluorescence evolves from a quiet beginning into a gritty 
and unabashed look at real-life limitations and struggles these 
teenagers face while coping with a life-changing secret.



Q.  So if Fluorescence is so groundbreaking, why does it need funding?

A.  Good question! The answer to that is simple - funding = marketing. Marketing = the ability to build a fan-base and gain an audience, which in turn, can = success.
 Think about it: how many books/movies/TV Shows, etc. would you have 
found out about or purchased if you'd never seen a commercial/flyer/or 
other promotional blurb about it? Probably few to none.
No matter how good something is, if no one knows it exists, it can't 
make an impact. This doesn't mean it's not a good product, it often only
 means the marketing failed. 




The success of this book, upcoming installments and myself as an author, relies solely on getting 



Fluorescence in front of people! 






NOTE:  $25/$35 gets a signed book! BUT If
 you don't actually SELECT/CHOOSE a perk from the RIGHT SIDE BAR before 
clicking "Contribute now" it won't let me send you the 
perk/book/etc. 


Perks are guaranteed! You can get great things like eBooks, gorgeous high-gloss 11"x17" Posters, signed books, and LTD art prints, to YOUR NAME in the actual book! Every $ COUNTS! 

The cover art illustrations were created by world-renown artist Fernanda Suarez! Her
 art has been featured in magazines, boardgames, books and websites all 
over the world! Some of her past work has been with Paizo Publishing and
 Plaid Hat Games!
  

I'm P. Anastasia. I’ve been a writer for as long as I’ve been able 
to write.
Most of all, I’ve been a storyteller. After a long mid-life 
struggle with debilitating, art-killing, writer's block 
inducing depression, I decided to turn my life around. 
Last
 year, I made the decision to move away
from the tedious, unsatisfying and under-appreciated work I was doing 
for a
living and finally take the plunge into what I’m here to do – tell stories that have never been told before. Stories that excite and inspire others.  to mention countless hours writing, re-writing, editing, researching, 
advertising, web design work, and hiring and interviewing editors and 
artists. I've had to invest nearly $5,000.00 of my own hard-earned savings just to get this project off it's feet. 

With so much media bombarding us every day, getting books into people's hands is tough and yet CRITICAL for success! This
 is ESPECIALLY true for newly published authors. I need to be able to 
show people what a great idea I have. I want you to be able to pick up a

work really went into this awesome story. This isn't something I can 
accomplish by sitting at home!
