story:
The Project

We always wanted to make a horror collection...

It was late in the evening. Christopher Earnings (DimensionBucket) got a message from his fellow writer and "CreepyPasta" narrator Josh Reeves (Awkward Thursdays.) He announced this idea he had, which involved taking the best writing they had, and collecting them into one huge anthology. Over the course of time, more stories were written, and other authors decided to join in. Here we are today, with a short story collection with over thirty horrifying tales of the macabre. Throughout the book, we are also including original artwork by Major Moose

We were really happy the way the book came out, and even more joyous when Mr. CreepyPasta, WellHey Productions, LitterBot, HauntingSeason, GentlemanWalrus, and many others agreed to record guest narrations for the audiobook. Now, you can hear the stories of "Neighborhood Kids" brought to life in audio form.

Anyhow, we're really excited to present our project to the world, and hope you're as excited as we are.


Our Goal

Hello Folks,

I’m Samuel Rhod. I’m here to tell you a little bit about this massive venture that we’re all putting together for you, the fans. We’ve painstakingly edited and written a collection of over thirty short horror stories for your pleasure. We’re very proud of what we have done and it’s a large undertaking so far. The group is facing some rather difficult odds and I know it seems like we’re asking for much. In truth we are doing what we can to keep your expenses down while making a small margin of profit to get you a copy of the book.

The group will be self publishing this book out to you, the fans, in various different forms. We’ll have several narrators reading for the audio book, including Murphy of WellHeyProductions and Josh from Haunting Season, a few other unconfirmed guests, and ourselves. Your funds will be used to power this well oiled machine in which will turn out the pages you will hold in your hands. We will then use the money left over to meet you all for a panel at Delta-H Con for a Theatre Obscurum panel where you can ask us all sorts of questions.

We are all proficient writers and we have had many others give us feedback on the stories with generally positive reviews. Between Geoffri C. Nelvon, Christopher Earnings, Josh Reeves, Jacob Emory, and myself we’re looking at a team of heavy hitters who’ll get the job done for you all. So far all of the stories are written and we are currently still editing a bit, but you’ll be happy to know that it’ll all be done far before we ship them out.

So send us your offerings and we’ll send you the nightmares.

Sincerly,

-Samuel Rhod


Price Concerns

You may be wondering why the price is so steep, but allow me to remedy your concerns. Obviously a 20 dollar price is quite expensive for a paperback book, but normally paperbacks run from 8-15 dollars. Count shipping and that's 13-20 dollars. We also have manufacturing costs because we are self publishing, so the things start to add up. One thing we hate to do is the 50 dollar price on the signed copies. The only issue with signing the books is that we live nowhere near each other. How we remedy this is we will have one author sign a ton of papers, send them to the next author, and go down the chain before landing at the final destination, where they will be inserted into the books. This will minimize shipping costs and keep us under budget.



Our Challenges

The challenges we face are somewhat daunting as they all boil down to you, the fans, to help push the bar up for us to get everything squared away and ready. The major challenge is balancing a fair price with a reasonable price. We would love it if we could make the items cheaper and more fair for you guys, but we have to account for shipping costs, production costs, and so much more. The cost may seem a bit high, but removing some for shipping and getting the book before anyone else will ever see it, I think that offsets it. 

If the book is funded, another challenge will be actually creating some of the items from the higher tiers. We are dedicated to creating the best quality, so we are looking forward to making the props, box sets, and the book itself look as good as possible -- as well as the stories being as good as possible.


Extras

We will require appreciate an extra 10 dollars shipping to Canada (if it is a physical item, not digital) and 15 for anywhere else international.

·  Add $5 and Jacob Emory will promise not to kill you

·  Add $50 for each Signed Hardback Book

·  Add $20 for each Paperback Book

·  At $125 we will unlock extra stories for the book


Basically, if you want extras, just add on the amount of the tier and we will contact you to find out exactly what you want (This way you can customize your tier... perhaps you want an ebook and a physical audiobook)

note: if you don't have Paypal but want to contribute please e-mail me at pedroontheroad@gmail.com

Synopsis:

"In January 2011 I left. I stretched myself, opened my arms and my heart and hugged a few dreams that had been lost, between momentous inspirations or laughter with no evil. I wanted to do something extraordinary, I wanted to meet people that weren't like me, I wanted to surrender to the effort of living with little money and various smiles. The other corner of the Eurasian continent, as far as the moon, lured me and offered me a rug made of asphalt, train-tracks and niceties. Whether with my thumb stretched out on the side of the road or a ticket in my hand, I dived in. I laughed, I cried, I loved, I fell into despair, I died and was born again, more myself and more of the world. When I arrived the wings I'd gained were too big and wouldn't fit the sky, so I took to the road again.

I went, and I came back. From here all the way over there, with fifty thousand kilometres tattooed on my soul.

And this is my story."

What Happened When Away?

  • I was in Syria days before the revolution began;
  • I spent 1 week in Iraq with no money;
  • I spent 11 days in Iran with 35$;
  • I was 2km away from Bin Laden 12 hours before he was shot in Pakistan (assuming what they say is true);
  • I was arrested in Croatia;
  • I spent over 100 nights Couchsurfing;
  • I was arrested and spent 36 hours in jail in Laos                                                 (worst experience of my LIFE)
  • I went to the Full Moon Party in Thailand;
  • I tubed in Laos;
  • I crossed the whole of china hitchhiking;
  • I crossed Siberia on the legendary Trans-Siberian Train;
  • I spent a week in the Gobi Desert in Mongolia;
  • I hitchhiked for 20.000km;
  • I spent 3300€ in 9 months and a half;
  • ... and do much more!

Hi guys and girls, grandpas and grandmas, men and women, kids and people who don't know where they fit! Welcome.

My name is Pedro and I'm a writer from the land of Portugal looking to self-publish his first book in English!

What's in it For You?

  • The safety of traveling

A lot of people will tell you traveling is dangerous, especially when in countries like Iraq, Pakistan... especially when hitchhiking... especially when staying with locals anytime you can, especially... when anything! Well, it's not! As long as you have some social and emotional intelligence, in this book you understand how traveling isn't dangerous!

  • Hitchhiking?

I'd never hitchhiked before this trip. It seemed like a strange concept and I'd never get far. I left Portugal and hitchhiked most of the way to Pakistan! In the end I did 20.000km this way. My main motivation was because it was free, it's true, but I soon realized it's such a cool way to meet random genuine people. Reading this book you can understand some of its tricks, please share yours with me when you start : )

  • Inspiration

I always feel awkward proclaiming it might inspire you, because after all, who am I, right? But turns, I'm just a guy. And people that are just people can inspire other people, as some other people inspired me. I think the way it can inspire you is by showing how easy it is once you take that decision to go, if that's what you want to do. I don't think everyone should travel, people should do whatever makes them happy. For me it's this, and who knows if by reading the steps I took to release myself from the shackles of normality you won't be closer yourself?...

  • Traveling with little money?

I spent 3300€ in 284 days, which is 11€ per day. A camera, insurance, meals, drinks, moving around... everything. I know you don't find 3300€ under a rock every day. But reading this book you can understand how I could do it with even less, since I'm not shy about explaining when I felt some expenses could be avoided.

What Led Me On Such a Journey?

As someone who always loved traveling I once found myself in India in 2009 in one of those I-gotta-do-what-I-gotta-do moments and decided to quit my job as a psychologist in Birmingham, UK,and just go and be happy, figure out the rest as I went along. You know... I guess I simply realized that what I really, really wanted was to travel... and write.

So I had to try.

I traveled for 9 months and a half and at the time it was the best thing I'd ever done (since then I cycled from Portugal to South Africa) and what I felt and what I learned changed some parts of me.

I traveled through 34 countries, hitchhiked 20.000km in 314 vehicles (green on the map), took the bus for another 20.000 (red) and the train for 10.000 (orange).

What Then?

Once I was back I needed to take the next step - to write about all these experiences and share what I'd learned.

No longer wanting to be under some publisher's wing I decided to print the book on my own, in Portuguese. I was pretty sure it was gonna work and so I moved forward with the editing. And the first edition sold out in 3 months! It was incredible! I'd taken what I thought was a bold and perhaps risky move and it worked out!

I then printed the second edition and this one is close to selling out too!

What Now?

Now I want to publish this book in English. Sure, there's a lot of people speaking Portuguese out there, but in English this book could reach so many more. People who want to travel themselves, people who want to travel vicariously, people who want to learn a bit the same way I did, friends of mine, like you, maybe, with whom I'd like to share something so important to me.

The book is already written!

So I need your help to make this happen! There's a bunch of options you can take that can bring you with me on this journey.

Why?

You know, I thought a lot about that... "Why should anyone care about what I have to say?" And I think it's just because I'm someone who did something. Not the best tagline to sell something, I know, but the truth is that no one else has ever lived exactly what I lived those days.

On top of that I consider myself to be someone invested in breaking down prejudice we have towards people that are not the same as us, someone who reflects on what's happened to him, someone attentive and willing to let all the kindness he receives land in his heart, understanding we are all the same.

I believe this book and future ones might be my best go at changing anything.

Finally, and judging from so many opinions that have been shared with me throughout time, this book is an inspiring one. It shows you that in order to break free you don't need much more than just wanting to do it. And once it shows you you can do it (if that's what you want, cos if you don't, that's cool too) it shows you some ways in which you can do it.

What I Need & What You Get

So in order for me to set off in this new venture I need your help. With the printing of the book, VAT, fees and shipping it will come to a total of 4000€. So what can you get?

  • Ebook - Don't like holding a physical book in your hand? No probs, get the ebook!
  • Get The Book! - If you're like me you'll prefer that whole deal... the smell, the touch, the... soul (?) And if you're in a hurry to get cracking with the reading, don't worry, you also get the ebook when you select this perk.

                                                                                                 portuguese cover & back cover

  • Presentation In Your Town - If you're there to listen, it's my pleasure to share

  • and many more...

All you gotta do is choose one of the perks you want on the right side of this screen and move forward. Since this is a Fixed Funding Campaign you'll only be able to pay with PayPal. It's easy to set up an account, but if you're having trouble with this contact me and we can work out a different way, no problem - pedroontheroad@gmail.com


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't really contribute you can always do other stuff:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign;
  • Not only share on you Facebook page but also contact directly someone you're pretty sure would be interested in contributing;
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

I always feel awkward proclaiming it might inspire you, because after all, who am I, right? But turns, I'm just a guy. And people that are just people can inspire other people, as some other people inspired me. I think the way it can inspire you is by showing how easy it is once you take that decision to go, if that's what you want to do. I don't think everyone should travel, people should do whatever makes them happy. For me it's this, and who knows if by reading the steps I took to release myself from the shackles of normality you won't be closer yourself?...
Traveling with little money?
I spent 3300€ in 284 days, which is 11€ per day. A camera, insurance, meals, drinks, moving around... everything. I know you don't find 3300€ under a rock every day. But reading this book you can understand how I could do it with even less, since I'm not shy about explaining when I felt some expenses could be avoided.


What Led Me On Such a Journey?
As someone who always loved traveling I once found myself in India in 2009 in one of those I-gotta-do-what-I-gotta-do moments and decided to quit my job as a psychologist in Birmingham, UK,and just go and be happy, figure out the rest as I went along. You know... I guess I simply realized that what I really, really wanted was to travel... and write.
So I had to try.
I traveled for 9 months and a half and at the time it was the best thing I'd ever done (since then I cycled from Portugal to South Africa) and what I felt and what I learned changed some parts of me.
I traveled through 34 countries, hitchhiked 20.000km in 314 vehicles (green on the map), took the bus for another 20.000 (red) and the train for 10.000 (orange).

What Then?
Once I was back I needed to take the next step - to write about all these experiences and share what I'd learned.No longer wanting to be under some publisher's wing I decided to print the book on my own, in Portuguese. I was pretty sure it was gonna work and so I moved forward with the editing. And the first edition sold out in 3 months! It was incredible! I'd taken what I thought was a bold and perhaps risky move and it worked out!
I then printed the second edition and this one is close to selling out too!


What Now?
Now I want to publish this book in English. Sure, there's a lot of people speaking Portuguese out there, but in English this book could reach so many more. People who want to travel themselves, people who want to travel vicariously, people who want to learn a bit the same way I did, friends of mine, like you, maybe, with whom I'd like to share something so important to me.
The book is already written!
So I need your help to make this happen! There's a bunch of options you can take that can bring you with me on this journey.



Why?
You know, I thought a lot about that... "Why should anyone care about what I have to say?" And I think it's just because I'm someone who did something. Not the best tagline to sell something, I know, but the truth is that no one else has ever lived exactly what I lived those days.
On top of that I consider myself to be someone invested in breaking down prejudice we have towards people that are not the same as us, someone who reflects on what's happened to him, someone attentive and willing to let all the kindness he receives land in his heart, understanding we are all the same.
I believe this book and future ones might be my best go at changing anything. 
Finally, and judging from so many opinions that have been shared with me throughout time, this book is an inspiring one. It shows you that in order to break free you don't need much more than just wanting to do it. And once it shows you you can do it (if that's what you want, cos if you don't, that's cool too) it shows you some ways in which you can do it.


What I Need & What You Get
So in order for me to set off in this new venture I need your help. With
 the printing of the book, VAT, fees and shipping it will come to a 
total of 4000€. So what can you get?
Ebook - Don't like holding a physical book in your hand? No probs, get the ebook!

Get The Book! - If you're like me you'll prefer that whole deal... the smell, the touch, the... soul (?) And if you're in a hurry to get cracking with the reading, don't worry, you also get the ebook when you select this perk.


                                                                                                 portuguese cover & back cover
Presentation In Your Town - If you're there to listen, it's my pleasure to share



and many more...
All you gotta do is choose one of the perks you want on the right side of this screen and move forward. Since this is a Fixed Funding Campaign you'll only be able to pay with PayPal. It's easy to set up an account, but if you're having trouble with this contact me and we can work out a different way, no problem - pedroontheroad@gmail.com

  Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't really contribute you can always do other stuff:

 
Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign;
Not only share on you Facebook page but also contact directly someone you're pretty sure would be interested in contributing;
 
Use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
What is

We're not just a publication that does features on local talent. We are the seen but unheard artists from Lancaster, PA. A collaboration of local talent to showcase local talent; those without money, connections or a desire to settle. The Townie is a platform for original essays, poems, short stories, photo galleries, videos, music and other mediums that tell the story of all of Lancaster's residents.

They tell us we're starving artists. We're not starving; we're hungry. Passionate creatives of every background and medium contribute their talents to showcase the hidden creativity in every corner of Lancaster city. We value our work and our community and don't acknowledge a choice between living with passion and just living.

Art for Art's (and Community's) Sake

As Townie's, we've taken on the mission to create art, create opportunities, and create a community of artists within which we create artistic opportunities for each other.

Though Lancaster's residents are primarily people of color (60%), they only comprise around 6% of the creative workforce in Lancaster City. With intentional content and hiring practices, The Townie seeks to provide creative opportunities and a publication reflective of our city's diverse make-up.

Readers will enjoy content and original works of art not available anywhere else in the world. Visitors to Lancaster reap the benefits of having a guide to the unseen. And Lancaster residents will gain exposure to a broader view of all of its neighbors.

Who is 

Townie Contributors: Founder/Editor-in-Chief - Sophie Roman; (top row) Content Contributor - Savannah Thorpe; Technical Advisor - Zac Shoyei Rogers; Operations Advisor - Phil Cabassa. (bottom row) Photography Editor - Sam Interrante; Content Contributor - Lore Mauger; Creative Advisor - Adam Serrano.

The Townie is a community initiative powered by the passionate contributions of creatives from all backgrounds. Leading this motley crew is me, Founder and Sole proprietor Sophie Roman. 

I was lucky enough to be born into a family where art was a priority. Over the past 12 years, I've put my creative skills to work in building a branding and marketing career. Observing the shear amount and quality of Lancaster's emerging and hidden artists, I realized I could utilize those skills to provide a platform for them to create and gain exposure. Building relationships with local artists over the course of several years has lead me to discover individuals with powerful commentary through their talent that no one has heard of because there is no place, no platform for them to be shown. As a Latina from an artistically talented family, I wanted to prove that we are more than just the hot-button issues assigned to our societal label, that our commentary was relatable and valuable too. Energized by the power of art to communicate instilled by my dad, the natural culmination was a publication for all of Lancaster, The Townie.

What We're Up To

Creating more opportunities for the artists and people of color of Lancaster ensures that our community remains inclusive and accessible to all Townie's. Urban growth can too often leave native residents and local minorities in the lurch (see Brooklyn, London, Portland...). The Townie believes in the unifying power of art and is providing a platform to all of Lancaster's artists to preserve a place for everyone in local progress. 

Lancaster's emerging artists have been moved by their passion for creativity and local talent and have contributed their talents on a volunteer basis to promote the hidden artists of the city. After producing content for www.LancasterTownie.com over the summer, we're ready to diversify our content and sign on advertisers and sponsors. By creating original video content, we expand our reach to make The Townie an advantageous outlet for businesses and organizations to publicly show their support for diversity and emerging local arts.

Meet Adam

The streets of Lancaster City are Adam Serrano’s portfolio. It's impossible to be in Lancaster City and not be surrounded by his body of work including DFB Salon, That Shuu Girl Boutique, Attollo and Fruition Collective. One could imagine the glamorous life this artist probably has with a job at some fancy graphics firm and a condo in the West End while getting hounded for interviews by every local press outlet. But like many creatives, financial stability is a constant struggle of looking for recognition and the overwhelming urge to throw in the towel.

Lancaster is a community that prides itself on its creativity. The Townie provides opportunities to artists like Adam to include everyone in the creative growth of our community.

In an effort to provide paid opportunities for contributors, our goal is to raise $8,000 for the resources to diversify our content mediums. By producing original video content we're creating opportunities for even more artists while also expanding our reach and growing exposure for the artists, making The Townie an excellent advertising and sponsorship opportunity for organizations that support cultivating local arts. By focusing our efforts on both digital and printed content, we maximize our revenue potential while meeting the needs of the artists and advertisers alike.

The Print Edition

Over the summer of 2017 The Townie has been featuring artists and local creatives through our website lancastertownie.com increasing readership with each article. The medium of print allows the best representation of the harmony of photography, writing and graphic design, providing the community with a beautiful representation of the city's talent and diversity. 

The Townie's print edition will debut summer 2018 and will also feature the sponsors and advertisers. Just 10 advertising placements per print issue of The Townie covers the cost of content production! And with advertising opportunities as low as $200/mo,  businesses of all sizes have an opportunity to reach Lancaster's artist community. 

Like and Share, Like and Share!

If you're all about local art, keep up with fresh content at lancastertownie.com and follow us on Facebook and Instagram @LancasterTownie.

story:
DISCOVER THE PROJECT

What it boils down to is this: There are millions of people out there living with the same pain, the same bondage, the same despair AND there is freedom out there that they don't even know exists.  That is why this book begs to be published.  So many of us spend our lives living with a fraction of the joy possible because of the freedom we have allowed to be stolen from us.  foreseen.forgiven.FREE is a campaign to aid in publishing a book by the same name.  

foreseen.forgiven.FREE is not just any book, though.  It is a book that takes the reader on a personal journey to freedom through personal reflection and discovery time.  The book will read differently for each individual because each journey is unique.  What you get in the end is a freedom that is as equally unique.


MEET MICHELE

I am a fresh and freed-up individual intent on forging freedom for women who find themselves living life trapped, stuck, and in bondage.  Maybe it is a secret sin.  Maybe it is a painful past.  Maybe you live your life every day in fear.  Maybe you run yourself into the ground trying to make everything perfect.  Maybe you are just stuck in a rut.  I have a powerful life story, and through it I want to show you that the FREEDOM Christ died for is REAL, AVAILABLE, and ATTAINABLE for all of us. Through an authentic and transparent message, I will point to the truths found in scripture and prove how they are relevant today.  Whether it is speaking or writing, the message is clear, FREEDOM IS WAITING.

I lived in bondage to a secret past for more than 30 years.  My young life was wrought with abuse, sexual trauma, and human trafficking at the hands of those responsible for my well-being.  With the trauma came a myriad of coping mechanisms I used to survive and maintain some sense of sanity - eating disorders, self-harm, lying, running away, attempted suicide.
When I finally did escape, I moved away and started a new life.  I started a career, got married, met Jesus, had kids.  I had lots of friends, was PTO president, an IronMan triathlete, and super involved at church.  I could juggle all the balls and do it very well.  Everyone wanted the life that I had, or at least they thought they did. Inside I was lonely, scared, and trapped.
Eventually, a series of events in this new life brought me to the end of myself, and I could no longer live trapped with my secrets in the prison walls I had created. Freedom was calling me, and it was time to take the journey.  It was painful, but WHAT I FOUND AT THE END WAS A FREEDOM I DIDN'T EVEN KNOW EXISTED.  

BELIEVE IN THE IMPACT

I believe in this book, and I believe in the message.  I am sure most authors feel the same way when publishing a book.  The difference is this:  I believe that once foreseen.forgiven.FREE hits the shelves and falls into the hands of women around the world there is going to be an epidemic of life-changing freedom. You simply can not read this book and not be changed!


ENGAGE IN THE JOURNEY

Like most things, publishing a book takes money if you want to do it right.  This book needs to be written.  It deserves to be written.  And it warrants excellence in the process.  

It will take $7000 to purchase the publishing package which includes everything needed for the book to leave my hands and hit the shelves of your local bookstore and ebook retailer: Softcover Format, ISBN Assignment, Worldwide Book Distribution, Library of Congress Control Number, U.S. Copyright Registration, Book Interior and Cover Design, Included in the WestBow Press Catalog, Author Learning Center Subscription, Author's Copies of Books, E-book Format and Distribution, Hardcover Format, Image Insertion/Text Treatments, Editorial Assessment, Barnes & Noble See Inside the Book Preview, Google & Amazon Search Program, Booksellers Return Program, Author Website, Promotional Materials (bookmarks, postcards, business cards), Press Release, Social Media Setup Guide, Data Entry Service, Indexing Service, Book Signing Kit, Standard Book Video.  (Also included in the total is the 4% fee to INDIEGOGO, and the 3-5% fee to third parties, credit card processing, paypal, etc.) 


ACKNOWLEDGE THE RISKS

As with anything in life, there are risks and challenges involved.  I am prepared to meet those risks and challenges head on and find the best possible solutions.  I believe that for every challenge there is a solution.  If I can not find the solution on my own, I will reach out to my trusted colleagues.

One potential risk is that the project will not be completely funded.  If I am unable to secure the full amount of the publishing package, there are other packages and publishing options that offer fewer services for a lesser cost.  That is one route.  Why not start with a lesser publishing option?  Because I believe in this book, and I believe in the message.  I believe that once it hits the shelves and falls into the hands of women around the world there is going to be an epidemic of life-changing freedom. 


DECIDE ON YOUR PART

So it comes down to this: foreseen.forgiven.FREE needs a lot of prayer, a lot of money, and a lot of exposure.  All are equally important.

If you decide to pray, ask God to do what only He wills and can do with this book. Ask Him to pave the way for the message of freedom to be shared through this book.

If you decide to give, thank you.  This book simply cannot be published without financial support. See the giving options and associated incentives with each level of giving.

If you decide to help spread the word, post the link to this site on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and whatever social media venues you use.  Email the link to your contacts and let them know why you want this book to be published.

story:
Short Summary

pReservation32, Inc. began as the brainchild of Zane Lambert. In 2011, after returning from a road trip which took him through several American Indian Reservations, he noted a stark difference between the oral health care received by Native Americans on and off the Reservations. Zane decided that it was imperative he become involved with helping this segment of the American population. Unfortunately, after attempting to become a member of such an organization, he could not identify a non-profit group specifically focused on improving oral health care for Native Americans. As such, Zane began to mold and shape his own non-profit organization using the scope of the following statement:

pReservation32's mission is to ease the disparity of oral healthcare access, funding, and education to Native American populations on their Reservations by building charitable capital, making philanthropic grants, and more general: to preserve the vitality of these communities.

Through these contributions, we hope to purchase a mobile dental clinic and supplies. This clinic would be able to reach out to Native Americans on their Reservations with minimal effort to the patient and the dentist.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The great news is that 80% of the contributions will go directly to fund the mobile clinic. The remainder of these funds need to go to organizational operating costs such as business licenses, website fees, and office expenses. Per our organizational bylaws, at no time will the collected money pay an officer's salary. If our goal is not fully funded, the amount collected will be held in an interest bearing account until a new campaign can be launched.

We are in the process of finding a Native American artist to create one of a kind "perks." However, this task is proving to be much more difficult than originally anticipated. Therefore, the only perk we can offer at this time is a huge heartfelt thank you from our organization. 

 

The Impact

To give one a sense of urgency, a study was conducted at the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation. The following statistics were pulled from that paper:

  • Ninety two adults or 68 percent of the adult participants had evidence of gum disease and 16 percent showed signs of an advanced problem. Gum disease can lead to a loss of teeth and can put people at risk for other serious health problems like heart disease.
  • One child and five adults were found to have signs of a precancerous condition of the mouth. If left untreated, such a condition can progress to full-fledged cancer.
  • The high prevalence of decay and gum disease suggests that many participants had chronic pain that could interfere with daily activities.
  • About half the adults in the study had missing teeth and two had no teeth at all.

We are reminded of the age old question; which came first? The chicken or the egg? Poor oral health has been directly linked to reduced GPA's and increased school absences. This in turn eventually leads to depressed household incomes and thereby directly oppressing future generations from obtaining good oral health and stellar grades in school. Help pReservation32 keep these kids excelling in school.

At pReservation32, we have heard the call to action and we are building our resources to respond to this crisis. However, in order to achieve any progress we must build capital. Please help us reach our first fundraising campaign goal.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help financially, that doesn’t mean you cannot help:

You have friends who may not stumble upon this campaign. Please use Indeigogo share tools to get the word out that we are in need of initial funding. Thank you for reading and putting in the effort to spread the word.

If you are a Native American artist, or know of one, please contact us. We would love the opportunity to speak with you about creating "perks" for our organization.

To give one a sense of urgency, a study was conducted at the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation. The following statistics were pulled from that paper:

Ninety two adults or 68 percent of the adult participants had evidence of gum disease and 16 percent showed signs of an advanced problem. Gum disease can lead to a loss of teeth and can put people at risk for other serious health problems like heart disease.
One child and five adults were found to have signs of a precancerous condition of the mouth. If left untreated, such a condition can progress to full-fledged cancer.
The high prevalence of decay and gum disease suggests that many participants had chronic pain that could interfere with daily activities.
About half the adults in the study had missing teeth and two had no teeth at all.

We are reminded of the age old question; which came first? The chicken or the egg? Poor oral health has been directly linked to reduced GPA's and increased school absences. This in turn eventually leads to depressed household incomes and thereby directly oppressing future generations from obtaining good oral health and stellar grades in school. Help pReservation32 keep these kids excelling in school.
At pReservation32, we have heard the call to action and we are building our resources to respond to this crisis. However, in order to achieve any progress we must build capital. Please help us reach our first fundraising campaign goal.


 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot help financially, that doesn’t mean you cannot help:
You have friends who may not stumble upon this campaign. Please use Indeigogo share tools to get the word out that we are in need of initial funding. Thank you for reading and putting in the effort to spread the word.
If you are a Native American artist, or know of one, please contact us. We would love the opportunity to speak with you about creating "perks" for our organization.

story:
My Vision- My Book, Soul's Illumination

Hi, I’m Mara Momsen. I have heard that our greatest challenges in life can be our greatest gifts. I am passionate about sharing my life lessons with other abuse survivors so they may recover with more ease, grace and less pain. I will share my journey, accumulated knowledge, exercises and wisdom to help others in the healing process.

You might be asking why my book is different from all the other self-help books. I offer a unique look into the physiology of abuse. I give the reader an understanding and insight into the mind and brain function of the abuse survivor. Knowledge is power. If we understand why we have certain behaviors it makes it that much easier to change them. Do you know every time you have a thought the body produces chemicals that are sent to every cell if your body within seconds. These are our emotions.

My book will stand out from the other self-help books because I am going to include a companion hypnotherapy CD. Each chapter will have a corresponding track that will help eliminate blockages and take the healing to a deeper level.  

The information I am sharing will help transform survivors into thrivers. We all deserve the chance to thrive. I am confident that I can help change the landscape of abuse recovery in this country. I need a platform to do this from and that platform is my book. Please help me fulfill my destiny.

Why I need your help

Your contribution will go directly to my book coach and nothing else. This is my first book and having guidance makes all the difference in the world. My coach has guided many people to the best sellers list and I want to be the next one. My target goal covers the cost of my book coach for six weeks. That is less than one third of my contract so anything over my target is very much appreciated. Actually, any contribution is greatly appreciated!

I am determined to get this project done one way or another. Your help will make the next phase of the journey a little (a lot) easier. I am forever grateful; not only for myself but for all the lives you will help me touch.

What will you get in return?

I am just finishing a transformational phycology program at the Southwest Institute of the Healing Arts and learned some new healing modalities. I want to gift all who help me by helping you reach your goals and dreams. Life coaching helps you stay on track to reach you goals while hypnotherapy helps address any unconscious resistance. Toe reading is as fun as it is informative. You will be amazed at what your toes are trying to tell you. Stepping into your power hypnotherapy track will leave you feeling good about yourself. And you can share it with your friends if you want.

Just a little more help : )

Every contribution helps, even if you can give just $5. You can also help by spreading the word. Please send the following link to everyone you know, I am forever grateful: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/310909/x/2090002

story:
Abstract Video

A campaign to raise honorariums for writers contributing to an edited collection on abstraction in contemporary video art (forthcoming UCPress).

Abstract Video will be the first collection to explore abstraction in contemporary moving image art. Assembled writers are specialists in their fields, coming together to contribute to this groundbreaking publication to be published by the esteemed University of California Press.

Why Abstract Video?

After an extensive search for writing on topics contained in this book, I realized that for the most part, it doesn't exist, and should. Words like ‘abstract’ and ‘video’ are bandied about quite often in the art world without a thorough examination of what these terms mean in relation to each other and how they have changed over time. This book seeks to explore different instances and aspects of abstraction in moving image artworks and to tell the story of the different ways the abstract ‘means’ now in regards to the moving image.

Abstract Video, How?

While academic presses generally don’t pay contributors to edited volumes, I am committed to raising funds to pay writers honorariums for producing these critical essays.

Abstract Video, What?

TABLE OF CONTENTS:

INTRODUCTION - Abstract Video, Gabrielle Jennings, Editor

SECTION ONE: HISTORY

Film Image Electronic Image: The Construction of Abstraction, 1960 - 1990, John G. Hanhardt (reprint)

Color coordinates with TV: Joseph Kosuth's 'Second Investigation' in Vancouver (1969), John Welchman

Abstract Transmissions: Other Trajectories for Feminist Video, Siona Wilson

SECTION TWO: FORMALISM

Visual Music's Influence on Contemporary Abstraction, Cindy Keefer

Electronic Alchemists: the Legacy of Abstract Cinema and Technology in the 20th Century, Edwin Stirman

Getting Messy: Chance and Glitch in Contemporary Video Art, Gregory Zinman

Abstraction in Experimental Film, Expanded Cinema, and New Media, Johanna Gosse, Jihoon Felix Kim and Edward Shanken.

net.video.art, virtual round table, Sarah Cook, Tilman Baumgärtel, Caitlin Jones

Interactive Abstractions - Between Embodied Exploration and Instrumental Control 'underneath your fingertips', Katja Kwastek

Video Art in the Public Sphere, tba

SECTION THREE: BEYOND IMAGES

Video Space without the Renaissance, Jeremy Gilbert-Rolfe

Abstraction of the Time Space Continuum, Diana Thater

Fractured Narrative in Contemporary Video Art, Söke Dinkla

Color as Metaphor, Maria-Christina Villaseñor

Go With the (unregulated) Flow - Fluidity, Abjection and Abstraction, Trinie Dalton and Stanya Kahn

Sine Qua Son: Considering the Sine Wave in Video Art, Philip Brophy


Help Abstract Video!

I need your donation, small or large, to bring this pioneering volume to fruition. I’ve worked hard to assemble a stellar group of writers and to secure a respected publisher. There are three ways you can show your support and get involved:

1. Contribute financially - perks
$25 – A signed thank you postcard of the cover of the book.
$100 – A signed copy of the softcover book.
$500 – A signed copy of the hardcover edition.

$1000 – Special acknowledgement in the book, access to the companion website with video clips to accompany each essay, a signed thank you postcard of the cover of the book and a signed hardcover book. (disclaimer: the website is expected, but not confirmed) And... everlasting gratitude!

$5000 – Special acknowledgement in the book, access to the companion website, a print from the original video used for the background of this campaign and a signed hardcover book. (disclaimer: the website is expected, but not confirmed) And... everlasting gratitude!

2. Share the campaign with others
Please share this campaign as widely as possible. The Indiegogo share tools under the video at the top of this page make this simple.

3. Share your expertise
We welcome any offers of help with this project. What’s your passion? Research? Promotions? Publishing or web development? Indexing, proofing, translating?

Abstract Video, $20,000?!

Up to the initial $20,000 target, funds will be allocated as follows:
- $1000 honorariums to each of 13-15 volume contributors

- $2000 translations and indexing

- $2200 accessioning image permissions

- $800 - indiegogo fees

Anything raised over $20,000 allows us to consider:
- Fees to artists and galleries for video clips to be accessible on a website to accompany the book. This prospect is especially exciting because often video art isn’t available to scholars and educators for extended and close study. The idea is for a clip from all works discussed in the book to be available along with the texts, on a website.

Abstract Video, Who?

Editor: Gabrielle Jennings, Assistant Chair, Associate Professor, Graduate Studies Art Department, Art Center College of Design, Pasadena.

Publishing Experience:

2003 - Private Landscapes: Modernist Gardens in Southern California, (Princeton Architectural Press), Pamela Burton, Marie Botnick and Kathryn Smith. (acquiring image rights, archiving materials and related communication management).

1999 – Beauty and the Contemporary Sublime, (Allworth Press), Jeremy Gilbert-Rolfe. (copy-editing, acquiring image rights, archiving materials and related communication management)

I am a persistent, engaged artist, scholar and writer with knowledge and experience in both the academic and artistic realms. I have taught and produced film and video art for nearly two decades, and currently I direct graduate students in writing their Master’s Theses as well as conducting studio visits throughout their candidacy, participating in reviews and helping to manage this renowned program.

Writers: A group of esteemed scholars, curators, writers, and artists, assembled from at least five countries. (see table of contents)

Abstract Video, Please Contribute!

I believe writers should be paid for their work. They are the heart and soul of this book; the book couldn't exist without them and their expertise, talent, enthusiasm and time. Please support this critical collection of texts on an underrepresented topic: Abstract Video.

Connect with us via:

Email: abstractvideo1@gmail.com

Thank you for your support; we look forward to hearing from you.

Special thanks to Sasha Freedman for shooting and editing the indiegogo video with patience, a positive attitude and generosity of time and expertise.

Disclaimer: Manuscript is subject to peer review through UCPress, all perks will be null and void if final manuscript never goes to print. I will do my utmost to see that the book is successfully printed and released as represented and on time. Writers listed are confirmed, however all rights are reserved in regards to changes to book contents.

story:
Our campaign:

"Sidney and Vicky Dine around the World" is a non-fiction picture book that explores table etiquette in various countries through the eyes of Sydney and Vicky- two eight year old friends.  Sydney is a book-worm who is constantly trying to gain more knowledge.  Vicky is a happy-go-lucky, adventurous girl, who possesses a special power.  The two friends embark on a magical journey around the world to discover different eating customs.  It has been written, revised, revamped, and tweaked with the authors paying attention to detail. Much love has been put into this book! The book is written in rhyming couplets utilizing a repetitive line that enables young children to join in with the chorus.  This book is the first book in our Around the World Series (5 more exciting titles are on the way!).  We have chosen to produce a limited edition author illustrated version of "Sydney and Vicky Dine around the World" for our Indiegogo family.  We are currently working to complete illustrations for the book and get it ready for self-publishing; although our ultimate goal is to find a publisher for our series- only our manuscripts will be submitted to publishers.

What you will help us achieve:

You will help us get our book in the hands of children around the world; spreading knowledge and appreciation of a multicultural world to young learners.

The Writers:

Kristin Halligan is an educator and mother residing in Northern Thailand.  She holds a B.A. in Sociology and a Masters degree in International Education.  Kristin is a self acclaimed cultural anthropologist and travel enthusiast.  She is fluent in Thai and loves to explore culture through linguistics.  When Kristin has free time she enjoys writing children’s books, jogging, swimming, cooking with her family and playing with her animals.  

Alana Fischer has been a lover of the arts all her life.  She grew up drawing, painting and sculpting.  Later in life she turned her interest to other forms of art such as drama, writing, and music.  She loves travel and has been exploring Asia while teaching English for the past three years.  Alana holds a B.A. in Philosophy and a B.F.A. In her spare time Alana loves studying up on vegan nutrition, practicing yoga, writing children’s books, and singing karaoke.

Funding

We have decided that we would like to find a publisher for our series.  However, if we do not find a publisher in a specific amount of time, we will self publish.  While we look for a publisher we will be preparing the book for self publishing.  The money that we raise will cover the cost of producing our own illustrations and self publishing expenses. The contributions will also cover the expenses of hiring an editor to provide a general critique on the strengths and weaknesses of our book.  We will hire a line editor as well.  Any additional funds will be used for marketing. 

What You Get

Choose from our many perk options:

Two collages of illustrations in e-poster format

A cookbook highlighting our favorite recipes from around the world.  This cookbook includes vegetarian, non-vegetarian, vegan and raw vegan dishes.

A coloring book based on the final illustrations from Sidney and Vicky Dine Around the World

Sidney and Vicky Dine Around the World in ebook format

Original artwork from the book

Original custom artwork of your favorite international meal 

The Impact

The goal of our book, "Sidney and Vicky Dine Around the World", is to encourage an interest in multiculturalism and travel in young children in a fun and engaging way. We show children that there are many different ways to dine around the world (politely). Practices that may be acceptable in one part of the world are a social taboo in another place.

Other Ways to Help

There are many ways to help contribute to this project.  We are so grateful to everyone who makes a financial contribution by purchasing one of our perks. We are equally grateful to everyone who contributes to the project by helping us spread the word. The more people who see our campaign the better.  If you know anyone who is interested in multiculturalism, travel for youth, children's literature, rhyming books, international dining or who has or knows small children, please send them the URL of our campaign.  And hey, if you have any connections in the publishing world send them the URL!  Don't forget the convenience of Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

In this book by celebrity psychic and super podcaster, Laura Powers shares her tips on how to launch, grow, and monetize your podcast! Laura breaks down the podcast launch, step by step, to make the process as smooth and seamless as possible. The book provides simple tools and templates, so you don’t have to reinvent the wheel, as well as guidance and resources for editing, designing, creating quality audio content, and distribution. Readers will learn various ways to make money from their podcasts and how to leverage their show as a platform-building tool. Even if you don’t want to host a podcast, this book will include dos and don’ts for how to get onto other people’s podcasts and  various types of media.

The book also features chapters with incredible podcast knowledge from several podcast influencers and teachers including:

  • Adam Schaeuble: The PHD (Previously Heavy Dude) and host of the top-ranked fitness podcast, Million Pound Mission, and the podcast on podcasting, Casting the Pod.
  • Allison Melody: Podcast host, film and television producer, author, international speaker, and host of the popular Food Heals podcast.
  • Jessica Kupferman: Marketing and sales expert, host of She Podcasts podcast, group, and the live podcast conference.
  • Marisa Imôn: Musician, voice-over artist, comedic motivational speaker, and host of the podcast Incandescent: An Unconventional Meditation Podcast.
  • Wendy Myers: #1 Bestselling author, detox expert, host of the Myers Detox Podcast, and the SuperCharged podcast.

Photo and Draft Cover by  dlartphoto.com

Who is Laura Powers?

Laura is a Celebrity Psychic who has been featured by The Ron Burgundy Podcast with Will Ferrell, Buzzfeed, NBC, ABC, CBS, FOX, Motherboard by Vice Magazine, The Jet Set TV show and many others. She is the author of seven other books. Laura has years of podcasting experience and has been hosting and producing podcasts for over nine years. She hosts and produces several popular podcasts including, Healing Powers Podcast, a mind-body-spirit podcast, and Behind the Scenes with Laura Powers, on film and television.  

Laura Powers is a host, psychic medium, writer, actress, producer, writer, and speaker who helps others receive guidance and communicate with loved ones. She travels nationally and internationally for clients, events, television appearances, and speaking engagements. She is passionate about helping others launch and grow their podcasts and generate business.

To see Laura doing her work, you can watch this Buzzfeed video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2eq5Zw_wmzg. Here is a short video reel of several of Laura’s TV appearances: https://youtu.be/M_pdEI9Kv0E For more information on Laura Powers psychic work, go to www.healingpowers.net, and for more details on her podcast and business coaching, go to www.powershour.biz.

What We Need & What You Get

Professional editing of the manuscript, cover photo, and using 99 Designs, printing of the book, and formatting of the book in e-book formats for the kindle and other ereaders (Mobi and epub format).  This budget covers getting the book print-ready, printing, and e-publishing only.  Every dollar we raise above the budget will be used to produce the audiobook, and additional funds will be used to promote the book!

*Proposed budget of what funds will be used for:

  • Library of Congress Registration $50
  • Cover Design and layout $500 (draft cover and photo by dlartphoto.com)
  • Printing and shipping $300
  • Formatting $200
  • Professional editing $300

Total print book estimates $1350

  • Optional Audio Book Production $600 or more

Total budget $1950

Note: These are all estimated expenses

What You Get

In addition to the e-book and hard copy, various perk levels include Laura’s Marketing Program, 9 Week Podcasting Course, one-one-one podcast coaching sessions, and a free surprise bonus gift!

The Impact

story:
The purpose of this fundraiser is to raise money to pay contributors to They Have to Take You In, a family themed anthology. The royalties from a previous Hidden Brook Press anthology, That Not Forgotten, are being donated to the Al Purdy A-Frame Trust. The success of the Purdy book inspired publisher Richard Grove and editor Ursula Pflug to do a second fundraiser anthology, this time to benefit families in transition. Monies recieved will be disbursed by the CMHA's Dana Fund. 

"The Dana Fund was created in July of 2010 at the Canadian Mental Health Agency (CMHA HKPR) in Peterborough Ontario, at the suggestion of friends and family who wished to make donations in her memory. Dana Tkachenko inspired many people through her own experiences of struggling against tremendous obstacles and succeeding in creating a stable and fulfilling life for herself and her family.  Dana’s memory is honoured through the Dana Fund, by dedicating donations to the cause of supporting young women and families in transition, experiencing similar challenges, who could benefit from some help along the way." - Gord Langill

This book was conceived as a response to the provincial government’s planned elimination of sixty-seven million dollars in funding, including the Community Start-Up and Maintenance Benefit. The benefit existed to help people receiving assistance pay first and last month's rent, buy furniture, and change locks. Approximately 16,000 Ontarians accessed the CSUMB each month; without it, many families are now forced into homelessness.

Because all royalties from They Have to Take You In will go to benefiting women and families, we are fundraising to pay honorariums to contributors. Hidden Brook Press has generously committed to covering all publication costs! Our sincerest thanks to them.

Perhaps even more important than the fundraiser itself is the awareness we hope to raise. So please, tell your family, your neighbour, your co-workers, your friends!

Writers who have generously contributed books to our fundraiser include Jan Thornhill, Linda Rogers, Leanne Simpson, They Have to Let You In editor Ursula Pflug and publisher Richard Grove. Writers whose work will appear in the anthology include Tapanga Koe, Linda Rogers, Jan Thornhill, Silvia Moreno Garcia, Leanne Simpson, Tapanga Koe and more. A three month reading period opened on March 15 to fill the remaining spots.

Next time you’re thinking of swinging by Timmy’s, think instead of the families forced into shelters; plan to make yourself a cuppa’ Joe at home, and donate!

Please check back often to bas new prizes become available!  

The Death of the Hired Man
by Robert Frost

Home is the place where, when you have to go there,

  

They have to take you in.

  

 

For more information on what the Community Start-Up and Maintenance Benefit was and who it helped visit: CSUMB

story:
Holy Ascension Orthodox Mission and bookshop is for people interested in English Language Orthodox Christianity. Standing outside national ghettos and unedifying sectarian polemics, it looks forward to the flowering of an authentic Orthodox spirituality on Australian soil

After working hard for the last 4 years and planning for our own bookshop and cafe, it  has now come to fruition at 1/323 Ingles St Port Melbourne

Even though we have a small selection of books, icons and other religious items, we really need people's support to buy more stock and create a vibrant bookshop. The bookshop is an important stepping stone towards establishing an Orthodox Church in Melbourne worshipping in the English language.

We ask your assistance to help fund this venture and provide us with working capital to buy stock. We do not have other overheads as the premises is manned by volunteers and there is no rent or other outgoings as these are kindly paid for by a generous benefactor

Any size contributions are most welcome and you will receive a certificate of appreciation from the mission to confirm your support, as well as a plaque to be located within the bookshop to acknowledge your kind contribution and our gratitude and prayers - may the Lord Jesus Christ pay it back to you 100 fold.

While all contributions are very welcome, please keep in mind that we are not a tax-exempt entity at the moment and therefore are unable to issue tax-deductible receipts.

story:
My name is Kerry Pastine and I’m writing a book!

How many of us have struggled with our self-image?  How many of us have found ourselves repeating the same negative and stifling thoughts, behaviors and outcomes?  All of us have, and it has affected our relationships, money, food, time or work.

As a life and business coach for the last 15 years, my passion has been to teach, reveal and ignite how we can take our lives back and feel a deep peace and contentment within.  

I have been asked for years to write a book and the idea always appealed to me, but I was always too busy coaching to dedicate the time to a book project. So instead, I would write articles when time allowed.  

Because balance creates health, I too had to tap into in my own creative dreams, constantly setting the example and inspiring my clients.  Still, I kept telling myself that one day I would write that book!

Over the years, I felt a growing need to help on a bigger scale. I have coached so many people burdened with anxiety, fear and stress, including a new wave of younger clients and realized things need to change for these kids.  I wasn't interested in public speaking, as the process of self-discovery is so personal and requires going within, asking the right questions, as well as taking time to listen and reflect. I thought, "How can I reach more people effectively?"  Time to write the book!

As you can imagine, writing a book requires time and focus.  I'm still trying to coach to pay the bills, but hunkering down to make this happen is what's important.  I'm collaborating with Indiegogo.com to help me write this book in months, rather than waiting for a publishing house to get it printed and to the shelves that could take years.  

Self-publishing the book will take a lot of hard work, financial investment and marketing on my part, but it's in my hands and I can get it out there with your help!  If you choose to help me with this crowd-funding experience, I want you to feel valued and inspired.  With a contribution, of course you will receive the book with the option of choosing a digital edition or the physical book.  

Another way that I will give back to you is by offering my unique "one liners" that I often spout out in a session or on Facebook.  My clients love them and I wanted to share them with everyone. So I've partnered with a professional graphic designer to create sets of limited edition quotation art that you can receive for higher contributions to my project.  

You have the option to choose from one or more professionally printed pieces. We have created a Zen series, a Contemporary art series and a groovy Mod series that are all fabulous!  You can gift them, hang them in your home or office or use them as a screen saver.  They remind us to be great!  Please take a look at the different pledge opportunities, as there are several ways to contribute.  You can be sure I will give back and stay connected with you throughout the process.

I think it's important for all people to have access to the tools to create a healthy life. For the many who cannot afford a one-on-one coaching session, they will now have the opportunity to buy or be given the gift of a personal workbook that allows them to go within and take their life back.  If we can have awareness and clarity about how we happened, then we certainly need the action and tools to course correct.  "Know Thyself" gives us just that.  

Are you ready to take your life back?

The Perks

The Contemporary Set:

  • "Imagine the dynamic that is uniquely you. What do you result in?"
  • "Your relationship with yourself determines your relationship with everything. Pretty cool, huh?"
  • "Thinking about the things we want rewires the brain and gives us instant excitement. Can you feel it?"

The Mod Set:

  • "Stop talking yourself out of what's next."
  • "Your dream is where passion is ignited."
  • "Redesign your experience on your terms."

The Zen Set:

  • "Life is not happening to you. You are not the leaf blowing in the wind. You are the tree. Stand tall."
  • "Don't expect others to behave in order for you to have a good time. Just decide to have a good time."
  • "Emotions are our compass. If we listen, they can save us from pain. Listen more. Run, talk, spend less."

Thank You

Thanks to each of you for taking the time to look at this page and for considering making a contribution.  I would also like to thank my clients for all that they've taught me and for offering their beautiful testimonials.  

I'm grateful for all of the royalty free stock photos and video that were so easily available to me in producing the video and helping me share my story.  All of the video content was used according to the royalty agreements to the best of my knowledge.  Special thanks goes to Louie Schwartzberg (http://louieschwartzberg.deviantart.com/) for all of the amazing video footage.

story:
Wolf Pack Justice


We are a group of five people hoping to get justice, not just for ourselves but for a host of others whose names are, as yet, unknown to us and may never be known, but they will get justice too. If we win.

 

It started with me, which is why I am the one writing the story, but we are all equally involved we all have the same story.

 

Last summer I entered what seemed to be a legit writing competition. Novels were to be submitted. It stated in the rules that they had to previously unpublished.  I received an email about it, after clicking on a link on a social networking site. I had an almost finished MS and  it was 2 months till the deadline, I finished the novel, edited it, and entered it. The first prize was a publishing contract. I never expected to win and guess what, I never heard back, so I figured I hadn’t made the cut. Fair enough.  It ought to be mentioned that the competition appeared to be endorsed by a celebrity (although looking back at it the name had been spelled slightly wrong. I admit, I never noticed at the time)

 

I decided to self-publish, until a friend of mine, impatient to see the book told me she had found it already on Amazon. Naturally, I told her she was wrong, I had not got around to it yet, but I took a look anyway. She was right. It was my book. The title was the same, but the author name was different. It was a slightly mangled version of my own name and it had been published by a small publishing firm. I looked at their website and my book was on sale there too. Along with a few others. Just a few I might add – maybe 10 or 12. Not very many.

 

I then did a title search and found it for sale on other sites too, all with the same mangled version of my name and all apparently from the same small publishing firm.

 

I contacted them and was told the book was their property now and to drop it or risk being sued. I also received a pretty snotty email purportedly from a solicitor warning me not to publish the book myself as it no longer belonged to me.

 

I suppose I could have left it at that, but I didn’t see why I should. I was pretty sure what they were doing was illegal and it occurred to me that the only people who had had access to my book were the one’s running that competition. The name was different, but it seemed logical. I then started to think that maybe I wasn’t the only one.

I searched for the other authors, using keywords from the titles of the other novels on the site, the author names (I tried a few permutations of their names, remembering how my own name had been slightly changed as the author name -  an example would be Alice instead of Alicia or Mark for Marcus) and from the synopses of the books. I was hoping to come across social networking accounts or writing blogs that mentioned the books and would give me a way to contact the real authors. It was a long shot, but it actually worked. I found someone. Their blog was all about a book they were hoping to publish, never realising that it already had been without their permission. They too had entered the bogus competition.  To cut a long story short, between us we found 3 other victims of this scam and we know there are more out there who have no idea. We haven’t given up hope of finding them, but even if we don’t, we intend to get justice for them all. But with 5 of us all with the same story, we have now got a pretty good case to present.

 

Our lawyer thinks so too, but that doesn’t mean he is willing to represent us for free.

If we want to litigate we need funds. But you knew that, why else would we be telling our story here?

At $100 an hour legal representation does not come cheap – even splitting the costs between us. We also need money to file suit in the first place. We can probably scrape that up – but without the money to pay the piper, there would be no point.

 

At this point the firm who scammed us is still out there doing the same thing to others, and selling books they have no right to sell, and until we take them on legally we can’t even name and shame them in case of a slander suit against us. They have no idea we are planning to take this to court . I hope it comes as a huge shock to them.

 

The nitty gritty – we have been told that it will cost up to and maybe a little over $20,000 to bring these weasels to justice and make them pay up. I am sure that is why they believe they can get away with it. Not many people have that kind of money lying around – we certainly don’t But it isn’t even about the money for us. We just want our books back. I want the right to publish my own book that I worked hard on – that’s what we all want.

 

We are aiming this campaign at $5,000 to get us started. With that we can file suit and give our lawyer a retainer to get the party started. We know this might well be a long hard fight, it might even be a losing fight in the end, but we are determined to see it through. We stand together.

Any money that does not get used in the lawsuit will be used to set up a foundation and website to help other indie authors who find themselves in this situation.

 

Please help us see that these unscrupulous people do not get away with stealing our work and that of others.

 

Yours sincerely

 

The Wolf Pack (Friends in adversity – friends for life)

 

Find us on Twitter @StoneWolfPack and help us spread the word.

The nitty gritty – we have been told that it will cost up to and maybe a little over $20,000 to bring these weasels to justice and make them pay up. I am sure that is why they believe they can get away with it. Not many people have that kind of money lying around – we certainly don’t But it isn’t even about the money for us. We just want our books back. I want the right to publish my own book that I worked hard on – that’s what we all want.
 
We are aiming this campaign at $5,000 to get us started. With that we can file suit and give our lawyer a retainer to get the party started. We know this might well be a long hard fight, it might even be a losing fight in the end, but we are determined to see it through. We stand together.
Any money that does not get used in the lawsuit will be used to set up a foundation and website to help other indie authors who find themselves in this situation.
 
Please help us see that these unscrupulous people do not get away with stealing our work and that of others.
 
Yours sincerely
 
The Wolf Pack (Friends in adversity – friends for life)
 
Find us on Twitter @StoneWolfPack and help us spread the word.

story:
My Name Is Joe Cintron;

I'm a 47-year-old C4-C5 quadriplegic (paralyzed from the neck down).

I am writing this in the hope of receiving assistance in the form of a grant, gift or individual donationsorto acquire a (much needed) wheelchair van.

Allow me to share with you a little about myself. In 1981 I was a 16 year young junior at Norristown High School, in Norristown, Pennsylvania. I had dreams of going to college, playing football and if lucky, making it to the NFL.

I thought my life was great until on one tragic night in December of 1981, at a friend's party, I fell out of a 2nd floor window, suffering a broken neck.

For the last 30 years I've been living at home being taken care of by my mother. My mother has been here doing everything for me from the very beginning.

She has literally made me her life. She washes me, feeds me, and exercises me. You name it, my (single parent) mother does it. 

The way we currently travel is by car. We require help by a family member or friend and the two become my personal lift.

With the car not being wheelchair accessible, it really is a task lifting, bending and maneuvering my body in and out of the car. 

Well, with 30 years gone by, we both are older and I'm much heavier. It is really becoming a burden on my 66-year-old mother to constantly lift me.

After all she has done for me, I would love to be able to tell her, "Mom, we have a brand new wheelchair van!!!"

If there are folks out there who have it in their power to help my mother and me, we both would really appreciate it. Thank you for reading this and for any help you can offer.

You can also contribute by check. Go to any

Wells Fargo Bank - "Juanita Cintron / Van For Joey Cintron"

 

Link to his Facebook  https://www.facebook.com/joe.cintron

Link to his Twitter https://twitter.com/#!/JoeCintron703

story:
1. A short summary:  

As a middle school teacher and mom of four, I know that students appreciate literature when they connect to it.  I observe and listen to my own children and my students, and find them to be rather truthful, funny, complicated, and bright people.  The characters in my novel reflect what I've learned from teens.  Of course the teacher in me was compelled to incorporate SAT vocabulary words, along with some contemporary dilemmas to give my readers something to ponder.  Your contribution will definitely make the publication of Journey's Lesson happen in the professional manner in which I have been envisioning for quite some time.

2. The funding will cover: I will need $2,000 for the cost of publishing Journey's Lesson.  This money will cover: Publication, Layout, Cover Design, Back Design, Book size 5.5"x8.5", the ISBN Number, and Shipping.


3. The Impact:  Journey's Lesson will cause readers to think about how gossip and bullying affect people's lives.

Other themes, such as teens' relationships with family and peers, along with  public policy issues also surface in this novel.  While digesting the impact of these significant concerns, readers will be exposed to over 100 SAT vocabulary words that are bold-faced throughout the novel.  The rich characters and plot events in Journey's Lesson, plus the enriched vocabulary, combine to make this book not only a teaching tool, but a memorable and entertaining reading experience.

I've been a teacher for over two decades, and I make up stories on the spot with our vocabulary words, perform poetry, and have even rapped in front of my school during assembly programs.  Many of my students, and especially my own children,  have encouraged me to write a novel.  It's going to be so exciting to finally share Journey's Lesson with them!

Other Ways You Can Help: Even if you are unable to financially contribute to the publication of Journey's Lesson, you can still help the process.  Here's how:  Go Tell It on the Mountain!  Tell people about the book.  Be a promoter.  Encourage others to donate.  I'd really appreciate it; but more importantly, my future readers will benefit from the experience.
Thanks to everyone who is helping me to get Journey's Lesson into the hands of readers.

story:
Our Story 

Tjeko is a social-profit organization founded for the children of Uganda. We want to give these children - children living the lives of adults - the opportunity to be a child, to play and to laugh out loud. Because every child has the right to enjoy being young. Every child should have a childhood.


After many years of working in Uganda, we're writing our first children's book called The Birthday Party!

What Is Our Book About?

One day Tjeka discovers something really really sad. Her friend Anacheza has never had a birthday party, ever! Anacheza doesn’t even know when she was born, so she can't celebrate her birthday.


Tjeka thinks this is unbelievable, and together with all her friends from Fun Village she decides to do something about it!


But in the preparation of the birthday party everything seems to go wrong! The friends are determined - and the party turns out to be... like no other party ever celebrated. 


The Impact

The profits from the sale of this book will go towards funding projects benefiting children in Uganda. The book itself will also be used in schools in Uganda as part of an educational curriculum.


What We Need & What You Get

We're looking for funds to hire Guillaume Girault, our freelance Tjeko designer,  and a professional illustrator, and funds for promotion, marketing, and publishing. We'd also like to distribute our book to at least 2000 children in Uganda.  Once the book is available for purchase, for every 1 book sold to a 'western' child we can give 2 books to Ugandan children!

 

Perks

$25 - receive the PDF version of the book, before it's even published!


$50 - receive the PDF version of the book, and a special mention in our Thank You video!


$100 - receive a free hard copy of the book, signed by the main character, Anacheza, herself! :)


$125 - a special spot in 'the Birthday Party" will be dedicated to your...CHILD, GRANDCHILD, NEPHEW or NIECE! 


$500 - a framed print of an illustration from the book! (limited number available)


$1000 - your name in print in a special dedication section of the book! AND this summer Tjeko HIMSELF will thank you in a special video message, all the way from Uganda!


Bonus!

  • Every supporter will get a personal e-card from us!
  • Every supporter will get a mp3 of the Tjeko Birthday Song (Summer 2012)!
  • Every supporter will get a GREAT feeling of helping children in Uganda feel GREAT! 


Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on Twitter @Tjeko or Facebook.com/TjekoFunVillage for updates!
