story:
Without hesitation, I will say, "This book just might change everything."

105,000.  Search "leadership" on Amazon and that's what you'll get in your results.  So the big question is why the heck does the world need another book about leadership?

Simple:

  • This book doesn't exist yet.
  • Short and right to the point, for leaders who don't have a lot of  time to read.
  • This book is honest and candid, including my own failures and successes.
  • Young leaders need a fresh approach.
  • Too many leaders are selfish
  • Teenagers a dying for something authentic and straightforward(that isn't a "teen version" of an adult book).
  • Young adults are bored with the same 10 leadership books.

Leadership is something I love studying. For the past 20 years, I've watched and learned from people leading me, authors writing on the subject, and speakers teaching about leadership. It's in my blood. I've read countless books, listened to countless speeches, watched countless men and women lead groups that I've been a part of.

I am, without question, convinced  that I am on to something fresh and new with this book. This just might change everything.

The timeline: 

8/29- send final text to editor

9/7- review prototypes of cover art

9/14- rewrite portions according to editor's recommendations

9/21- send final text to layout designer in Michigan

9/21- receive final cover art from designer

9/28- send final layout of book to printer

10/20- receive and review mock-up of book

11/10- receive first shipment of book

11/14- mail out YOUR copie(s) of book

I am a full time professional motivational speaker to students across the country. This is my second book. In Sept, 2011, I self-published Jigsaw(The Past, Present and Future Me) and have moved around a thousand copies thus far.

What will these funds be used for? Offsetting the costs involved with EDITING, DESIGNING,LAYOUT and PRINTING.

*If we SURPASS our goal: (these costs DON'T include the production costs) The cost to print 1,000 copies is $1800. 2,000 copies is $2300 and 3K copies is $2800. I would LOVE to print as many copies as possible. The more we bring in, the more we can print. The cheaper they are to print, the more I can GIVE AWAY to young people who can't afford them.

About Mike

Mike's website: http://mikeisspeaking.com

Motivational speaker and author Mike Hall speaks to tens of thousands of young people every year around the country. To coincide wtih his speaking, he has written Jigsaw, and now The Only 2 Words Young Leaders Must Know.

From getting picked last in gym class,  to being voted “Person Most Likely to Change the World.” by his 670 senior classmates, Mike knows about overcoming obstacles.

Mike is the real deal. One of the most genuine people you will meet, Mike is a rare find in the world of teenage motivation. Many many people have said about him that he has an incredible capacity to connect with adolescents.

Mike’s life has been a series of disappointments, joys and adventures. He draws kids in with vibrant storytelling as he captures snapshots of his own story. Bullying, peer pressure, and a search for significance were the threads that wove his life’s fabric.

Growing up in a Navy family, Mike lived in 5 different states before graduating high school. It’s never easy being the new kid in class, but over time, Mike began to see the value of getting a fresh start. He is who he is today thanks to the experiences he’s had thus far in his journey. After all, life’s a trip; not all about the destination, but what you become on your way there.

Teenagers have been his life and his passion, coming alongside them and guiding them to navigate adolescence well. Mike resides in Western North Carolina in the foothills of the Appalachian Mountains. He is an alum of Rutgers University.

What the money is for:

  • Cover design by Matt Pfalert thesilentp.com
  • Layout and design of the inside of the book
  • Editing the text
  • Printing copies of the book (the more we raise, the more we print!)

The Impact

  • Finally a short and easy to read book on leadership written JUST for young people. 
  • Training young leaders will positively affect the community they live in.
  • YOU will be making a positive impact on the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can/cannot support this project financially, you can still:

  • Share this link on facebook, twitter or email.
  • Tell anyone and everyone about this book!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Why This Indiegogo Campaign?

Hi! My name is Bruce Goldwell and I am the author of the Dragon Keepers series.  I am an independent author and thus far getting the word out about my books has been through sharing my book links with friends on Facebook and Twitter. I want to expand the circle of people that know about Dragon Keepers who could potentially become one of my fans.

One of the best ways to get the word out is via a great Press Release.  The service that Jill Lublin [author of Guerrilla Publicity] recommends is PRweb.com.  The cost to do a PR on PRweb is $499.00.  So I am coming to Indiegogo to raise the money here so I can submit a PR to PRWeb and let the world know Dragon Keepers IV is available.

What I Need & What You Get

What I need is to raise $499 to do a Press Release. Of course, any money raised above that amount will allow me to do more. 

One of the Perks is autographed copies of Dragon Keepers IV.  If you are not already a Dragon Keepers fan, why would you order book iv of the series?  Here is one author's review of DK IV.  

"With finely crafted descriptive language, the author creates the world of the River Dragons, and The Standers, who live on the shore. Kenmei and Banquai, two of the River Dragons set the scene for a battle between good and evil. Peace has reigned between the dragons, but strange dark events start to happen, and one of the dragons seems to be the cause of it all."
"This is a novel of good and evil, treachery and betrayal with strange twists and turns painted against the dream-like landscape of the dragons. Magical action and emotions swirl when Merlin, the Dragon Keeper enters the scene. With the fire and action of a dragon’s breath, Merlin faces his dark, shadowy enemy...and eventually Blackpatch, pirates, and others. Thrilling fiery magical action and adventure! Five Stars and Two Thumbs up!" (Review by PanOrpheus, author of the ‘Delphic Oracle ‘series of metaphysical historical fantasy fiction)

 

Another Perk is an autographed Postcard with the Lady of the Lake (Artist, Ruth Thompon).    

UNIQUE GIFT or COLLECTORS ITEM: The Lady of the Lake postcards will become a collectors item you can charish for years or a great gift for a friend.

The Impact

I can't get the books to the Best Sellers list without the help of my fans and others.  

You can help by letting others know about this Indiegogo campaign.

INCENTIVE BONUS:

Be one of the 1st 25 people to reserve an autographed copy of Dragon Keepers IV and get an Autographed Lady of the Lake Postcard too.  Each card will be made unique by having a special note just for you on the card. Or you can name someone you want the card sent to and have it mailed directly to them as a gift.  When the deadline for the campaign passes, you will be asked who to make the card out to.  But to get one, you have to be one of the first 25 people to reserve a copy of DK IV [Perk #2].  Make your selection now so you don't forget and miss out later.  Thanks for your support.

IMPORTANT NOTE:  

You may want to purchase books I, II & III to catch up with the story and Merlin's adventures before receiving book IV.  Vist Bruce Goldwell's web site to read previews and order these books.

story:
It's been on my mind for a very long time. I always wanted to do this. Time constrain kept me from doing this. The whole journey takes up 3 separate train journey and lasted about 3 nights and 2 days.

 
The first train will set off from Singapore at slightly before midnight and lasted about 6 hours. I will arrived in Kuala Lumpur in the early morning. Will spend the day touring Malaysia Capital - Kuala Lumpur. Reason being the next train journey will also start at night 11pm from Kuala Lumpur and takes another 6 hours to reach Butterworth, Penang - Malaysia.
 
Upon reaching Butterworth, Penang, I will catch another train all the way to Bangkok, Thailand. This journey will takes about 23 hours.
 
So you see, the time involved and why I have not yet take this up. Beside my wife said that I am just wasting my time and I should just take a plane and reach Bangkok in just under 3 hours. Unless somehow I am able to find a sponsor for this trip. Huh?? You mean I can do that?? You are kidding me right? I ask.
 
That is before I discover Indiegogo.com
 
BAM! An idea struck me. I finally have a way to let my wife have no reasons not to let me go. Hey, if this journey are funded by so many people, this is a commitment that I have to fulfilled and she will no longer have any reasons to stop me from going.
 
Help me make this journey possible and help me have the memory of a lifetime. 
 
Not to mention Bragging Rights.... to my friends, relative and even my children..... or grandchildren if I am lucky.
 
Fund my trip and I will make the journey. 
 
I will setup a blog and takes lots of photo during the journey and upload live.
 
When I reach Bangkok, I will personally send a postcard to each and everyone of you who make this trip possible. Plus I will list some perks for those who sponsor more. I will send surprise gifts from Bangkok on the second day that I arrived...
 
So lets do it!!!

Will spend the day touring Malaysia Capital - Kuala Lumpur. Reason being the next train journey will also start at night 11pm from Kuala Lumpur and takes another 6 hours to reach Butterworth, Penang - Malaysia.
 
Upon reaching Butterworth, Penang, I will catch another train all the way to Bangkok, Thailand. This journey will takes about 23 hours.
 
So you see, the time involved and why I have not yet take this up. Beside my wife said that I am just wasting my time and I should just take a plane and reach Bangkok in just under 3 hours. Unless somehow I am able to find a sponsor for this trip. Huh?? You mean I can do that?? You are kidding me right? I ask.
 
That is before I discover Indiegogo.com
 
BAM! An idea struck me. I finally have a way to let my wife have no reasons not to let me go. Hey, if this journey are funded by so many people, this is a commitment that I have to fulfilled and she will no longer have any reasons to stop me from going.
 
Help me make this journey possible and help me have the memory of a lifetime. 
 
Not to mention Bragging Rights.... to my friends, relative and even my children..... or grandchildren if I am lucky.
 
Fund my trip and I will make the journey. 
 
I will setup a blog and takes lots of photo during the journey and upload live.
 
When I reach Bangkok, I will personally send a postcard to each and everyone of you who make this trip possible. Plus I will list some perks for those who sponsor more. I will send surprise gifts from Bangkok on the second day that I arrived...
 
So lets do it!!!

story:
DO YOU BELIEVE A BOOK CAN CHANGE THE WORLD?

I do.

Do you remember reading a special book when you were younger - one that changed your life.

I do.

If you believe in the power of a book, as I do, I invite you to participate in changing the life of a young reader, maybe thousands of young readers - and in saving the planet - by supporting this very special book project.

JOURNEY TO THE HEART OF THE WORLD  will be an engaging Young Adult fantasy novel based on a true story.  Christian Castagno is a teenager living in New York when his mother dies of cancer. She leaves behind an illustrated handwritten letter, written when he was conceived, describing the life adventures that await him. Chris tells the story of being led by a talking butterfly, in a series of what may or may not have been dreams, to a mystical mountain in South America where he meets a wise teacher, the elder of a lost tribe of indigenous peoples who fled the coast at the time of Columbus - a people who believe themselves to be the Heart of the World. The spiritual and environmental teachings of the shamanic elder trigger several dream-like heroic adventures through Chris’s past and future lives, including being present as the Spanish conquistadors land on the Colombian coast and participating in conversations between Thomas Edison  and Henry Ford. In the end, the hero comes to understand the true purpose of life and the prescription for saving the life of his endangered Earth Mother.

ABOUT THE AUTHOR – JOHN LUNDIN

John Lundin with the Mamos of La Sierra Nevada

I am the author of THE NEW MANDALA - Eastern Wisdom for Western Living, written in collaboration with His Holiness the Dalai Lama, a book that presented the message of the Buddha to western readers. I have recently been invited by the elders - the Mamos - of the indigenous descendants of the Tairona of the Sierra Nevada in Colombia - people who fled the Spanish invasion in the 1500s and whose culture has remain largely unchanged for five hundred years - to live with them and to learn from them and to write a book that will share their urgent message, the message that our Earth Mother is in trouble and that we are the only ones who can save her.

I have chosen to write a young adult fantasy novel, not unlike Harry Potter or Lord of the Rings or The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, one that will appeal to young adult readers since they are planet's only hope for the future. It will not be a "preachy" book, but it will be an engaging fantasy adventure story with a serious message, one that young people will want to read and one that parents and teachers will encourage them to read.

JOURNEY TO THE HEART OF THE WORLD - When a teenager from the Catskills is led by a talking butterfly to the mountain home of a lost tribe in the jungles of South America, the elders’ sacred teachings initiate dream-like adventures through his past and future lives, revealing the secrets of their spiritual and environmental message – and the purpose of life.

SCOPE OF THE PROJECT

I am currently living in Colombia, in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta, receiving sacred teachings from the shamanic elders, the Mamos, of the Kogi, the Arhuaco, the Wiwa and the Cankuamo, ancient peoples who have not changed their ways since fleeing the Spanish invasion five hundred years ago. I have been invited to live among them, to experience their culture and to learn from them. They are very suspicious of outsiders, but they know their Earth Mother is in danger of dying unless we, whom they refer to as their Young Brother, change our ways. They have asked me to listen to their plea and to write a book that will convey their urgent spiritual and environmental message to the world. This will not be a book about these profoundly spiritual people, but instead it will be a book that allows the reader to experience their message – a book that will engage the reader’s imagination in a manner that touches the heart.  It will be a book that can change young lives, and ultimately change the world.

WHAT WILL THE SUPPORT FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR?

This book project requires a great deal of travel, for visits with the indigenous elders in their secluded villages and for research in general. I am currently living in Minca, an eco-village in the foothills of La Sierra Nevada, just above the coastal city of Santa Marta.  The Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta is a unique pyramid-shaped mountain range adjacent to, but not geologically related to, the Andes. From its base at sea level the mountains rise to an altitude of 18,000 feet in just 24 miles. La Sierra contains areas of most every micro-climate on the planet, from beaches and deserts to tropical rain forest and coastal jungle to snow-capped glacial peaks. It is also one of the most bio-diverse regions in the world. The indigenous peoples have villages scattered throughout the Sierra, and move from village to village to cultivate their crops according to the altitude and changes of seasons, and to perform their Earth-saving spiritual and environmental rituals.

Travel to these secluded villages requires lengthy and arduous trips that include the hiring of off-road vehicles and drivers, and even mules and pack animals. On each of these trips I also bring food and supplies to the villagers. In addition to learning from the indigenous elders in their villages, my research for the book includes visits with local environmentalists, anthropologists, botanists and zoologists and ornithologists, and background research at various museums and conservation areas as well as to the sacred sites of the indigenous peoples. I am also employing professional translators to assist with my conversations with the indigenous peoples, and also to produce a Spanish language version of the book to be published simultaneously with the English version. The goal of this campaign is to raise $15,000, enough to cover these travel expenses for the next year of the research and writing that I anticipate will be required for completion of the book.

HOW DOES THE SUPPORT PROGRAM WORK?

The goal is to enlist Supporters who will pledge a small monthly support contribution of $10.00 in the form of a monthly Subscription, billed to your debit or credit card automactically each month.  One hundred subscribers will provide $1,000 per month,enoughto fund the travel and other expenses necessary tocomplete the research and writing of the book. You can  Subscribe easily and securely on my website, www.JohnLundin.com.

PLEASE PLEDGE YOUR SUPPORT TODAY

Please pledge your support now and participate in this effort to change young reader's lives and save the planet by Subscribing now. Each subscriber will receive a signed copy of JOURNEY TO THE HEART OF THE WORLD when published, and periodic email updates on the progress of the project. With your support, you will be partnereing withme and also taking your own step toward becoming a part of the Heart of the World yourself.

THANK YOU

story:
Did you know that the average book sells only 500 copies, with 80% of books selling less than 100 copies? UGH!

I refuse to be average.  :)

While the odds aren't on my side of becoming a bestseller-- with less than 500 titles selling more than 100,000 copies each year (less than .04%); I do think my book has a good chance of being in the top 2%--at least that's what the CEO of my publishing house told me.

To be in the top 2% of all published books, I need to sell 5,000 copies.  Preferably in a short period of time. Which may or may not sound insurmountable, depending on your perspective.

Did you know know that the publishing industry is changing so much that 99% of a publisher's budget is going toward those few titles that come from megaselling authors? 

This leaves the rest of all authors having to choose between paying for their own marketing or not having any marketing. The first choice often leads to debt and the second choice is likely to lead back to selling only 500 copies to friends and family.
 

My Book Needs Your Help...

My book Friendships Don't Just Happen! The Guide to Creating a Meaningful Circle of Girlfriends is already available for pre-order on Amazon.com and will be released on Feb. 12, 2013 by Turner Publishing.

In my humble opinion, the book is the first of its kind to offer a look at how we can create healthy platonic relationships around us in ways that support our lives.  It's not about how to meet more people, but rather about how to turn friendly people into friends that matter.  And while part of that process is about healthy expectations and appropriate steps toward bonding, much of it is about our own personal and spiritual growth. Relationships are the gymnasiums where we learn to stretch our compassion, increase vulnerability and trust, work through our fears about rejection, practice forgiveness, and let go of the need to judge others. 

I was so happy when my editor wrote, "The manuscript is awesome, by the way, and I think you've done an excellent job with flow, cohesiveness, tone, clarity of thought, and engagement. We're excited to get it to our reps! I'm thrilled to have had the privilege to be involved with this, and you've done such an impressive job in creating an honest, compelling, and helpful tool for every woman in your audience—no matter her age or life stage."

I feel confident that $10,000 can go a long ways to making these things happen.

Book marketing budgets run the gamut so it's hard to know exactly how much is necessary, but I'm going to shoot for the lowest dollar amount I think I need to get the biggest bang for my buck.  No one person can do it all so I've carefully put together a marketing plan that I believe plays to my strengths: experience on TV, skills with teaching and speaking, and access to my target market through the GirlFriendCircles.com community.

To maximize those advantages-- I need money to ensure I can create a web site for the book that will be a resource for the media, make short videos for people to share on Facebook, hire a publicist to pitch TV shows, schedule events in cities where I have a following, run contests to increase the involvement of my community, and get my book in the hands of bloggers, critics, and editors across this country.

And all of that costs extra money that I don't have.

Just one book signing event in New York City will cost me a minimum of $2,000 for travel, lodging, publicity support prior to my visit to land me as much media attention while I'm there, and any VIP events I need to throw for my fans who help sell copies of my books. That number greatly multiplies when we add Chicago, Los Angeles, and San Francisco, just as a start to my book tour.

Obviously the more books I sell, the more opportunities I will have to speak, travel, and be interviewed on the themes of this book.  And these topics will help inspire the rebuilding of the social fabric of our country in ways that we desperately need in this day and age.

Would you be willing to help this girl who refuses to be average, who has a passion to make a difference, and who has a plan to help spread the message of community, belonging, forgiveness, love, and acceptance to more people in our country?

THANK YOU!!!!

 

The Fine Print:

If I Receive More Money:  If I get more than $10,000-- I will be able to add other cities onto the book tour, each costing less since they won't have to be book launch premieres.  I'll be able to help pay for some administrative support which will keep increasing as I start to get emails from readers.  I'll be able to put together some extra resources that I can make available on my web site-- worksheets, checklists, and workbooks.  I'll also be able to host some Friendship Accelerator weekends in various cities, underwriting some of the costs.  I can use all the money that comes in, I assure you!  :)

If I Receive Less Money:  Well the good news is that even $2,000 will help since any amount I get will ensure I do one more event, one more project, one more strategy than I would have been able to do on my own.  So no money is wasted. However, as extra incentive, this crowd-funding site will take a 9% fee instead of a 4% fee if we don't reach the stated goal. So I'll cross my fingers we can reach that magic number of $10,000.

If You Feel Broke... I know the feeling! So while I hope this invitation to be generous finds you in a place where you can release $1,000-$2,000 into a project that can bring more joy and health to others, I also know that not all of us can financially support everything we believe in. It's okay!  If you know anyone who might be able to donate-- you sharing this project with them means just as much! You can use the sharing tools along the top (with the email button being the most effective).

story:
On October 31, 2013, I released the e-book edition of Ravensblood, an urban fantasy set in the Pacific Northwest and crowdfunded through Kickstarter.   (Trade paperback edition released this spring.) It garnered many glowing reviews on Amazon:

"Couldn’t put it down. . . Once I was able to read this, I couldn’t put it down. The writing style reminded me of early Andre Norton (my all time favorite author) and Andre’s books had the same effect – one becomes engaged in the plot and characters, and the settings have enough color so that your mind can picture the scenes. Hoping for a sequel! Or several…"

"Unique and engaging. . . This story had the tone of the later Harry Potter books but with obvious differences. It takes place in the U.S. and all societies, muggle and magic alike, coexist aware of one another. Of course, we don’t use muggle here. . .they are merely Mundane. The book starts in a gripping fashion only taking breaks for back story and character development, meaning you neither miss nor misunderstand the action. If you know the quirks of Portland, it even seems plausible. Scenery is excellent. Fantasy, warriors and mages with modern realism. I loved this novel."

"Darkly entertaining and enjoyable read, , , It was very easy to become immersed in this story, due to a deeply flawed but compelling character, Corwyn Ravenscroft. Definitely give this author a chance, her storytelling will draw you in. Her style is just a hint of Andre Norton, a dash of J. K. Rowling, and the tiniest pinch of Anne Rice. The rest is her own unique stamp."

"Good story set in an intriguing world  I enjoyed this story very much and was left hoping for a sequel. The story is set in a world of magic which Shawna describes wonderfully. . .Shawna is able to paint descriptive pictures with enough detail to let the reader create vivid images and yet keep a story moving at a nice pace. . .As the end of the book drew near - the pace increased and the pages grew fewer. I found myself staying up much too late wanting to finish and wondering how Shawna could bring about a conclusion without leaving me waiting for volume two. Fortunately there was indeed a satisfactory conclusion allowing me to finally put the book down and drift off to sleep. I was happy to not be left with a brief "to be continued" comment but also thinking that there remained more of this interesting world to explore and hoping for a follow on story."

Ravensblood  also received a positive review from the notoriously tough review site Smart Bitches, Trashy Books, and it won a gold medal in the 2014 Global E Book Awards in the category of contemporary fantasy.  I feel like I have successfully proven that I can produce quality, riveting fiction; my debut novel The Stolen Luck (Carina Press) won a silver medal in the 2013 Global E Book Awards in the category of original world fantasy and an 2014 Eppie in the fantasy romance category.  I have also won two honorable mentions for my short fiction from Writers of the Future and have sold stories to e-zines and an anthology.  I have a B.A. in English. Writing Option from Penn State University and have taken workshops and classes from Charles de Lint, David Farland, Donald Maass and Elizabeth Lyon, among others.

I see the Ravensblood  universe as one that can be returned to again and again. It already has its passionate devotees.  One of my beta readers traveled here from France to take the Ravensblood  tour of Portland,  One reader who bought the book when it first came out put aside the work she was doing on deadline to finish reading the novel.  A supporter gave me the funds to pay the cover artist, and musicians among my support base did a custom arrangement of the music for the video trailer as well as editing the trailer itself.  (Do check out the video, for the music if for no other reason.  It's spine-tingling good.)

So where do you come in?  I got a good start with the I first book, but I need to get more books out there to build a readership.   Mostly, I need to pay my freelance editor in order to put out the sequel, because, to paraphrase an old axiom, any writer who acts as her own editor has a fool for a client.  I will be using the some editor I did for Ravensblood.  Anything above what I need to pay the editor will go to promotional costs.

A little bit about the book that started it all:

In a life of impossible choices when sometimes death magic is the lesser of the evils, can a dark mage save the world and his own soul? Corwyn Ravenscroft. Raven. The last heir of an ancient family of dark mages, he holds the secret to recreating the Ravensblood, a legendary magical artifact of immense power.

Cassandra Greensdowne is a Guardian. Magical law enforcement for the elected council— and Raven’s former apprentice and lover. She is trying to live down her past. And then her past comes to the door, asking for her help.

As a youth, Raven wanted to be a Guardian but was rejected because of his ancestry. In his pride and his anger, he had turned to William, the darkest and most powerful mage of their time. William wants a return to the old ways, where the most powerful mage was ruler absolute. But William would not be a True King from the fairy tales. He would reign in blood and terror and darkest magic.

 Raven discovers that he does have a conscience. It’s rather inconvenient.

 He becomes a spy for the council that William wants to overthrow, with Cassandra as his contact. Cass and Raven have a plan to trap William outside his warded sanctuary. But William is one step ahead of the game, with Raven’s life, his soul, and the Ravensblood all in danger.

And about Raven's Wing:

In Ravensblood we saw Raven’s struggle to escape the world of dark magic he’d committed to as a bitter young man. In Raven’s Wing he has to come to terms with both his past and his ancestry and figure out his new place in the Three Communities and among the people who enter his life. The task becomes more difficult, of course, when he finds himself on the run, trying to find the stolen Ravensblood in order to protect the Three Communities and beyond from the dangers presented by this powerful artifact in the wrong hands, and at the same time prove himself innocent of the theft.

Raven finds support in unlooked-for places, but he faces an unknown enemy  who is cunning, ruthless and powerful.

The manuscript for Raven's Wing is complete, needed only the deft hand of my talented editor before publication.

Teaser chapters are up here: http://www.shawna-reppert.com/ravensblood-and-r...

Depending on the level of contribution, supporters will get cool stuff to read, Raven's Wing swag and the knowledge that the helped the early days of a compelling new urban fantasy 'verse.

If you can't contribute financially (and believe me, I understand broke), you can still be part of the magic by spreading the word via Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, your own blog, etc.  Every shout-out is greatly appreciated.

Mundane. The book starts in a gripping fashion only taking breaks for 
back story and character development, meaning you neither miss nor 
misunderstand the action. If you know the quirks of Portland, it even 
seems plausible. Scenery is excellent. Fantasy, warriors and mages with 
modern realism. I loved this novel.""Darkly entertaining and enjoyable read, , , It was very easy to become immersed in this story, due to a deeply 
flawed but compelling character, Corwyn Ravenscroft.  Definitely give 
this author a chance, her storytelling will draw you in. Her style is 
just a hint of Andre Norton, a dash of J. K. Rowling, and the tiniest 
pinch of Anne Rice.  The rest is her own unique stamp.""Good story set in an intriguing world  I enjoyed this story very much and was left hoping for a sequel. The 
story is set in a world of magic which Shawna describes wonderfully. . .Shawna is able to paint descriptive pictures with enough detail to let 
the reader create vivid images and yet keep a story moving at a nice 
pace. . .As the end of the book drew near - the pace increased and the pages grew
 fewer. I found myself staying up much too late wanting to finish and 
wondering how Shawna could bring about a conclusion without leaving me 
waiting for volume two. Fortunately there was indeed a satisfactory 
conclusion allowing me to finally put the book down and drift off to 
sleep. I was happy to not be left with a brief "to be continued" comment
 but also thinking that there remained more of this interesting world to
 explore and hoping for a follow on story."Ravensblood  also received a positive review from the notoriously tough review site Smart Bitches, Trashy Books, and it won a gold medal in the 2014 Global E Book Awards in the category of contemporary fantasy.  I feel like I have successfully proven that I can produce quality, riveting fiction; my debut novel The Stolen Luck (Carina Press) won a silver medal in the 2013 Global E Book Awards in the category of original world fantasy and an 2014 Eppie in the fantasy romance category.  I have also won two honorable mentions for my short fiction from Writers of the Future and have sold stories to e-zines and an anthology.  I have a B.A. in English. Writing Option from Penn State University and have taken workshops and classes from Charles de Lint, David Farland, Donald Maass and Elizabeth Lyon, among others.I see the Ravensblood  universe as one that can be returned to again and again. It already has its passionate devotees.  One of my beta readers traveled here from France to take the Ravensblood  tour of Portland,  One reader who bought the book when it first came out put aside the work she was doing on deadline to finish reading the novel.  A supporter gave me the funds to pay the cover artist, and musicians among my support base did a custom arrangement of the music for the video trailer as well as editing the trailer itself.  (Do check out the video, for the music if for no other reason.  It's spine-tingling good.)So where do you come in?  I got a good start with the I first book, but I need to get more books out there to build a readership.   Mostly, I need to pay my freelance editor in order to put out the sequel, because, to paraphrase an old axiom, any writer who acts as her own editor has a fool for a client.  I will be using the some editor I did for Ravensblood.  Anything above what I need to pay the editor will go to promotional costs.A little bit about the book that started it all:In a life of impossible choices when sometimes death magic is the lesser
 of the evils, can a dark mage save the world and his own soul? Corwyn 
Ravenscroft. Raven. The last heir of an ancient family of dark mages, he
 holds the secret to recreating the Ravensblood, a legendary magical 
artifact of immense power. Cassandra Greensdowne is a Guardian. Magical 
law enforcement for the elected council— and Raven’s former apprentice 
and lover. She is trying to live down her past. And then her past comes 
to the door, asking for her help. As a youth, Raven wanted to be a 
Guardian but was rejected because of his ancestry. In his pride and his 
anger, he had turned to William, the darkest and most powerful mage of 
their time. William wants a return to the old ways, where the most 
powerful mage was ruler absolute. But William would not be a True King 
from the fairy tales. He would reign in blood and terror and darkest 
magic. Raven discovers that he does have a conscience. It’s rather 
inconvenient. He becomes a spy for the council that William wants to 
overthrow, with Cassandra as his contact. Cass and Raven have a plan to 
trap William outside his warded sanctuary. But William is one step ahead
 of the game, with Raven’s life, his soul, and the Ravensblood all in 
danger. And about Raven's Wing: In
Ravensblood we saw Raven’s struggle
to escape the world of dark magic he’d committed to as a bitter young man. In Raven’s Wing he has to come to terms
with both his past and his ancestry and figure out his new place in the Three
Communities and among the people who enter his life. The task becomes more
difficult, of course, when he finds himself on the run, trying to find the
stolen Ravensblood in order to protect the Three Communities and beyond from
the dangers presented by this powerful artifact in the wrong hands, and at the
same time prove himself innocent of the theft.
Raven finds support in unlooked-for places, but he faces an unknown enemy  who is cunning, ruthless and powerful.

The manuscript for Raven's Wing is complete, needed only the deft hand of my talented editor before publication.Teaser chapters are up here: http://www.shawna-reppert.com/ravensblood-and-r...Depending on the level of contribution, supporters will get cool stuff to read, Raven's Wing swag and the knowledge that the helped the early days of a compelling new urban fantasy 'verse.If you can't contribute financially (and believe me, I understand broke), you can still be part of the magic by spreading the word via Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, your own blog, etc.  Every shout-out is greatly appreciated.

story:
Hi, my name is Dr. Bill.

 

 

I've been writing children's stories for quite some time for my nieces and nephews. When Piranha Yama's story popped into my mind, I felt strongly that Yama's journey and it's messages would resonate in a bigger way and for more than just my family. I wanted to share it with everyone who loves colorful, fun, creative, uplifting, inspiring, adventurous, feel good stories.

 

I enjoy telling stories that sprout up from the unique way my brain processes words, showing new dimensions of meaning while the subconscious enjoys the layers beneath. In this case, it’s appeared as a story about a yoga-loving Piranha on a terrific journey.

 

 

As someone who is strongly empathetic, I feel or connect to others emotions by default, which is why I love doing things that help keep kids happy. And, in reality, we are all still kids with some years and layers of life experience built on top of us. With the positive messages that lace this story line, the happy “feel good now” side of us is reminded to shine bright and make the world a happier place.

 

 

 

 

What is Pranayama? 

It is a style of yogic or meditative breathing. The breathing technique is known to increase communication between the hemispheres of the brain, energize and heal the body, and oxygenate and alkalize the blood, amongst other things. The character, Yama, popped into my head as Piranha Yama because it sounded similar to the yogic breathing system.

 

                                      

 

 

 

 

Who Is Piranha Yama?

Piranha Yama is a loveable and powerful character that is learning to get into the flow of life's journey. Her life seems perfect on the outside, but she has her own personal obstacles to overcome.

 

 

                                           

 

 

 

 

What will we learn through Yama's stories? 

I want to tell you the whole story of Piranha Yama, but it’s more fun with the imagery and in a book format. I don’t want to give too much away either, but I can tell you this...

Yama reminds us to trust your instincts, to listen to wise elders, to stick up for yourself, to have courage to do new things, to calm your mind, to move your body, to breathe, to realize your boundaries are only real until you surpass them, to go with or against the flow, the importance of listening to your dreams, and to know that things will be okay (even when you feel lost). 

I hope you will all begin this adventure with Yama and share the encouraging message “The light within guide your fins.”

 

 

                              

          

Piranha Yama meets her teacher, Piranha One, in the dreamworld.

 

 

 

 

 

Who is the illustrator?

When I began thinking about Yama, I sketched her out on a piece of paper and excitedly showed my friends and family. However, judging from their reactions to my hieroglyphs, I quickly started my search for a real artist to bring Yama to life. I found the amazing artist and illustrator, Nikki Manteen, @HeySheDraws, based in Maryland. Take a look at the images and try to guess which one came from the trained artist.

 

 

 

 

 

 

How many adventures does Yama go on?

The story is a three book series with an exciting story arc. But for now, I'm going to start with "Piranha Yama: The Art of Non-Biting" and continue once the goals are reached for the first book.

 

 

 

 

Why is this campaign important?

Yama is a positive role model. We need positive role models that show us some of the actions we can take on our own to improve our lives. Some examples are:

- Do what it takes to awaken your dormant talents and abilities.

- Help your community.

- Find the others - your peers, soul family, people like you that will support you. 

- Learn to recognize the light within you and others.

- Strengthen the mind and body.

- Put aside the conflicting messages and learn to know when your intuition is correct.

- To bring awareness that yoga and meditation are great tools to achieve all of the above. (Please see our list at the bottom of this campaign for kids yoga and prenatal yoga centers near you).

 

 

How much do we need to raise & where does it go?

We need to raise $9240 to get the first printing done, to get the books shipped to the US, and to pay the artist for her work.

Art:    $5000 

Printing:  $4240 for the first print run 

Total:  $9240

If we raise more than that, then we have some other good things in store!

 

 

 

 

 

 

Your contribution and pre-orders help...

...And they are necessary for me to get this book made. Without a publisher, it's a grassroots effort to get this book made, and one of the bonuses to that is that I have a lot more wiggle room to write the story the way Yama (and myself) would like it told. The grassroots effort starts here with us and then spreads to the people we know.

 

 

Some of my personal goals for this book series:

I would like to use this project as a springboard to connect more meditation and yoga schools with the people in their communities. 

It may not be common knowledge, but yoga and meditation are now becoming more widespread in the U.S. school system. These new brain breaks are helping kids find their own personal peace in the middle of their busy and stressful days. The health benefits of these activities are supported by scientific research.

If more kids begin to train their brains and decide on their own to be more thoughtful and peaceful, instead of being reactive, the world will benefit as they grow up and become our future leaders.

Finding and creating more classes on mindfulness, creative thought,

 

 

Risks and challenges...

The book can only be made if we are completely funded. If we raise less money, we will not have enough for the first printing. If financial goals are not met, Indiegogo returns all of your money. For us, it's all or nothing when it comes to the cost of paying the artist and printing the book. Risks related to this project delayed final product due to delayed illustration or delivery times.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Please spread the word and tell your friends, family and schools about Piranha Yama. You can let your yoga or meditation class members know, too. Yama is ready to share her adventures with the world! If they liked Kung Fu Panda or Nickelodeon’s Avatar The Last Airbender, they will like this story, too.

 

Here’s an easy cut and paste message to share with your friends:  

 

Hi! 

I just heard about this great new kid’s book called Piranha Yama.

Here’s a link to the indiegogo campaign: www.piranhayama.com

 

 

Say hello to Piranha Yama!

Instagram: @piranhayama

Facebook: www.fb.com/piranhayama

 

 

 

 

 

 

If you're looking for a studio in your area to practice yoga and meditation, I've compiled a list of locations that teach kids yoga, meditation and prenatal yoga. The Yama Yoga List is arranged by city and state:

www.piranhayama.com/yogalist

If you'd like your studio to be added to this list, please contact me.

story:
Mother/Daughter conflicts are legendary!  Some might say: inevitable. 

As a daughter and an author,I have a burden to see mended relationships between women and their mothers. 

My name is Jessica Errico, and I know what it’s like to feel disconnected from one's mother.  My mom was a classy, driven woman who coped with the pain in her life with alcohol.  I experienced a deep emotional gap between us that lasted 47 years.  We both suffered from brokenness and hurt handed down through the generations. Yet, once I found a BRIDGE that healed our relationship, I was able to serve her lovingly and cheerfully the last four years of her life. 

With my heart restored, I feel compelled to share my story with other hurting daughters. Spiritual healing is possible!  The forgiveness of God bridges gaps of all kinds.  Though I usually write short devotionals and newspaper columns, I labored for three years to compile my memoir: “THE MOTHER GAP, A Daughter’s Search for Connection.”

 

WHY pursue crowd funding through Indiegogo?  It's all about timing!

Rather than waiting to go the “traditional” publishing route, I’ve chosen to self-publish my book in order to make it available more quickly. Raising funds through this campaign will allow me to share the HOPE in my memoir by printing it within the next 2 months! 

This self-publishing venture will cost $5,500.  The package I selected includes book cover design, custom text formatting, paperback printing of an initial 501 books,e-book formatting and distribution, feature video trailer, and a basic advertising strategy, etc.  We will be able to launch the book nation-wide. If we exceed our goal, we hope to invest in a professional website separate from the one provided by the publisher.

Your partnership will enable me to not only bring my memoir to press, but market it to those who will benefit from it the most.  I chose a self-publishing company that has a wide platform so I can reach many women and their families with this message of
forgiveness.

If you are able to partner with me in making “THE MOTHER GAP” available, I’m excited to offer you a signed copy of my book, as well as other perks! Check out the side bar.

Any funds I receive will go to funding this project.  Because I so believe in the message of emotional healing central to my book, I’m committed to bringing it to press.  The initial order of 501 books will not be released until they are paid for.

Ever since the Garden of Eden, mankind has needed forgiveness. When we learn to receive it and offer it, our hearts are healed and our lives enriched.  “THE MOTHER GAP” deals with mending relationships through a bridge of forgiveness available in Christ.  As the hearts of women are healed, families and friendships thrive.

You can help me help others! 

I truly believe that your partnership will get this message of healing and hope into the hands of a multitude of women. If it’s not possible for you to partner with me financially at this time, you can still help champion the healing between mothers and daughters by sharing this link with others.  Please use the sharing tools on Indiegogo and spread the news about “THE MOTHER GAP”!

Everywhere I mention my book, folks express interest in hearing my story.  Women of all ages long for a better relationship with their mothers.  My degree in psychology primed my heart to want to grapple with the issues of jealousy, bitterness, and resentment.  The bridge of FORGIVENESS is the driving truth behind this project, and you can help me get that message out! THANK YOU!

story:
Dear LeVan:

Our favorite type of email to send......

We are very happy to say that based on the merit of your manuscript you have been admitted into the Tin House Summer Workshop program. Applications are up 30% this year, so getting accepted was a steep hill to climb. Congratulations!

----------

This has turned into one of most exciting and fulfilling creative years I’ve had in a very long time.  I figured out the structure of my book, "What Men Do,"  after working on it for six years. "What Men Do" is a familial love story, an unlikely relationship between me and my oldest nephew who I didn't meet until he was twenty-seven.  Upon our first meeting, he snarled and deemed me "bourgeois (or more accurately, 'bourgie')," and I deemed him "ghetto."  "What Men Do" addresses issues of class, mentoring, masculinity, fatherless sons, family obligations, and race. My book is progressing at a steady pace.  I estimate I will have a draft completed by November.  It will be the best birthday present I’ve ever received. 

A video of my graduate reading at Antioch University-Los Angeles where I read from a rough draft of my book is in the gallery. Please click the gallery tab above.

A  sample from "What Men Do" earned me an invitation to attend the Tin House Summer Writing Workshop in Portland, Oregon this July.    I Googled the workshop and found this description of the Tin House Workshop: Like Tin House Magazine and Tin House Books, this week-long workshop is on the cutting edge of today’s literary scene. It consists of intimate morning workshops, along with craft seminars, career panels, readings, and parties. It is held on the campus of Reed College in southeast Portland, OR.

Sounds like heaven! There will also be one-on-one sessions with agents and editors. During the last few years,  I’ve also been working on my book proposal, samples, and query letter, items necessary to get an agent. At Tin House, I will be able to have my query letter evaluated.   At minimum, this experience will help me polish my work to the highest professional level so I can take this next step to publication.

This venture will be much less stressful if I can get some help from my family, friends, fans of my work, and those who support the arts.  I don’t have a full time job – well, I have two – I take care of my sick mother and I work on my art.  I am looking for financial assistance  in covering tuition for the workshop, room and board, travel, and other incidentals.

In the gallery are clips that made me realize the universality of the impact of fatherless sons and how it impacts families.  One is from Oprah Winfrey's Lifeclass Show featuring Iyanla Vanzant on Fatherless Sons showing how the absence of the father affects the son even when the sons are men.  It confirmed what I had observed in my mentor situations, my relationship with my nephew, and made me reevaluate my own experiences.  I considered myself a neutral party, an observer in my book but no, the tears I shed watching the shows said otherwise.

The second clip from Iyanla's "Fix My LIfe" just devastated me.  Again you see how the father's absence affects the son but it also illustrates how the absence, the neglect affects the son's relationship with his mother.  Again, I found myself in tears and a flood of memories rose in my spirit.  These shows confirmed my belief in the importance and the power of the story I wanted to share.

covering tuition for the workshop, room and board, travel, and other incidentals.In the gallery are clips that made me realize the universality of the impact of fatherless sons and how it impacts families.  One is from Oprah Winfrey's Lifeclass Show featuring Iyanla Vanzant on Fatherless Sons showing how the absence of the father affects the son even when the sons are men.  It confirmed what I had observed in my mentor situations, my relationship with my nephew, and made me reevaluate my own experiences.  I considered myself a neutral party, an observer in my book but no, the tears I shed watching the shows said otherwise.The second clip from Iyanla's "Fix My LIfe" just devastated me.  Again you see how the father's absence affects the son but it also illustrates how the absence, the neglect affects the son's relationship with his mother.  Again, I found myself in tears and a flood of memories rose in my spirit.  These shows confirmed my belief in the importance and the power of the story I wanted to share.

story:
THE PROGRAM IS NOW AVAILABLE IN THE "GALLERY" SECTION!

About the above video:

OWWA Executive Board Member & Yari Yari Ntoaso Rosamond S. King explains why OWWA was founded, what Yari Yari is, and why you should support us!

THANK YOU TO ALL OF OUR SUPPORTERS AND DONORS!  It's not too late to support OWWA & Yari Yari Ntoaso:

 

Here are the instructions to make a tax-deductible donate via PayPal:

 

1) Go to paypal.com
2) Click "Personal" on the upper left of the screen.
3) Click on "Transfer," and when the menu drops down, click "Send Someone Money." 
4) A new window will open.  Type your email addres as the "From" and owwayariyari@gmail.com as the "To."
5) Enter the amount and click "Continue."
6) At this time it will ask you to log in or create a PayPal account.
7) Once the above is done, all you have to do is enter any message to OWWA, and click "Confirm!"
We will send you an email confirmation once our account has been credited. 
Checks are also accepted made out to OWWA and mailed to P.O. Box 652; Village Station; New York, NY 10014.

About Yari Yari Ntoaso:

Yari Yari Ntoaso: Continuing the Dialogue is a symposium of literature by women of African descent taking place in Accra, Ghana, May 16-19, 2013.  This free gathering will put writers, critics, and readers from across Africa, the USA, Europe, and the Caribbean in dialogue with each other through readings, roundtables, screenings, and performances. YYN continues the dialogue of the first two Yari Yari conferences, which put hundreds of writers in dialogue with thousands of readers.

Why should you give?

Amazingly, more than 50 poets, writers, and scholars from 15 countries have agreed to attend and to raise their own travel costs.  But those with less resources - often writers living in the Global South and those working outside of universities - are struggling to raise their travel funds.  The monies raised on this website will help cover these writers' costs.  Your gifts help ensure that Yari Yari Ntoaso will feature a wide range of voices.  If there are remaining funds, they will pay for documentation and an improved website so those who can’t attend in person can stay updated online.

And if you need more reasons to give, just look at our thank-you gifts to your left!

A list of participants – as well as many photos and videos – can be found in our "gallery" on this site.

About OWWA:

OWWA (The Organization of Women Writers of Africa) is a 501(c)(3) non-governmental organization associated with the United Nations Department of Public Information. OWWA was formed by Jayne Cortez (USA) and Ama Ata Aidoo (Ghana) for the purpose of establishing links between professional African women writers. In recent years OWWA created, and organized, critical panels, readings, book celebrations, conversations with creative women, the presentation of literary awards, film/video screenings, and a literary literacy project connecting young students to literature and professional writers.

OWWA is deeply saddened by the loss of its President and Co-Founder, Jayne Cortez, the amazing poet, performer, and activist described by The New York Times as “one of the central figures of the Black Arts Movement.”  We are committed to presenting the third Yari Yari as scheduled in Jayne’s honor.

Please give at whatever level you can.  And please let others know via email, Facebook, and Twitter, about this campaign!

                                              THANK YOU!

story:
What is This Magazine?

For more than 46 years, This Magazine has been publishing the voices, issues and topics mainstream corporate media ignores. From its early days as This Magazine is About Schools, the magazine has grown to be Canada's leading progressive magazine of politics, arts and culture. The magazine is home to award-winning investigative journalism, in-depth coverage of Canadian arts and culture and new work by the best emerging and established talent.

This Magazine regularly publishes stories about politics, the environment, social justice, labour, aboriginal peoples, human rights, feminism and queer issues because we believe they're important. But they're not the kind of topics (Kate Middleton Unsolicited Uterus Update! Please Your Man Tips! Monkey Wears Kicky Jacket to Local Ikea!) that commerical media and magazines build their big business on.

Nobody owns This Magagzine. We don`t rely on advertising or corporate sponsorship. We run a tight ship with low overhead and an operating budget that's smaller than what most mainstream magazines spend on a single issue.

We may not have a big bottom line, but what we do have is freedom. Our writers can tell the stories they want, in the way they want to. Since 1966, This Magazine has brought Canadians thousands of important stories that counter the status quo, expose wrongdoing and expand the debate of issues that matter to you. This important work hasn`t gone unnoticed. In 2008, This Magazine was named one of the 20 most influential Canadian magazines of all time. This Magazine has been named Small Magazine of the Year by the Canadian Society of Magazine Editors three years running, received more than 75 National Magazine Award nominations, been a five-time winner at the Canadian Newsstand Awards and been nominated for Utne Independent Press Awards. People like us! They really do!

This Magazine gives you an uncompromising, uncensored, unapologetic magazine with real people and real politics that have a daily impact on you, your family, your world. And now we want to give you more of this.

What do we need?

This Magazine currently publishes six issues a year. This year we're launching a special project (a seventh issue) devoted to the stories you missed this year. These are stories that matter. Stories big media ignored, overlooked or didn`t delve deep enough into.

Newsstands are crowded with year in review issues, but this isn't your standard year in review coverage. There will be no best hook-ups and break-ups of 2012. We don't care what's hot or not hot! No newsmakers, trendsetters or one's to watch. You will not see the words "baby bump" anywhere. We promise! No best movies of 2012! Worst movies of 2012! Movies you should have seen in 2012, but didn't!

What you will find are stories about rights, the people and places that don't have them, but should. These are the stories you need to read. Stories about the lawsuits companies are using to muzzle environmental activists. A report on that other B.C. pipeline. An investigation of Nunavut's suicide crisis. You'll find all these stories, and more, in our first-ever Year in Review issue.

But, we need your help to finish this issue. We need to raise $3,500 by December 25 (we can report your good deeds to Santa right up until midnight on the 25th) to get our Year in Review issue into readers hands. Your donations will support a group of dedicated writers, journalists, illustrators and photographers who are more interested in real analysis and real issues than corporate ass-kissing, breakneck news cycles and sound bites.

Your donation will help cover the printing, production and editorial costs of our special Year in Review issue. Take a break from holiday shopping and holiday movie marathons (I refuse to watch Love Actually one more time!) and donate now.

As a thank you for your support we've got lots of great gifts available. All donations are also tax-deductible!

Help us reach our goal of $3,500. Help This Magazine publish it's first annual Year in Review issue and provide a national forum for the people, issues and opinions big media ignores.

We can't thank you enough for donating,

This Magazine

PS: Please help us spread the word about our campaign. Tell your friends! Get on Facebook and Twitter now and help us promote the heck out of our campaign. Cute cat videos can wait and the Ikea monkey's tweets will still be relevant for at least another 11 minutes. Thank you!

story:
Our Story

POSTRmagazine: published since 2009


“If you consider the great journalists in history, you don’t see too many objective journalists on that list. H.L. Mencken was not objective. Mike Royko, who just died. I.F. Stone was not objective. Mark Twain was not objective. I don’t quite understand this worship of objectivity in journalism.”

Hunter S. Thompson, The Atlantic Monthly Interview, 07-16-1977


POSTRmagazine is a quarterly magazine, written in English that is printed on an A1 size poster and available for free in Europe in selected concept stores, shops, art centers, galleries and concert halls. We currently have a printing run of 5000 copies per issue. The choice for the A1 size is because we want to look at different possibilities of magazine publishing, use of public space and freedom of speech.
POSTRmagazine is an independent Counter-Culture magazine in tradition of the Free Press magazines and newspapers from the 1960s and 1970s. Every issue of POSTRmagazines talks about one specific subject and consists of an editorial, main story, two side stories and an interview with two experts on that subject.
POSTRmagazine is not a lifestyle magazine, a mud slinging machine or a haven for conspiracy theories. Our influences are Rolling Stone magazine, Oz, the International Times and the Berkeley Barb.
The content of POSTRmagazine is critical and subjective. We pay homage to Gonzo journalism and the New Journalism but don't want to copy these styles in any way. POSTRmagazine has it's own, modern style of writing which is critical and subjective. Our content is always fact-based though and the result of thorough research. Our readers are invited and even provoced to think for themselves rather than us telling them what to think.

Pieter De Kegel is the publisher and designer of the magazine. He's a graphic designer with his own studio called Not Another Graphic Designer and he's been an art director for different magazine since 2005. Pieter works together with Robbert Van Jaarsveld and Michael De Wilde (aka Monkeys With Typewriters) who are two top notch journalists to write the articles in POSTRmagazine. Next to our editors in chief we have one more contributor called Bart Deweer who helped start the Belgian branch of Vice magazine. Evelyne Copers is Pieter's fiance and she takes care of administration and distribution.

We finance POSTRmagazine with 1 advertisement on the back of the A1 poster and small logos of people who support us on the front of the poster.

The Impact

We want your help to keep publishing this great, independent magazine. We have been making POSTRmagazine for two and a half years now but it's getting increasingly hard to finance the writing and printing costs of the magazine with the advertisement on the back.
There's a lot of blood sweat and tears that go into making POSTRmagazine and we insist on paying our writers and contributors for the work they put into writing their fantastic articles. Printing the magazine is expensive as it is now but we want to increase our printing run to 10000 copies so it wil become even more expensive in the future. We don't want to become dependent on advertisers so we can keep our content 100% non-commercial. Getting the money we need will allow us to use our back cover for illustrations or photography. This will enhance the overall quality of POSTRmagazine even more.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $4300 to make one issue of POSTRmagazine on a printing run of 10000 copies.
That's $3145 for printing and $1145 to pay the writers.
The cost for the design and distribution will be payed by selling the small logos on the front side of the poster.

You can pay by credit card or Paypal on this website.
If you don't have a credit card or Paypal account you can pay by bank transfer too.
Just send an email to info@postrmagazine.com and we'll give you the details.
Your amount will be added on the IndieGoGo website afterwards.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us out by sharing this campaign with all your friends, family and pets!

story:
Join The Movement and help Good News Toronto Non-Profit launch a digital iPad magazine - your support will also help a GNT hero, The Seeds of Hope Foundation, build a house for vulnerable women. In the video above Dan Jenkins shares how Love Works.

About us

We are passionate about the city of Toronto and the fantastic people who call it home—we believe here more than anywhere that LoveWorks! This Fall Good New Toronto will be launching GOOD NEWS Magazine - Toronto Edition: Digital Interactive iPad Magazine and Website. GOOD NEWS Magazine champions actionable journalism, paying it forward and exclusively good news. Our vision is to build a new home for the best in journalism, uncovering truths while introducing possible solutions, sharing positive motivation and showcasing inspiring role models who pay it forward. You have the opportunity to be part of bringing about a beautifully designed interactive experience that puts you, the reader, first! However, we cannot bring our vision to completion without the help of supporters like you! 

Fundraising Goals

1. GOOD NEWS Magazine  

Toronto Edition: To Launch Fall 2012:The $25,000 target covers a) Brand Design, b) Interactive Publishing Design, c) New Website Design, d) Content Development and e) Electronic Distribution of first issue through Apple’s app store for iPad. 

2. THE SEEDS OF HOPE FOUNDATION 

For every one dollar contributed Good News Toronto would like to pay it forward by delivering 30 cents to one of Toronto’s Heroes: The Seeds of Hope Foundation charity to support the completion of a new Toronto transition home for vulnerable women and run its programs. Helping Toronto's most vulnerable women get off Toronto’ streets, facilitate life-changing activities for a month, guaranteeing her a safe place to eat, sleep and live towards regaining full independence and permanent shelter.

Join The Movement! 

To help us get GOOD NEWS Magazine out into the world, please pledge what you can—from the cost of a coffee all the way up to a $1,000 corporate sponsorship. With a minimum donation you can help us decide on future story lines by joining our open editorial board. You’ll be joining an experiment in true collaboration and there are tons of super cool perks!

We would LOVE it if you supported this cause! We would LOVE it if you told your family and friends! We would LOVE it if you helped us build a new magazine representing the best of Toronto, and hopefully soon, the best of the world! Why do this? Because we think these things matter — and we hope you do too!

Any questions? Leave a comment here or email us at hello@causeforgood.com


For updates on the project, you can find us on Twitter @causeforgood or connect via our Facebook page http://www.facebook.com/causeforgood

Who We Are

Good News Toronto 

Eva Karpati has been sharing her passion for good news and Toronto as founder and chief editor of Good News Toronto in print since its original inception in February 2008. It’s amazing what a fresh perspective can do! Not only does it brighten someone’s day, but over time it changes the way we see and interact with the world around us. Good News Toronto reveals the vibrant communities that are often hidden from mainstream print, thereby allowing people to connect with all the wonderful individuals and their projects in Toronto. The community is not only engaged by the stories they read but also through direct involvement in the paper. The newspaper has become an important source for mentoring talented individuals, from professional writers to journalism students to visual artists and poets. In print for over four years, Good News Toronto needs your support to continue its evolution!

Good News Toronto is run by a loyal, talented group of volunteers who create and share this free publication throughout Toronto. With a circulation of 10,000 each month distributed in 640 locations the paper costs $3000 per issue to print. That’s $36,000 for an entire year of print, and this only represents a small portion of the potential readership that deserves a greater dose of good news. These challenges will be conquered once the new digital magazine is made easily accessible to everyone online! 

The Seeds of Hope Foundation

Founder David Walsh and executive director Kimberly Curry have committed their organization to helping Toronto’s most vulnerable. Seeds of Hope is a charitable organization that provides places of hope and belonging for those at a crossroads in their lives. Places where people find their gifts and abilities through communities of compassion and caring. The transitional homes, safe places, and creative spaces enhance livelihood, learning, and social opportunities. In 2010 The Seeds of Hope Foundation touched the lives of over 3,000 people, through transitional housing placements, Learning Centre Activities and more than 25,000 community meals.

Cause for Good 

Ileana Rouse, Mark Kearney, Emery Bishop and their team at Cause for Good recognize unprecedented opportunities and potential for good to lead in our world. They decided to dedicate their lives and enterprises in a mission to serve humanity and the planet. The goal is to leverage the amazing changes and opportunities recognized to create an abundant world (that is prosperity beyond sustainability). This cannot be done alone, so we are very glad to have great partners and friends to work along side on this purpose. With your help, Cause for Good is helping GOOD NEWS Magazine to launch.

Founder David Walsh and executive director Kimberly Curry have committed their organization to helping Toronto’s most vulnerable. Seeds of Hope is a charitable organization that provides places of hope and belonging for those at a crossroads in their lives. Places where people find their gifts and abilities through communities of compassion and caring. The transitional homes, safe places, and creative spaces enhance livelihood, learning, and social opportunities. In 2010 The Seeds of Hope Foundation touched the lives of over 3,000 people, through transitional housing placements, Learning Centre Activities and more than 25,000 community meals.

Cause for Good 
Ileana Rouse, Mark Kearney, Emery Bishop and their team at Cause for Good recognize unprecedented opportunities and potential for good to lead in our world. They decided to dedicate their lives and enterprises in a mission to serve humanity and the planet. The goal is to leverage the amazing changes and opportunities recognized to create an abundant world (that is prosperity beyond sustainability). This cannot be done alone, so we are very glad to have great partners and friends to work along side on this purpose. With your help, Cause for Good is helping GOOD NEWS Magazine to launch.

story:
Hello-

My name is Evan Lemke and I am an activist for Planned Parenthood Votes North West. As a member I work towards equality for both men and women and to politically motivate the community in support of sexual right. Working on the ground floor you may see me canvasing the neighborhood creating awareness or tabling community events. Believing in something isn’t a daydream for me; I put it into action and create change.

My work as a leader in change does not stop with Planned Parenthood. I am also the President of the Human Development club for Washington State University Vancouver and a Court Appointed Special Advocate for Clark County. As I am working towards a degree in Human Development I strive to make a positive impact on my society.

Recently I have been given an opportunity to travel to Washington DC and participate in becoming a leader in change for Planned Parenthood Generation Action Network. A team that brings in advocates for reproductive freedom and specialize in creating lasting changes in the community that surrounds them. Upon my arrival to Washington DC I will be trained as a political leader, gain valuable knowledge in the political field, and network with some of Washington’s top ranking leaders. By donating today you will be supporting a loyal activist in the fight for reproductive freedom for all.

Your donation will fund my trip to Washington DC and support the activist work I plan to continue upon my return.

I leave you with a qoute by Margaret Sanger Founder of Planned Parenthood:

“Woman must not accept; she must challenge. She must not be awed by that which has been built up around her; she must reverence that woman in her which struggles for expression.”

Thank you,

Evan Lemke

story:
I urge you to contribute and together, let's make a difference. It is not nessecary to reach the goal. It is important to raise as much as we can for those people.


Stop Saying ''I wish'' and Start Saying ''I will''



Purpose

According to the UNHCR, to date there are over 3 million registered Syrian refugees, of which over 50% are under the age of 17. Since the revolution began in 2011.

Last months we can see an increase of syrian refugees trying to enter in Europe through Greece, Turkey and Mediterranean Sea. As a result of this we have a huge number of people who need: Food, Water, Clothes, Place to stay. Some of these people have lost their friends, their family, their life.

So I am asking you. Do you think it's time to take some action? Can we make a strong community in order to face their problems and all together be supporters to them. Sometimes I am thinking how they are feeling, but I can not imagine what they are facing every day.

Let's act as human beings. I was thinking to post some picture that may hurt your feelings but I decided that all together we can stop that kind of pictures to exist.


Who are you?

My name is Matthiew Dieter (Matt) and I'm 35 years old. I'm from Vienne, Austria but live in London UK working in Marketing Industry. I am proud to be an active European Citizen.


Is this a joke?
No. Crowdfunding can really help because it's just a case of getting on and doing it.



Fixed/Flexible funding.
I chose flexible funding because we need to donate as much as we can.



Are you just making a statement/some kind of point?
This is a real attempt to do something.


Do you have any link to IndieGoGo?
I've never been involved with IndieGoGo before.



What happens if you don’t make the target?
I Believe that hopefully we’ll make it though! If we don't, I really hope that people will still get behind a campaign to do something.



Do you think that you can reach the target?
I hope very much that the campaign will reach the target, I think it will be a victory for people power.



What will happen to the money?
We promise that all profits will go to the Syrian people. Whether that be via the government accepting it or by other means.


Other Ways you can help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. If you can not afford a cotribution, you can help us spread it through your social media.

story:
What is Feedback the Magazine?

Feedback the Magazine tells compelling stories about individuals, startups, and events that pass under the mainstream press’ radar. We are a platform that gives readers an up-close take on emerging innovators, designers, artists, and entrepreneurs. We also give readers a peek into the world of forward-thinking problem solvers working to address our generation’s biggest social issues.

We cover tomorrow’s taste-makers. Brilliant and innovative startups and leaders who have just begun to make their impact. Often, media exposure comes down to connections or preconceived notions of what constitute hipness or originality. That’s not how Feedback the Magazine works. No story pitch is too crazy for us. We strive to provide a platform for those starting out. A platform for those who want their voice, vision, design, product, and work seen by the world.

This isn’t another rag covering the stories and tired faces everybody the world-over already knows about. This is Feedback the Magazine, where you make the noise, where your voice resonates, and where we foster the future together. 

Who is Sonny Pinkney?

Founder and editor Sonny Pinkney’s dynamic vision stems from his less-than ordinary life. After family tragedy and a near-death experience, the young writer developed a passion for journalism that blossomed into the ambitious entrepreneurship behind Feedback the Magazine. 

Sonny grew up in Chester, PA. When he was 12 years old, his father passed away prematurely. “I became a man on July 21, 1994, the day my father died,” Pinkney says. His next test in life was just two years later, when he was diagnosed with brain tumors. After seven brain surgeries and relearning how to walk, Sonny emerged from his illness against tough odds, newly empowered and eager to make an impact on the world.

He went on to graduate from Howard University and to work with various news outlets in Washington, D.C. and Philadelphia.

“My illness and near-death experience has changed my perspective on life. I now know how precious it is,” explains Pinkney. “That's why I founded Feedback the Magazine, because the next day, minute, second or hour isn't promised to any of us and I want to get the most out of everything life has to offer.”

Where Do You Fit In?

We’ve already begun publishing our magazine online, but we’re thinking bigger than that. MUCH bigger.

We want to take our passion for cutting edge ideas to the next level, releasing Feedback as a monthly print publication. By embracing both today’s technology and traditional media platforms, we aim to greatly expand our scope. We want to share our vision with everyone. Even people with different tastes can share an enthusiasm for the next big idea. We want to give the up-and-comers we feature as broad an audience as possible. In other words, we want them to succeed.

But before we can help them, we need you to help us. Print publications aren’t cheap. In order for us to give voice to tomorrow’s big names, we need your help today. Every donation we receive brings us closer to our dream of publishing a magazine for the rest of us. 

We’re raising $25,000 in start-up capital to formalize our business, pay writers, and release our first print issue. Additionally, this funding will help us secure office space and equipment.

The task is big, but so is our drive. Join us in making this project a reality. 

All donations of $45 or more will receive a complimentary first issue of Feedback the Magazine following the successful completion of the campaign.

How to Give 

There are a number of ways to support Feedback the Magazine

• Indie Go Go (Credit Card)

• Checks and money orders made out to Wardell Pinkney

• Cash

Please send all physical donations to Feedback the Magazine’s campaign headquarters:

Key Elements Group LLC

Attn: Sonny Pinkney

1800 JFK BLVD., Suite 300

Philadelphia, PA 19103

Or, if you’re in the neighborhood, stop by 1800 JFK BLVD, Suite 300 and drop off your donation in person! Just ask for Lynette or Patrick from Key Elements Group. If they aren’t available, the secretary at the front desk will be more than happy to accommodate you. All physical gifts will be manually computed, and will be featured on the Indie Go Go campaign page replete with acknowledgement, and the sum will go toward the campaign’s goal as well.
