story:
'Today I Am'

  • My name is Mark Blackburn, I am a father, a son and a passionate illustrator/designer and writer.
  • This campaign is to fund, print and self publish 300 high quality copies of my first children's book. I'd like to engage with contributors, to produce something which not only I am proud of, but which I believe has potential to branch out into further volumes and larger edition runs. Above is an example of a double page spread. The book contains  18 more pages in this style.
  •  My dream is to release a fun, colourful, quality children's book which will be read and loved by everyone who sees it, and turn my TODAY I AM books into modern classics.

What I Need & What You Get

  •  I am looking to raise £3000 which would allow a first print run of 300 high quality, full colour, A4 sized casebound hardback books.
  • For a short run such as this, the cost per book comes in around £10 per copy to produce, and ship worldwide. I will get them printed here in the UK so that I can ensure the quality is of the highest standard, and worth every penny of your money.
  • Providing that together we raise £1500, people contributing £20 or more to the campaign will receive one signed and numbered first edition copy along with my eternal gratitude and the bragging rights to say they saw the potential in this idea from the outset should it blow up and become a bestseller!
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, all contributed funds will of course go into the production of as many copies as can be afforded, without me having to go via a remote printer where quality control is out of my hands, and unlikely to be as satisfactory. I'm confident we can reach at least £1500 to ensure eveyone generous enough to take a punt on £20 will get their copy.

The book itself

  • The title “TODAY I AM" refers to each page containing an illustration of a child playing in a onesie/costume of a different animal, alongside short verse relating somewhat to the type of animal and it’s nature, but also to the changeability of a child’s mood and their desire to explore, play and imagine. Almost as if the onesise becomes their spirit or mood animal for the day.

The notions behind this are:

  • BE HAPPY BEING YOURSELF
  • ENCOURAGE INDIVIDUALITY
  • IT'S NORMAL TO HAVE OFF DAYS, IMPERFECTION IS FINE
  • DON'T WORRY SO MUCH WHAT OTHER PEOPLE THINK.
  • I have attempted to inject a sense of irreverence, goofiness and fun into these pages, but there is an underlying, positive message in there too.
  •  I have drawn and written in quite a few subtle cultural references, Easter eggs if you like. Nods to other literary works, movies, songs, footwear, toys, elements which are close to my own heart. If adults especially, spot these, I think they'll recognise their origins.
  • I have a keen interest in natural history which is reflected in some of the animal species I've drawn; a few of which are slightly obscure and would hopefully encourage the reader to investigate these further.

Challenges Ahead

Once I manage to produce the initial run of books, I will use 100 copies as promotional tools and approach publishers and retailers, online influencers, plus arrange talks and demos at schools and festivals to help push the project on, and develop it into a series with further expansion and marketing potential. I already have 2 follow up books in the pipeline.

I would love to be able to send a copy of the final book to every person who helps towards making it, but in reality getting the first 300 made is really only the beginning.
Anyone who contributes to this venture, I would hope very much that they would be willing to go on the journey with me to see how far we can push this project. So share, blog, tweet and like it and shout about it into becoming a not only a successful book, but encourage the spread of it's positive message, allowing kids to express themselves and be whatever they like on any given day.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot or do not want to contribute financially to this campaign, I would welcome any pertinent advice or ideas as how I can take this concept further, tips or experiences you might have had with similar projects in order to help me get it out into the wide world.

Please share and post or blog and tweet about this project/fund on social media, I'm sure your friends would like to hear about it, if they have children or not.

 Indiegogo share tools are one way of helping spread the word about TODAY I AM

story:
Story of My Book

Hi! My name is Lauren Krasnodembski and I am the author of Reclaim your Power.

Reclaim Your Power is a memoir that takes you through a season of my life where I went on a 4-year inward quest to find myself, my passions and purpose. I had "checked all of my boxes" only to feel unfulfilled, exhausted, and anxious. I had a nagging feeling inside that I was not doing what I was put on this earth to do, yet I had no idea what that lingering feeling was or how to get off my hamster wheel to explore it. Through my self-discovery process, I realized that you don’t discover your passions or purpose because they discover YOU. 

I wrote this book because I know I am not the only busy driven woman out there that has asked themselves “Is this really it?” Successful by societal definitions, yet feeling like something is off while juggling the day-to-day stressors of life.

My hope is that by reading this book you will discover how to give yourself the love that you so freely give out to others, and to honor your thoughts, feelings and desires.  May it provide you hope and inspiration to reclaim your power by beginning or deepening your self-discovery so that your passions and purpose discover YOU, and you design a life you absolutely love! I desire nothing more than for this book to serve as a guide to help you explore your own personal freedom.

You'll learn about the self-discovery process, how to identify what is blocking you from reclaiming your own power, and the art of surrender and flow. You'll hear stories about the time my mom gifted my sister and I with an early Christmas present by taking us to the Passionate Palmist where I was asked a question that changed the trajectory of my life. I share stories about the very first life coach I hired and the unconscious discoveries I encountered as I slowly began to make myself and my desires a priority.  

Reclaim Your Power will speak to busy driven women and those seeking to feel lighter and more fulfilled. It will also resonate with those looking for more passion and purpose in their life. 

VIP Community - What You'll Get


By supporting, you will be a part of the VIP Reclaim Your Power community. For each book sale $5 will be donated to a non-profit called Be The Light Campaign. Their mission entails creating events and random acts of kindness to spread hope, love & compassion. They believe that mental health is just as important as physical health and that a life without hope is not really living. Check out their site: https://www.bethelightcampaign.org/!

You will be eligible for the following exclusive extras dependent upon which package you select. 

  • A signed copy of Reclaim Your Power.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • Invitation to book signing party.
  • Encouragement greeting card brought to you by Be The Light Campaign.
  • Invitation to my Author Community where you will receive an up close and personal seat into my publishing journey. This will also include weekly (May-August) motivational messages, tools, tips and resources.
  • Access to early content, with the opportunity to provide comments and feedback. 
  • Opportunity to vote for a book cover and subtitle.
  • Collaborate with Lauren to speak on how to allow your passions and purpose discover you. 
  • Entry to win a Human Design Reading by Lauren.
  • Entry to win a gift basket containing items Lauren used during her 4-year quest (valued over $250). Basket includes, but is not limited to: 
    • $25 Starbucks gift card
    • $25 Amazon gift card
    • Stress Relief Bath & Body Works Candle 
    • Refreshing Bar of Soap & Palo Santo
    • Jesus Calling Daily Devolutions, by Sarah Young
    • 50 Affirmation Card Deck
    • Journal filled with writing prompts
    • "You are awesome keep that shit up" coffee mug
    • Private in person or virtual yoga session or energy reading from Jenna Durban, creator of Sacred Embodiment Yoga (valued at $75)
    • Custom Mind Muscle Motivator Worksheets
    • Louise Hay Book
  • Invitation to attend a 1 hour live swanky virtual concert. BYOB Saturday May 1st to celebrate your VIP status!
  • Desire to write your own book? Invite to a 1-hour live workshop explaining the Creator's Institute & New Degree Press process. 

 

About the Author

Lauren Krasnodembski is the creator of the Mind Muscle Motivator, LLC. She believes that your mind is like a muscle and you get to exercise it regularly until it begins to serve you. Lauren is a bubbly and compassionate force-to-be reckoned with because when she puts her mind to something the world better watch out!

She is thought provoker, and is passionate about helping other busy driven women discover themselves on a deeper level so their passions and purpose discover them, and they design a life they love!

She is married to her high school sweetheart, Brian and has two beautiful gifts Brody and Maya. By day, she is a full-time healthcare privacy attorney at McKesson, and spends her free time spreading light and love to herself and others through her words and daily actions.

Lauren wrote this book to help other busy driven women discover more fulfillment and zest for their own life. She trusts that her book "Reclaim Your Power" will motivate you to begin or deepen your self-discovery so your passions and purpose discover you and you realize that you too are an instrument of light and love.

In her free time you can find Lauren in the bath, by the fire or in her hammock reading. She enjoys riding bikes and having hot tub dates with her kids and husband. She is a sucker for all water related activities and eating yummy food is her second hobby!

Connect with Lauren

Email: Lauren@mindmusclemotivator.com 

Instagram: Mind_Muscle_Motivator 

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/mindmm/

Website: www.mindmusclemotivator.com  

Facebook: Lauren Krasnodembski

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

Publishing Process 

Reclaim Your Power will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.

The cover design of my book. The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer of 2021.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish an audiobook.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

story_txt:
Story of My BookHi! My name is Lauren Krasnodembski and I am the author of Reclaim your Power.Reclaim Your Power is a memoir that takes you through a season of my life where I went on a 4-year inward quest to find myself, my passions and purpose. I had "checked all of my boxes" only to feel unfulfilled, exhausted, and anxious. I had a nagging feeling inside that I was not doing what I was put on this earth to do, yet I had no idea what that lingering feeling was or how to get off my hamster wheel to explore it. Through my self-discovery process, I realized that you don’t discover your passions or purpose because they discover YOU. I wrote this book because I know I am not the only busy driven woman out there that has asked themselves “Is this really it?” Successful by societal definitions, yet feeling like something is off while juggling the day-to-day stressors of life.My hope is that by reading this book you will discover how to give yourself the love that you so freely give out to others, and to honor your thoughts, feelings and desires.  May it provide you hope and inspiration to reclaim your power by beginning or deepening your self-discovery so that your passions and purpose discover YOU, and you design a life you absolutely love! I desire nothing more than for this book to serve as a guide to help you explore your own personal freedom.You'll learn about the self-discovery process, how to identify what is blocking you from reclaiming your own power, and the art of surrender and flow. You'll hear stories about the time my mom gifted my sister and I with an early Christmas present by taking us to the Passionate Palmist where I was asked a question that changed the trajectory of my life. I share stories about the very first life coach I hired and the unconscious discoveries I encountered as I slowly began to make myself and my desires a priority.  Reclaim Your Power will speak to busy driven women and those seeking to feel lighter and more fulfilled. It will also resonate with those looking for more passion and purpose in their life. VIP Community - What You'll GetBy supporting, you will be a part of the VIP Reclaim Your Power community. For each book sale $5 will be donated to a non-profit called Be The Light Campaign. Their mission entails creating events and random acts of kindness to spread hope, love & compassion. They believe that mental health is just as important as physical health and that a life without hope is not really living. Check out their site: https://www.bethelightcampaign.org/!You will be eligible for the following exclusive extras dependent upon which package you select. 
A signed copy of Reclaim Your Power.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
Invitation to book signing party.

Encouragement greeting card brought to you by Be The Light Campaign.
Invitation to my Author Community where you will receive an up close and personal seat into my publishing journey. This will also include weekly (May-August) motivational messages, tools, tips and resources.
Access to early content, with the opportunity to provide comments and feedback. 
Opportunity to vote for a book cover and subtitle.
Collaborate with Lauren to speak on how to allow your passions and purpose discover you. 
Entry to win a Human Design Reading by Lauren.
Entry to win a gift basket containing items Lauren used during her 4-year quest (valued over $250). Basket includes, but is not limited to: 
$25 Starbucks gift card
$25 Amazon gift card
Stress Relief Bath & Body Works Candle 
Refreshing Bar of Soap & Palo Santo
Jesus Calling Daily Devolutions, by Sarah Young
50 Affirmation Card Deck
Journal filled with writing prompts
"You are awesome keep that shit up" coffee mug
Private in person or virtual yoga session or energy reading from Jenna Durban, creator of Sacred Embodiment Yoga (valued at $75)
Custom Mind Muscle Motivator Worksheets
Louise Hay Book


Invitation to attend a 1 hour live swanky virtual concert. BYOB Saturday May 1st to celebrate your VIP status!

Desire to write your own book? Invite to a 1-hour live workshop explaining the Creator's Institute & New Degree Press process.

Short Summary

Hello I'm Squeak. I am in need of some assistance. I run Pony In A Box Productions. I love to create the audioplays that I, with my wonderful team of people, have been creating since 2011, Doctor Whooves Adventures, Goodnight's Journals, Daring Do Adventures and the coming Mare Do Well Adventures. But do to economic stress unexpected vet bills, student expenses and general misfortune (Which you may no as 'Murphy Attacking', I may not be able to devote as much time to my projects as I have these past two years. If you can, I really need your help. I would like to use the time these donations would buy me to make something awesome, a Doctor Whooves Storyline, Traveler. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need some help in order to keep writing and doing the things I love, I'd like to meet the goal of 2k, but any bit helps. If we succeed in the goal though, we will begin production on Traveler, an epic Doctor Whooves Adventures story spanning three differnt timelines as the Doctor and Twilight race to defeat the darkest evil they have faced...Twilight herself. I can't hope to get the stories I have in production finished in a timely manner if this economic pressure stays on my head. I will still work with Ponyinabox of course, I simply will not be able to devote as much time to the show or its fans. If you help to give me this time, I will do my best to bring one of my most requested stories to life. 

And because I am asking your help, there are perks. 

10$ will earn you a thank you in the credits.

25$ will earn you a personalized thank you from the Doctor himself Jamjar, or any other PIAB character you enjoy.

60$ Will get you a Piab Teeshirt with one of the designs below.

100$ A cameo within the episodes of the Travelr Storyline or a PIAB T-shirt with a design of your choice.

 

 

 

The Impact

I have done stories like this since the fandom began and I'd adore to do them as long as I possibly can. I am deeply thankful for anything you can donate, and even if you can't, just thank you, thank you so much for taking the time to read this. I apprciate it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, if you could spread the word, a tweet, a Tumble a Facebook link, anything you can do to help out. Again, thank you so much for your time. 

 

Streach Goal


Hello guys! Since we made our goal so blindingly fast (Seriously THANK YOU SO MUCH Squeak is so very deeply touched) we've decided to make a streach goal. If we can break 4k before the end of the capain we shall make Number 12 into a full motion comic (Which you can preview here) if that's something you'd like to see, donate! Again thank you, and we hope you enjoy Traveler!

story:
Welcome to the IndieGoGo page for Authors, Large and Small! We are a full-service literary public relations firm, offering online and offline publicity to authors of all genres, self and traditionally published. 

We interview authors and write press releases, solicit blog and Amazon reviews, land bookstore signings and media interviews, and consult regarding how to develop and maintain social media presence, and assist with formal book proposals and queries. 

We have years of experience, and a solid track record of scoring results for an eclectic crowd of writers. Endorsements and more information are available at our regular website, http://authorslargeandsmall.wordpress.com

We are profitable and sustainable financially, just seeking a temporary infusion of cash to spread our values and business model through some strategic advertising. 

Our business is green and eco-friendly, as we all telecommute, reducing air pollution, and send most of our documents and books out as e-copies to save paper. 

We also provide work, references, training, experience and an income source for our team members, many of whom are disabled, terminally ill and uninsured, single parents, recent graduates, recovering from homelessness or addiction, or residents of developing countries. 

We operate through revenue-sharing, where half of what a client pays us will go to a team member in need of flexible work opportunities. Our people are perfectly capable of working and very talented, just need coaching and the chance to set their own schedules. Just because someone cannot show up in a cubicle from 8-7 pm daily, dressed in polished work clothes, in one of the world's major cities, should not mean that the literary industry cannot use their talents!

We seek to empower a broad, diverse group of people through work, education, and income, preserve the environment and our financial resources, and infuse new energy into the publishing and writing fields. 

We are an established company with eight people currently working with us, tackling publicity matters for 32 books. This is more of a sales pitch than a fundraising site, but IndieGoGo lets us accept credit cards for free and easily expand our offerings. 

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to attend the three-day San Francisco Writers' Conference, and let the professional authors there know about Authors, Large and Small. What we have to offer them is cheaper and more flexible and comprehensive than similar services they will find elsewhere, so this is a good set of potential clients. One of our current repeat clients came from the SFWC when I attended as a volunteer five years ago. 

Conference costs $575 if we sign up before Sept 1st, and we're asking for a little over twice that. Our team members who are offering the perks will receive half of whatever you pay us, since our whole business model works through revenue sharing. 

The remainder of what we raise/earn goes to our leadership for personal income (we're starving artists too!) and to other promotional needs (recycled-paper business cards, bus and train fare, food for our author events, etc). 

We'll complete the list of perks/items for sale as time goes on and our staff and team members decide what they have to offer. 

But for now we're offering commentary and advice on your resume, cover letter and/or book query letter, from one of our team members who's quite experienced in providing these services on a freelance basis. 

Also, two of our team members, highly experienced writers with amazing stories to tell, will provide inspirational poetry. 

Our regular literary public relations services are also available here, for their regular prices. These include creating press releases for your work, soliciting blog and Amazon reviews, organizing bookstore signings, landing you media interviews, and consulting regarding social media. 

The Impact

This project seeks to spread the ideas of Authors, Large and Small to the broader literary world. We've been successful so far within our circle of self-published and small-press authors and indie bookstores and bloggers, but we would like to expand our sphere of influence. 

We believe our business model is more humane, eco-friendly and resilient in the face of economic and technical changes. So, we would like to educate people about our ideas for the broader benefit of the literary and publishing industries, as well as to earn money for our team. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have a blog, and are interested in reviewing books, or would like to mention independent and small press books on your Facebook and Twitter accounts, please contact us at cedeptula@sbcglobal.net with Book Review Blogger in the subject line. We are happy to send you free books from a whole variety of genres. 

Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign, online and offline. And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you very much.

Dear Universal Family,

Since I was a little girl, I've known I've always wanted to be a writer. As many of you know I’ve been working on my book, “Be A Thriving Artist, Not A Starving Artist (How To Manifest Your Artistic Dreams Without Struggling)”, and I am now ready to give birth.

In order for me to get to the next level, I could really use your support. Here is how you can help my dream become a reality.

The first phase of this process is to achieve my goal to raise $12,000 dollars or more in 35 days or less. Something to ponder- “Life is short. God’s way of encouraging a bit of focus.” Robert Brault  

The second phase would be to use the contributions to create several new websites, purchase a new laptop, Microsoft Office, McAfee antivirus software, and get professional photos. I would need the services of proof readers and editors. The actual, physical birthing of the book cover, layout and printing the book. Any remaining money left, I would use that for P. R. /marketing and moving the book forward. I am on third base and I need a couple of pushes to get me to home plate or, better, on the New York Times Bestsellers list.

I could really use your support!! Will you help me by donating to my campaign on www.indiegogo.com/cleopatra? Please feel free to email me at cleopatrawrites@yahoo.com or call me at 404.914.3624, if you have any questions.

Finally, remember, as God moves me forward in creating massive success for others and myself, I will never forget your act of generosity toward something I believe in. Please let me know if there’s anything I can ever do to help you move through your life with ease, grace, and a whole bunch a fun. I wish you the best in this moment and beyond.

Thank You,

Cleopatra Bell

 

P.S. Please feel free to share with anyone who would be inspired to give, and  please make sure you check out Level 7-My Gift To You Perk which in my update section. Also I've enclosed my BIO and introduction to my book in that section as well.

story:
About The Writer:

Two years ago, I started work on this book. It had started out as an idea that popped into my brain and it was a joke, more than anything else. Y'know: "Wouldn't it be funny if...?"

I get myself into more trouble asking my brain these kinds of questions, because my brain inevitably starts answering the questions and tacking on other ideas and saying to itself, 'oh, but what if -- and what if --? oh, and what if this happened at this point here?!'.

Before I knew it, I had enough material for a whole book -- hell, a whole series of books -- and my brain refused to let me forget it or set it aside. The ideas that refuse to die are the ones you have to get down on paper otherwise they'll haunt you forever, so I bit the bullet and said to myself - okay, if The Idea is still around by the time NanoWrimo comes around this year, I'll start work on it.

November came around and, wonder of wonders, The Idea was still camped out on my couch, drinking all my good coffee and waiting for me to quit dicking around and start writing, already.

So, I started work and fixated on the daily word counts, the weekly word counts, and surprising myself with how easy it was to develop a strong work ethic when it came to my writing. I not only finished and reached the 50,000 word goal, I finished with several days to spare.

I told myself as soon as November was up and NanoWrimo was over, I'd give myself a month's break and then start working on editing what I'd written and then finish up with the first book.

But then real life happened and my day job ate my life and all my free time and energy along with it. Let's face it - my day job might have paid the bills, but it's never been what I've wanted to do with my life. I've been writing since I was 12 years old and whenever I told anyone about my dream of becoming a published author, they would always tell me 'you won't make a penny' (usually with a pinched, almost apologetic expression on their faces, like 'oh, hon!') and I'd always say, with all the passion of a frantic compulsive, 'I don't care, I just want to write'.

The money has never mattered to me, but the longer I go on, the more I realized my day job would never reward me in the way my writing does. But at the end of the day, after toiling away for hours at my job, I just didn't have the energy or the kind of focus it takes in order to write.

I need time and I need help -- not just to finish the first book, but to get it professionally edited and proofread, to get pretty, pretty cover art created for it and, finally, get it out there for people to read. The Idea is like the bastard child of Godzilla and Frankenstein's Monster: it's not content with being stuck in my skull, it wants to get out and throw the furniture around in your house and drink up all of your good coffee!

 

About The Idea:

With this book, I want to show you vampires in a way you've never seen them before. Years of reading and research are going into the making of this book, but my mission statement from the very beginning has been to take back the vampire genre from writers like Stephenie Meyer. Stephenie claims she was never a fan of vampire novels or movies and, quite frankly, it shows. I want to write a vampire novel for people who know vampires and know they don't sparkle like diamonds in the sun. I want to write a vampire novel for people who love Bram Stoker, for people who saw The Lost Boys in theaters when it first came out and then wore out their VHS copies watching it over and over again, just like I did.

This is a book for people who love vampires, like I always have, and who are dismayed at the involuntary trendy, safe, fang- and blood-free YA-friendly makeover these creatures of the night have gotten in the last 5 or 10 years. This isn't a YA series - make no mistake, it most definitely will feature mature content - but it's going to be asking a lot of mature questions, too: about faith, about grief and guilt, about the nature of mortality and time, about memory and about devotion.

 

About the Campaign:

So this is where you come in. Your donations will help to fund the completion of my book and help me be able to afford to have it professionally edited and proofread. While that's being done, I'll be looking for an artist to do my cover art and I'll be researching options for print copies, though at this time, my primary focus is e-reader formats. With luck, if enough people donate, I'll be able to release the book in e-book formats as well as print and make those available at various levels to the donors.

One of the perks I'm especially excited about is going to be for a select few donors for the book - if you donate a certain amount, you'll not only be getting your copy of the finished book well before it's released to the world at large, but you'll also have the opportunity to meet up with your fellow donors on Skype to have an advance book release Q&A session with me! You'll get the opportunity to give me your feedback about the book as well as ask any questions that you might have. I love hearing from my readers and really look forward to chatting with the donors for this particular perk!

I have to admit, I'm also really excited to see if anyone will go for the Four Poster Bed perk, though I'm more excited about the idea of getting to tattoo your names all over me -- to show that not only is my dream well on its way to coming true, but so I can proudly show off those tattoos and say 'these people helped me make this happen'.

Any money that comes in over the goal will go towards making the book and artwork even cooler than what I already have in mind!

From the start, I had it in mind to crowdsource the completion and eventual release of this book because, to be quite honest, I don't think a professional triple-A publishing house would know what to do with it. And, what can I say, I'm a control freak -- I want to release the book I'm actually writing, not the book big publishing houses are convinced will sell. You guys will know if this book, this story and these characters are for you and, over the coming days/weeks, I'll be sharing more and more of the details about the book with you right here!

If you want to see The Idea get loosed on an unsuspecting public who think the Cullens are the end-all and be-all of vampire fiction, like I do, then throw some cash my way and help me give the current status quo of the genre the mother of all wedgies.

About The Writer:
Two years ago, I started work on this book. It had started out as an idea that popped into my brain and it was a joke, more than anything else. Y'know: "Wouldn't it be funny if...?"
I get myself into more trouble asking my brain these kinds of questions, because my brain inevitably starts answering the questions and tacking on other ideas and saying to itself, 'oh, but what if -- and what if --? oh, and what if this happened at this point here?!'.
Before I knew it, I had enough material for a whole book -- hell, a whole series of books -- and my brain refused to let me forget it or set it aside. The ideas that refuse to die are the ones you have to get down on paper otherwise they'll haunt you forever, so I bit the bullet and said to myself - okay, if The Idea is still around by the time NanoWrimo comes around this year, I'll start work on it.
November came around and, wonder of wonders, The Idea was still camped out on my couch, drinking all my good coffee and waiting for me to quit dicking around and start writing, already.
So, I started work and fixated on the daily word counts, the weekly word counts, and surprising myself with how easy it was to develop a strong work ethic when it came to my writing. I not only finished and reached the 50,000 word goal, I finished with several days to spare.
I told myself as soon as November was up and NanoWrimo was over, I'd give myself a month's break and then start working on editing what I'd written and then finish up with the first book.

story:
OH THE EFFEN PLACES YOU'LL EFFEN GO!!!


What is it? A fully illustrated poem-book, to be distributed in hardcover, and also as an eBook, fully underscored by a "sing-along" soundtrack.

A perfect gift for those who are embarking on a new chapter in life at any stage (except  youngsters who may not be ready for some of the "vernacular" of the text).


Creation Process

Your contribution to my campaign will allow me to 

  • Finish illustrating and colorizing all of the panels that create the pages of the book, which are hand drawn, uploaded into Photoshop, and colorized digitally. 

  • Finish composing and recording the original "sing-along" soundtrack.

  • Purchase all necessary art supplies used to design and create the book ( ie. pens, pencils, bristol board, erasers, Wacom digital pen & tablet).

  • Cover recording studio expenses, and pay additional musicians for the recording of the "sing-along" soundtrack.

  • Self-Publish and distribute the finished product as both ebook and hardcover book.


About the author

"Your Uncle Josh" is the pen name for Joshua Kobak. 

Kobak has lived many lives, with a history full of costumes, uniforms, hats, helmets and stories. He has worked in factories, ridden his motorcycle over 120 thousand miles across North America, and has performed over 22 parts on Broadway's numerous stages for over 12 years. Kobak has also been heard in tiny coffee house corners and world famous venues playing his original music, both solo and also with his band SWIM (see KOBAK MUSIC to check it out). An uncle since the age of 9, Josh has always sketched and written, and has always rhymed. Since then, he has composed, penned and collaborated on two musicals which were featured in the NYC International Fringe Festival, one of which - Subway Train, was billed as a "Beat Poetry Musical".

In his lifetime many have simply called Kobak a poet. Now, after a potentially career shifting injury, he is finally claiming that title, to announce himself to the world as "Your Uncle Josh".


THANK YOU! 

I am very excited to finish this book and get it to all of you, and especially to continue to be Your Uncle Josh! Look for updated content throughout this campaign and please "like" and "follow" and SHARE. Thank you for looking this over and for considering Your Uncle Josh with generosity! Please look over the perks! and don't hesitate to write and ask me anything :)


NOTE: The pitch video only includes a few short excerpts from the poem. You can read the entire poem upon receiving the book ;)


LINKS

Please Like, Follow and Share!

Facebook - Your Uncle Josh

Instagram - Your Uncle Josh

Twitter

KOBAK MUSIC

story:
Story of My Book​

The Mafia Princess is about a mafia princess, Angelica Ferrari, who struggles through her life in the mafia, trying not to be seen as the “typical” princess type. Throughout the story, she evolves from someone who is seen as a chess piece to be moved, to someone who kicks butt and takes names. Her character is all about redefining what people think the role of a princess should be.

My name is Khadijah L. Wynter and I am the author of The Mafia Princess. I wrote this book to showcase a strong female protagonist that doesn’t need anyone to save her and actively goes against the traditional “princess” role. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a strong, relatable character. You will see that not all princesses follow the typical “Disney-style” mold that says they need someone — usually a man — to save them. A real princess takes control of her own story.
You will love this book if you enjoy modern stories about the mafia, strong female protagonists, and narratives that reject traditional stereotypes. The Mafia Princess speaks to women and a young adult audience who value a strong female protagonist with agency, and want to see more stories that challenge the “damsel in distress” narrative you typically see in princess stories — they want to see a princess who rescues herself!

Ultimately, I hope that The Mafia Princess inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions and statements like:

Why do traditional princess narratives position the princess waiting to be saved, as if she doesn’t have agency otherwise?

Can the definition of a “princess” be flexible and go against tradition? 

How do you become your own hero and not rely on someone else?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing the dynamics of the princess narrative and becoming your own hero will change us all for the better. 

Summary of My Book

“In the Mafia lifestyle, you never know when your last day alive will be. Walking down the street with your guard down can lead to you on the side of the road choking on your own blood. Usually over something your employer did, and your murderer will kill you just to send them a message. Betraying the wrong family can lead to one bullet to the head and two to the chest if you are lucky. If you’re not lucky, well, you could spend the last few days of your life stuck in a basement being tortured just for your limbs to be sent to your family piece by piece, with your family hoping they have all the pieces of your body before the day of your funeral. Such are the risks you take in our business. While the men are praised for their heroics, the women are forced to shut up, look pretty, and shop like the airheads their husbands want them to be. Being trained to pull the trigger as a woman is relatively unheard of. This leads to Mafia wives and daughters — ‘princesses’ — being utterly defenseless. That’s not the life I wanted to live, my destiny is bigger than this.

“I, Angelica Ferrari, was destined to be more. I won’t let the barriers my father thinks I should abide by keeping me down. I don’t abide by the rules these old-timers set for me. Nor should I take the abuse my father is determined to dish out to have me stay compliant to him. I clutch my gun and sheath my blades every morning before leaving my loft. I may be a princess, but I’m not a Disney princess. As far as I’m concerned, a real princess gets off her ass and gets shit done. I’ve done tons of jobs with the benefit of my family in mind. I’ve never needed some man to swoop in and save me like a damsel in distress and I find no need to have one now. 

“But when my father’s loyalty and intentions come into question, and my brother Leonardo turns up missing, the only person I can possibly turn to is a guy from another Mafia family: Cristian Salvatore, the heir to the Salvatore throne. But when Cristian finds himself in a sticky situation, it looks like the only person to rescue the men that I need the most is me. You know what they say, real women kick ass."


The Book - The Mafia Princess

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. Readers are introduced to the main character, Angelica Ferrari, and are shown a glimpse of the current situation she finds herself in. It also introduces the secondary character, Cristian Salvatore, and his notorious family as well. 

Part 2 contains chapters 4-10. Here the reader is given a taste of Angelica’s determination to write her own story and be her own hero. Of course, nothing comes easy, so we watch the internal and external battle that Angelica has to go through to be who she is determined to be. Also, how Angelica reacts when on the verge of losing everything and everyone she loves.

Part 3 contains chapters 11-Epilogue. These chapters brings Angelica’s story to a close and show us the decision she makes after all that’s happened. Will she choose the family she was born into, or the newfound family she has found along the way?

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it.

  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover photo.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Khadijah L. Wynter is a writer who loves pushing social norms in the stories she creates. Her parents describe her as passionate, challenging, curious, and outgoing. 

Khadijah always thought there was a lack of “strong female lead” stories, and that most of them had this character needing to be rescued by a man; only after she is rescued, too, is the story put back on track and comes to a nearly satisfying ending. Khadijah’s niece asked her one day, “Why does the princess always have to be rescued?” With that in mind, Khadijah wanted to create a story where the female lead does not need to be rescued by a male secondary character. Instead, she ends up being the one to do the rescuing herself. 

When Khadijah isn’t writing, she loves reading, archery, baking, and spending time with her family and friends. 

For more information, you can connect with Khadijah L. Wynter at Khadijahwynterwriting@yahoo.com and on Instagram @_khadijahwynerauthor.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #TheMafiaPrincess or #TheMafiaPrincessBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Khadijah L. Wynter

story:
Twisted Tech is a book about the future of privacy and the internet. 

My book explains to what extent the government and tech companies track us and why it matters. It differs from the current privacy book market because it has a positive outlook on the future.

My name is Scott McClallen and I am the author of Twisted Tech. I wrote this book to start a conversation about what levels of privacy we are willing to trade for convenience. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will wrestle with difficult questions about the tradeoffs between privacy, security, convenience, and current law.

In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for public policy, safety and policing. 

Ultimately, I want to help you understand the tradeoffs that are associated with the internet, social media, and public policy . 

In this book, you will learn about how law enforcement can weaponize your Google search history and phone's metadata. You'll hear stories such as...

-Detroiter Robert Williams, who thanks to faulty facial recognition, was wrongly arrested and detained for nearly 40 hours over a crime he did not commit.

-How the company PatientsLikeMe sold its users' private medical data without explicitly telling its users.

-How a school spied on a 15-year old. Using the data from his school laptop, he was accused of dealing drugs, when he was in fact just eating candy!

-How employers, through the use of tracking software, have exploited work-from-home orders during the COVID-19 pandemic to spy on employees.

You will love this book if you wonder about Big Tech's influence on us! I address the future of the internet and facial recognition, highlighting the legal and social ramifications of increasing methods of technological surveillance.


Twisted Tech is a nonfiction book for those interested in the future of tech who want to look at privacy and the use of the internet in new and exciting ways!

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. Pre-order tiers help cover publishing costs. Money raised will fund: 

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in December 2021.

Here's how this works: 


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Scott McClallen is a staff writer covering Michigan and Minnesota for The Center Square. A graduate of Hillsdale College, his work has appeared on Forbes.com, RealClearPolicy, Fox News, and FEE.org. Previously, he worked as a financial analyst at Pepsi.

Scott started writing this book during the global pandemic because he saw how the government would exploit the pandemic to trample civil liberties. He hopes to start a conversation about the bounds that government and tech companies should have when selling data and the future of public safety. 

Scott spends his time reading, playing videogames, and caring for an Illinois farm housing goats [picture of Rocco below], chickens, and more. 

 


Other hobbies include reading about wacky tax policy, stupid government laws, and unintended consequences of public policy. 

For more information, you can connect with Scott at smcclallen2@gmail.com and Scott McClallen for LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically mailing the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including shipping costs of into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on my publisher. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #Twistedtech and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.


Thanks again for all of your love and support for joining me on this journey.
Scott McClallen

story:
THANK YOU!

A big thanks to everyone who pre-ordered B.S., Incorporated—the books will ship to you the first week in May. If you'd still like to read the book, never fear! You can pre-order it on www.seattlebookcompany.com (our book distributor), Amazon, Barnes & Noble or iBooks. The official book launch is May 17. 


About the Book

B.S., Incorporated is our debut novel—a funny, heartfelt story about a big, dumb, but well-meaning company teetering on the brink of disaster. Think The Office meets The Devil Wears Prada. The book officially launches May 17, 2016, published by Wise Ink Creative Publishing in Minneapolis.

"The emphasis is on the characters—and there are some really wonderful ones in B.S., Incorporated. It is a very heartfelt story ... I really enjoyed it. 4 out of 5 stars."

- NetGalley review


                                            


About the Authors: Jennifer Rock and Michael Voss

We spent the better part of two decades careening through corporate America—and barely lived to write about it. As company journalists, speechwriters, and communication directors, we took notes. Copious notes. "Someone-should-write-a-book-about-this" notes. So, we did. 

We both live near Minneapolis, Minnesota, where we work as speakers and communication consultants. We share our best stories during happy hour. 


                                     


About The Story

Business Solutions, Inc., is falling apart at the seams. While employees kill time stalking free snacks and filming porn in the HQ stairwells, the company's co-CEOs bring in shadowy corporate consultants to shake up their business in ways even they don't understand. 

As the communications manager tasked with translating C-suite doublespeak, Will Evans is constantly torn between his blue-collar warehouse past and his white-collar future. When he is put in charge of rolling out a dubious strategy the consultants brand Optelligence, Will is thrust deep into a muddle of absurdity and responsibility he never expected.

Enter Anna Reed, corporate mercenary with heels as high as her ambition. To her, BSI is just a steppingstone to a better job at a smarter company. Demoted to Will’s team on her first day, she’s ready to steamroll anyone to get her career back on track.

When BSI is pushed to the brink of bankruptcy, Will hatches a covert plan that just might save them all. But he needs Anna’s cunning and courage to pull it off. Can Anna, the consummate job jumper, find a reason to go all-in on BSI? Or is she better off bailing and letting the company go down in flames?      


                                          


About This Pre-Sale Campaign

Nearly six years ago we sat on a restaurant patio in the shadow of our employer's office building and hatched a plan to write this book. After more than 60 months of rejections, revisions, and resolve, we found a terrific publisher to help us make it a reality. We've since invested hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars in professional publishing services (we pay upfront for editing, cover design, printing, distribution, etc.). All of this work is to make B.S., Incorporated the best it can be possibly be. And unlike traditional publishers, Wise Ink allows their authors to keep 100% of their royalties after those up-front investments. And while we are now ready to take this humorous, heartfelt story to the world, we need just a little help to make that happen. 

Which is where you and this fundraising campaign come in. By pre-ordering a copy of the book via any of the perk packages on the right side of this page, you will help us fund the last remaining piece of the publishing puzzle: publicity. Our campaign goal amount will fund a 6-month contract with our publicist—to help us get the word out through local and national TV, radio, and print media. Any amount we raise beyond the goal will fund an even broader marketing campaign, including ads on Facebook, conference sponsorships, and more.

You can see we're more than a little ambitious in our plans. Our goal is to reach anyone and everyone who has languished even a day in a soul-sucking job. We want to save (and entertain) as many lost corporate souls as possible.      


Even Better Than Leftover Meeting Muffins in the Break Room!           

So pre-order the book now, and you can not only be the first in your cube-farm to read B.S, Incorporated, you can also brag about your role in helping bring it to life. And while you're at it, consider one of the fun Office Survival Kits or other perks, some of which are pictured below. Or buy the right to name a Book 2 character—yes, we're working on the sequel. And our publisher is not shy about reminding us the clock is ticking on our writing deadlines.    


                        

                       


IMPORTANT NOTE #1: If you order an e-book, click on the red "contact" button under the video near the top of this page. It'll ask you to log in with an email address and password. Then, send us a message with the type of e-reader you use (a Kindle or any other type of device). Likewise, if you order a signed, printed book, use the same process to send us your inscription. 

IMPORTANT NOTE #2: Every perk package comes with a Business Solutions Incorporated Employee of the Month certificate. After purchasing your book and swag, simply go to our web site's Buy the Book page—the cute li'l hangman drawing is a secret link to a downloadable, customizable PowerPoint certificate. 

IMPORTANT NOTE #3: Regarding the "Name a Character in Book 2" packages: With great naming power comes great responsibility. Our books are humorous, but also based in reality. So please, no Alabaster Huckleberrys or Tatiana Snarkypantses. In other words, we reserve the right to ask you to "try again" on any submissions that wildly stray from the tone and the story.)


For More Information

Thank you for being a part of B.S., Incorporated! Feel free share this page with other book lovers. Visit us at www.rockandvossbooks.com or connect with us on social media:

  • www.facebook.com/rockandvossbooks
  • www.instagram.com/rockandvossbooks
  • www.twitter.com/jenniferrock or www.twitter.com/MVoss23

story:
A bit about us:

Asymmetric Magazine is an art and music community that thrives on passionate storytelling. Our goal is to discover, showcase and celebrate today's artists and musicians and be the vessel for their stories. We started in Los Angeles, and with each featured artist, we aim to capture the ever-changing LA story and bring the city's artists together on a unique platform. In our plans to grow, we hope to extend our reach to artists across the globe.

 

Phase 1:

First and foremost, we need funding to expand the Asymmetric team. Let’s face it: We’re maxing out our capabilities with our current bandwidth, and we’re eager to grow. When we rise, we bring artists up with us. With a larger team, we’ll be able to conduct more artist features and have more event coverage across the city. What this means for artists: With more of us, we can reach more of you and help give you the attention and exposure you deserve. What this means for our readers: We can reach more of you, too, and we’ll be able to share much more great content, published more consistently.

 

Phase 2:

We’re going to bring our print issues back. We want to keep print alive and give artists a space to share their stories in our print publications, but printing costs are a killer. We’ve had the incredible opportunity to establish relationships with a few of local LA shops that are currently carrying Asymmetric publications (Skylight Books and Fingerprints Music to name a couple and many more to come). This means as soon as we’re able to start printing regular issues again, ideally quarterly or biannually, we’ll have a larger circulation than ever before. Artists, that’s even more exposure for you. Readers, that’s more ways to read our content plus have high quality, timeless print magazines to line your apartment with. You’ll be supporting local art, music AND print journalism, and your guests will love them, too–we promise!

// pictured above: a peek at our print issues

// pictured above: our Introspect art book on sale at Skylight Books in Los Angeles

// pictured above: our Introspect art book on sale at Fingerprints Music in Los Angeles

 

Phase 3:

We want to change the way you’re consuming art. One of our larger initiatives is to make art more approachable and accessible to the public. We don’t believe art should only be on view during weekday business hours or–even scarier–“by appointment only”. Similarly, we don’t believe art should be viewed in a quiet, sterile environment at all. We want to bring people together and create an atmosphere that encourages conversation and community. To us, this means combining art with live music, readings, screenings, etc., hosting events on weekend nights when more people can attend, and having a lively bar serving up drinks–just like a party–the way art should be.

We want to make art shows as simple and enjoyable as possible for the artists themselves, too. We feel group shows are best on a smaller scale, so nothing feels oversaturated or gets truncated, and each artist has their space to shine. We also want to keep vendor/space fees at a minimum, and we NEVER want to take cuts of artists’ sales. This often means paying more for the right gallery space that won’t take cuts from artists either.

We hosted our first two-night group art event Introspect in April of 2018, and we considered it to be a huge success (take a look for yourself here). We’d like to gather the funding to host and curate regular, thematic group art shows and multimedia events, plus create printed companion art books for each show. The funding will go towards space rental, merchandise printing costs and paying our live performers, event photographers and lovely bartenders.

// pictured above: a look at our Introspect art show in Los Angeles

We know $15,000 is a lot, but hear us out:
Based on our last event, we know $5,000 will cover all event costs for our next art event. The additional $10,000 will allow us to pay our collaborators, start printing again, and get a head start on funding for future events. With our now larger distribution and circulation, we can print larger runs, lowering the printing cost per issue. We're hopeful that within a few runs, printing will pay for itself and continue to fund us.

We’re 100% independent and funded by our readers, so any donation will help us reach our goals. We hope to aid in the expansion of the amazing art and music community in LA and connect our readers to new discoveries. Thanks so much for your continued support!

Xx,
Leah

story:
Join the Revolution.

The Living Stone.

 

It is a dark time for the land of men.

After centuries of corruption and war, the elven Empire of Kryus has conquered and colonized the nations of men, oppressing humanity into a false peace and suppressing the truth of who they once were.

And so men have lost the way.

Caleb De’Ador – a man who knows the truth and trained by the elves – returns to his homeland. Haunted by prophecy and his own past, Caleb’s purpose is to raise an army of believers and teach humanity how to be free again.

But before this revolution begins, Caleb must reach the Living Stone.

At the same time, a long forgotten evil is unleashed, threatening to throw all living beings into an even greater darkness. A young woman, Eshlyn, takes on the task of warning her people and keeping her son safe.

____________________________________

 

Hello! I am MB Mooney, author of a new fantasy novel entitled The Living Stone. While I've been writing stories since the 2nd grade, this is the first novel I'll be self publishing.

The first book in a series entitled the Eres Chronicles, the Living Stone has been described as a mix between LOTR, Narnia, and Game of Thrones. In other words, it is a story focused on character, story, and action; it possesses Christian allegory and parallels; but it is a dark, violent and more modern story. This makes it a unique book.

People have also really enjoyed reading it!

I've been working on this book for over 3 years: the idea, the characters, building the world and history, and the plot. After finishing the first draft and two major revisions, it is almost ready to publish ... but I need your help.

What I Need & What You Get

$5000 of your help.

Good Lord. Why all that money?

First of all, like all professional books, it needs a good professional edit, which is an expensive endeavor. And since I am self-publishing, that money comes from me ... or you and me.

Second, some extra funds would help make the overall product look and feel more professional: graphics, cover art, website, etc. Many of these things I could do, but a little extra fundage would help with those things, too.

Oh, and there also needs to be some money to produce and ship the awesome rewards you get. Check 'em out.

Since the primary reason for this is to raise money for a professional edit, that will take time to get back, make corrections, etc, so that is why the target date for getting your "perks" seems so far away! The plan is to have this done by May, but I'm giving myself some wiggle room here.

And remember, the more money I raise, the better quality those perks will be!

If I make the goal, then you will be part of launching a great book and making it more accessible to the masses. If I don't make the goal ... well, I get to put out what I can and do it barebones.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have money but want to help? You can:

Share link on Facebook, Twitter, etc. Use Indiegogo share tools!

You can also watch a different promo video with a personal message from me here.

I hope you JOIN THE REVOLUTION!

Peace.

PS - Music for promo video by Stacy Marie Walker and Cornel Olar. Check them out at www.transcendthetrilogy.com!


PPS - The amazing artist I'm talking to for some artwork is Jeremiah Briggs. Check him out at www.jeremiahbriggs.wordpress.com!

 PPPS - The person doing my graphic work (putting the cover together, etc) and responsible for the image seen above is Paul Gary. He doesn't have a website, but he's done a great job and I recommend him for any graphic art you'd like to do! Msg or email me if you'd like his info.

story:
Velvet Redemption is the story of Justin Pierce, a graphic designer from Denver, Colorado. One night he and his girlfriend Lisa are driving home, and due to distracted driving, he gets into a horrifying wreck. Lisa's life is lost as a result. 

Six months pass, and Justin tries to move on with his life, but he finds himself unable to. He decides to kill himself by jumping off the top of a mountain. Before he can complete the task, a demon named Lilandra appears before him, offering to bring Lisa back to life. 

The catch? He must find a mystical blade and use it to stop a brewing war between Heaven and Hell. He'll do battle with Lucifer and even Michael the archangel as he starts his quest to bring Lisa back. Along the way he'll realize that his mission is about more than saving Lisa. It's about saving the entire world. 

I've tried many times and ways to get this book published, but I've been unable to find any literary agents or publishers who were willing to give the title a chance. The publishing world is full of writers trying to do the same thing. So, I'm taking matters into my own hands and asking you to help me publish Velvet Redemption. 

The total amount I'm seeking is $2,500. I'll use approximately $1,400 of that for professional editing services and another $200 to have the edited novel converted into an Amazon Kindle-friendly format. The remaining funds will be used to print copies of the book and take care of prizes for those who pledged funds. 

If the book is completely funded by the end of December, then I'll anticipate releasing the book in February of 2015. Prizes will be sent out by June of 2015 unless otherwise posted. 

I'll keep those who pledge funds updated on the project status as time goes on if the book is successfully funded. 

Trust me when I say I have faith in this book. I've worked on it for years, and it's ready to enter the world as a published novel. I'm asking for those who are even remotely interested in this project to help. Just give me a shot by funding this book, and I'll handle the rest to get Velvet Redemption out to the world. 

To read an excerpt of the story, click here.

story:
Short Summary

Hi my  name is Johnny Murillo. Since I first step foot onto a small conservative bible college in southern Arizona, I made a commitment to reach the world for the Kingdom of God. In that 20 year journey we've youth pastored, launched a program called Master's Commission, were the District Youth Directors for our Assembly of God District, were mentored as  Church Planters at New Hope Oahu in Hawaii, planted a church in Sacramento and now God has called us to Hollywood to learn the art of filmmaking. So for the past 7 years I've been working in LA as an actor, producer and writer learning the as much as I can about how to make a movie. My goal now is to train churches from a Pastors perspective on how to make a movie. This e-Training Manual will be written with the church in mind and it's mission to reach the world with the Gospel. This decade alone several churches have proven that a church can make a movie. So my mission with this e-Training Manual is to give the tools and point out the assets that churches already have so that they can make a movie with the crew in the pew. We  also want to launch a training website and webinar series that will teach churches the skills needed to create life changing digital narrative. Your partnership will help me help churches and together we will advance the Kingdom! 


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need the funds to finish the book, launch a webinar series and build a website with clips and tips on the different aspects of filmmaking from a Pastors perspective.
  • Your different levels of partnership will help us build an audience of faith film lovers, get you the e-Training Manual sent to your email when it's done and even access to the training website for your whole church.
  • In the event that our goal is not reached the amount collected will still launch us in the right path but in a baby step pace, but we will still get'erdone!

The Impact.

  • Can you imagine how powerful a church movie movement can be? We can flood the market with powerful testimonies that can reach the world in all languages.
  • As a 20 veteran pastor that God has called into the film industry I know and can teach what it will take for a church to make a movie.
  • Actors, writers, crew, locations, cooks and equipment are sitting in churches waiting to be challenged to create a new level of outreach.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Please pray for us as we launch into this new endeavor. I know that the obstacles that churches will encounter will be tough but the end result will be lives changed. Become a Prayer Producer and commit to praying for us today.
    • Also get the word out to as many as you can on Facebook, twitter, etc. We need al the help we can so that we can change the world together for the Kingdom!

story:
Silence in the Library and the authors of the incredibly successful speculative fiction anthology Time Traveled Tales are back again with Time Traveled Tales, Volume 2!

In Time Traveled Tales, Volume 2, readers will experience the thrills, the terrors, the joy, and the often heart-rending sadness of over 500 pages of speculative stories from authors including Aaron Allston, Jean Rabe, Michael A. Stackpole, Timothy Zahn, Janine Spendlove, Bryan Young, and many, many others. 

Each story is beautifully illustrated by renowned artist Matt Slay. Best known for his work for IDW’s Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Comics and several Upper Deck Marvel projects, Matt brings a realism and emotional context to his illustrations that captures the spirit of every story. 

The best part is that the book is already ready to go and has been sent to the printer. The purpose of this Indiegogo project is strictly pre-sales. Because the book is ready to go, and because Indiegogo payments are immediately available, upon backing this project, you'll receive the eBook within a matter of days, and the print book within a month from the end of the project.

For those of you who weren't backers of Time Traveled Tales, we've created perk levels at  which you'll be able to buy both Time Traveled Tales, and Time Traveled Tales, Volume 2.

So, please join us (once again) in this exciting adventure of the imagination.


Authors


The List:

Aaron Allston, Michael A. Stackpole, Timothy Zahn, Maxwell Alexander Drake, Janine K. Spendlove, Bryan Young, C.S. Marks, Aaron Rosenberg, Donald J. Bingle, Kelly Swails, Jean Rabe, John Helfers, Jennifer Brozek, Daniel Myers, Tracy Chowdhury, Gregory A. Wilson, Dylan Birtolo, R.T. Kaelin, Steven Saus, Sarah Hans, Bradley P. Beaulieu, Brian E. Shaw, Maggie Allen.

story:
Every since my mother introduced me to the world of horror shows and movies, I’ve been a fan of everything horror. As a kid, despite being afraid after reading a horror story or watching a show or film, I still couldn’t get enough of it.

After years of consuming what the horror genre has to offer, I’ve finally decided to come up with my own stories. So I’ve recently published a collection of short horror stories and I am looking for support in helping to promote my book.


About my Book:

For me, dreams are part nightmare, part mystery, and part pure inspiration. In the hypnagogic state, the ephemeral boundary between sleep and the waking world, my dreams flourished. I bring them to life in Hypnagogic Tales, a trio of mysteries enhanced by the supernatural and science fiction.

In “Second Chance,” a coma patient becomes the object of fascination for FBI Agents. As they begin to unravel her mysterious past, she fears what epiphany awaits.

Within “Be Wary of Wishes” Erica is thrilled when Nolan, her handsome neighbor asks her out on a mini adventure in Central Park. But when her life starts to spin into a dizzying avalanche of good luck followed by Nolan’s bizarre comments and behavior, Erica begins to worry about what's next.

Tormented by gruesome dream images, a woman fights for her sanity in her waking hours. When Amanda, a scared and abused child appears at her door one night, begging for help, she takes her in. As secret upon secret conspires to unravel her life, she becomes uncertain of who can be trusted. As her life begins to close in around her, she learns that there is “No Room for Secrets.”

About Me:

Harlem-born, I am a licensed master social worker living in New York City. My upbringing as a foster child inspired me to write Through the Belly of the Beast and Back: My Life in Foster Care. I am currently working to finance a documentary on foster care in New York City.

Where Your Contribution will go towards:

Although my book titled HYPNAGOGIC TALES has recently been published, I need to raise funds to promote my book in order for horror fans to know it’s ready to be possessed.

Your contributions will make a difference in helping me to share my horror stories with those who love all that is horror.

Specifically, I will be using the money raised here towards:

• Promotional copies for reviews to magazines and blogs, plus postage

• Promotional items (bags, pens, t-shirts, and other items that help to promote my book)

• Graphic Design Work for promotional products 

• Creating a website

story:
Not Your Ordinary Magazine About Gentrification

Rent is Theft is different in that it shrugs off popular yet superficial condemnation of the upper-middle-class, and instead focuses on the fundamental social and economic structures that make gentrification possible, and offers radical solutions for a better world.

In the first issue we focus on the argument against rent, the history of Bushwick, Brooklyn, the city policies of police violence, and the world we wish to see. Throughout the publication, we seek to make the case for instigating an indefinite rent strike, expropriating property from the landlords, and advocating for the renters taking control of their homes.

What We Need

This is not a money making venture. We intend to distribute copies of our magazine free of charge. By forgoing any sort of income from the project, we are forced to rely on donations for the funds to print the magazine.

We will also have the the magazine available in PDF form for free.

The Impact

What we hope to get out of this project is an end to the cycle of reliance upon neoliberal solutions and the minuscule victories that come with it. We hope to further educate the people most vulnerable to gentrification and give them alternative avenues to direct their rage, instead of relying on social services, liberal NGO's, and back-stabbing politicians.

We want to present a new world in which a house is a home, and not a vehicle for wealth extraction by the wealthy few.
