story:
Before You Start

Check out the real, interactive, choose your own video adventure at Interlude: http://in.fm/v/ab?vid=V8W2XA 
Now, back to your scheduled programming.

Hey, I'm Amber T. Lee

And I'm raising money to have my book Heliophiliacs printed and published under my own production company, Originelle Design and Production.

HELIOPHILIACS  is a dark comedy written as an illustrated choose your own adventure novel. I know. Can you feel the goosebumps? It's your average story of girl meets boy, girl sleeps with boy, girl and boy slowly destroy each other in a twisted mix of love and fate. You know, your typical romance.

                              

  A Few Questions You Might Have:

Who are you? I'm a writer, artist, and filmmaker based in the United States. Over the years my work in video and performance has taken me all over the world. I've shown in galleries in Paris, London, Berlin, and Korea just to name a few. I recently founded my own production company, Originelle Design and Production with co-directors Lauren Jared and Leah Ariel Wallace.

What's Originelle?

We're a production company that specializes in interactive, collaborative, multimedia works. Think an animation voiced by actors living in different cities across the world, or poetry gathered across continents, or you know, a choose your own adventure novel.

Originelle is a stupid name. So is Heliophiliacs. What's with the stupid names?

You're stupid.

...I'm sorry. I didn't mean that. I like making up words. Get used to it.

Why should I give you my money?

Well, one, this book is something new. It's an experiment in genres, and it questions everything from love to race identity to the meaning of fate. Plus, it's a friggin choose your own adventure novel. Do you remember reading those? You're like, 'go to the door' 'oh shit' 'no, I meant stay inside, stay inside' 'phew'

Second, 10% of the proceeds from this book, including this campaign, are going to the Brain Research Foundation. They do scientific research to help those with both mental disorders (a big theme in the book) and neurological diseases (a big part of my life).

How long did you work on Heliophiliacs?

It's been a long, incredible journey. I started three years ago, writing down glamorized stories of my own adventures in the basement of Defibrillator Art Gallery. This was a pet project for me. For two years I played with the characters, based off of my friends and I, mixing and mangling them until they weren't us anymore and it wasn't my story. I took the story with me on a performance tour through thirty cities in Europe, scribbled it in notebooks in New York, illustrated it in L.A., but I couldn't bring myself to publish it. "It wasn't ready" or so I kept telling myself. 

Then finally, I heard about this thing called National Novel Writing Month, where you write 50,000 words in thirty days. I had a novel I wanted to write, so I decided to give it a try. Problem was, I found out about the competition three days before it was done. So, with Mr. Folger by my side I spent the next three days re-writing Helio from scratch. The rules were, you had to start fresh and so, I opened up a blank word document and wrote 50,000 words in three days. After that, I knew I had to do something with the novel. It wasn't my pet any more. It was a lot of hard work and time, and I wanted to share it. 

So, I started editing. Edited in Korea, on a cross-state tour with my collaborators Eric Piper and J. David Osbourne, and finally in Virginia. During the process, my brother developed a neurological disease called ADEM. He's made a miraculous recovery, but he started out nearly comatose. My family and I pushed together to take care of him, and seeing his fragility pushed me to see my work through. During the days, I helped the family as much as I could, and at night, I would stay up with coffee and energy drinks, pushing the editing and illustrating process forward until I had the final product. 

Heliophiliacs.

That's Where You Come In

I want to publish Heliophiliacs under my own production company's name. For that, I need money to print and ship the books. Here's the breakdown:

To print 100 books and ship them to my house, it costs $606

To ship them out costs about $3, so that adds another $300 fee, which brings us up to $900. I made it $1000 to have room for whatever goes wrong. Not a lot of room, just a little foot room.

So, what do you get?

First of all, the book. Everyone who donates will receive a copy of Heliophiliacs. In addition we have:

Helio Tee- Shirts

Personalized Animations (This is one I did for Lightbulb's Lament by Grant Wamack)

Posters by Originelle Design

A Star Named Whatever You Want

And a mystery prize that you will love. Shh. It's a secret.

story_txt: Before You StartCheck out the real, interactive, choose your own video adventure at Interlude: http://in.fm/v/ab?vid=V8W2XA Now, back to your scheduled programming.Hey, I'm Amber T. LeeAnd I'm raising money to have my book Heliophiliacs printed and published under my own production company, Originelle Design and Production.HELIOPHILIACS  is a dark comedy written as an illustrated choose your own adventure novel. I know. Can you feel the goosebumps? It's your average story of girl meets boy, girl sleeps with boy, girl and boy slowly destroy each other in a twisted mix of love and fate. You know, your typical romance.                                A Few Questions You Might Have:Who are you? I'm a writer, artist, and filmmaker based in the United States. Over the years my work in video and performance has taken me all over the world. I've shown in galleries in Paris, London, Berlin, and Korea just to name a few. I recently founded my own production company, Originelle Design and Production with co-directors Lauren Jared and Leah Ariel Wallace.What's Originelle?We're a production company that specializes in interactive, collaborative, multimedia works. Think an animation voiced by actors living in different cities across the world, or poetry gathered across continents, or you know, a choose your own adventure novel.Originelle is a stupid name. So is Heliophiliacs. What's with the stupid names?You're stupid....I'm sorry. I didn't mean that. I like making up words. Get used to it.Why should I give you my money?Well, one, this book is something new. It's an experiment in genres, and it questions everything from love to race identity to the meaning of fate. Plus, it's a friggin choose your own adventure novel. Do you remember reading those? You're like, 'go to the door' 'oh shit' 'no, I meant stay inside, stay inside' 'phew'Second, 10% of the proceeds from this book, including this campaign, are going to the Brain Research Foundation. They do scientific research to help those with both mental disorders (a big theme in the book) and neurological diseases (a big part of my life).How long did you work on Heliophiliacs?It's been a long, incredible journey. I started three years ago, writing down glamorized stories of my own adventures in the basement of Defibrillator Art Gallery. This was a pet project for me. For two years I played with the characters, based off of my friends and I, mixing and mangling them until they weren't us anymore and it wasn't my story. I took the story with me on a performance tour through thirty cities in Europe, scribbled it in notebooks in New York, illustrated it in L.A., but I couldn't bring myself to publish it. "It wasn't ready" or so I kept telling myself. Then finally, I heard about this thing called National Novel Writing Month, where you write 50,000 words in thirty days. I had a novel I wanted to write, so I decided to give it a try. Problem was, I found out about the competition three days before it was done. So, with Mr. Folger by my side I spent the next three days re-writing Helio from scratch. The rules were, you had to start fresh and so, I opened up a blank word document and wrote 50,000 words in three days. After that, I knew I had to do something with the novel. It wasn't my pet any more. It was a lot of hard work and time, and I wanted to share it. So, I started editing. Edited in Korea, on a cross-state tour with my collaborators Eric Piper and J. David Osbourne, and finally in Virginia. During the process, my brother developed a neurological disease called ADEM. He's made a miraculous recovery, but he started out nearly comatose. My family and I pushed together to take care of him, and seeing his fragility pushed me to see my work through. During the days, I helped the family as much as I could, and at night, I would stay up with coffee and energy drinks, pushing the editing and illustrating process forward until I had the final product. Heliophiliacs.   That's Where You Come In I want to publish Heliophiliacs under my own production company's name. For that, I need money to print and ship the books. Here's the breakdown:To print 100 books and ship them to my house, it costs $606To ship them out costs about $3, so that adds another $300 fee, which brings us up to $900. I made it $1000 to have room for whatever goes wrong. Not a lot of room, just a little foot room.So, what do you get?First of all, the book. Everyone who donates will receive a copy of Heliophiliacs. In addition we have:Helio Tee- ShirtsPersonalized Animations (This is one I did for Lightbulb's Lament by Grant Wamack)Posters by Originelle DesignA Star Named Whatever You WantAnd a mystery prize that you will love. Shh. It's a secret.  Other Ways You Can Help If you can't give, that's cool. Just help me to spread the word. Share this with everyone you can, in every way you can and help me to reach my goal. Thanks so much!

story:
My name is Margie and I live in So. Calif. with my husband, Bob, and our dog JoJo. One morning I woke up with an idea.

For years I have listened to and observed the animal activities of the ranch by my house and one morning it came to me to write a story about them.  My main character is Wendy, a little chick my daughter and I rescued and my imagination took off from there.  This little fantasy fiction ended up being a novelette suitable for middle grade children that I feel they would enjoy.  My friend Victoria Barras has generously offered to do chapter sketches and now we are both excited to have this published.

The contributions here will pay for self publishing fees and expenses for perks and shipping.

story:
Life is a song, its notes alternate themselves between breaks and melodies. Everything flows and goes but emotions leave echoes in your mind...and in my eyes She...

This is a love story, a journey to reach the girl that I've loved for all of my life, through myself discovery and a total body change, fighting in a world full of prejudice.

This happens with the help of music.

Music is the soundtrack of all moments of our life.

The “Storycode” is a book, an autobiographic love story. It has two cds inside and qr codes through the pages, that contain photos of my life from my birth until now.

It is an innovative very difficult project, that requires a lot of time and money, so I ask you to help me to achive it.

This story tells about Enrico, an italian musician, in the middle of his FTM transition from female to male, and difficulties he has to pass trough.

He finds difficulties expecially with his job when his voice changing.

He doesn't fall down about it and finds solutions not to miss the music.

Often in the story, the memories of Her returns in his life. A lot of flashbacks explains Enrico's love to the same girl during his entire life. Unfortunately, for different reasons during the story, Enrico cannot reach her.

Until, with his self confidence, he finds the courage to tell his feelings about her.

The protagonist is me, Enrico.

The sotry is writing by Ferruccio Scarpella, an italian writer. He is able to write on paper my feelings.

The story is my autobiography, so it tells about real facts.

I'm a transgender italian musician and singer. I started my transition two years ago in 2012, when I decided to discover the origin of my pains that I feel during all my life.

Music is still the best part of me. I'm a song writer.

I love music, I love writing words. I sing to express myself, to reinterpret myself and my emotions.

I have been writing music for 10 years, but I love singing cover songs, too.

I have been studied music since I was 6 and....I have never stop yet.

I sing, I play guitar and piano. I love all that is music, all that shakes my body and soul.

Inside the Storycode, there are 2 cds, the first one made before my transition, 3 years ago, with my female voice, and the second one, under construction, with my male voice.

To realize my cds, I took advantage of the expertise of professional musicians and singers, who are well-known in the North of Italy and of professional recording studios to have the best quality album.

The first cd “DO” features 10 songs, 8 covers and 2 songs wrote by me:

1. Don't you remember (Adele cover)

2 Sunrise (Norah Jones cover)

3 Thinking about you (Norah Jones cover)

4. Listen to your heart (Roxette cover)

5. A night like this (Caro Emerald cover)

6. Smooth operator (Sade cover)

7. Kiss Kiss (Holly Valance cover)

8. La notte (Arisa cover)

9. Do

10. La mia musica


The second cd “TRY TO DO IT” features 9 songs wrote by me:

1. By my side

2. Senza nomi

3. Vento

4. Semplice

5. Cosa non darei

6. Everything of your life

7. Rosso

8. Girotondo

9. Sempre

click here if you want hear a mix of songs of either cds, to hear the difference of voices.


I can send the translation of the lyrics of my songs from italian to english language, if request.

Within the Storycode, there are often references to my songs.

You can find Qr Codes near them. So, with a simple click of your smartphone, with an apposite app (Qr Code reader), you can see a slideshow of photos relevant to different times of my life.

The reader can satisfy his curiosity and see my changing, so he can be part of the story.

The Storycode is not a simple book, I don't want my story only to be read but also heard and seen, just to involve all the senses of the reader in a total innovative experience.

I think that the Storycode is an encouragement for everybody.

I decided to write my story, because, before starting my transition, I was scared about it and I've serched someone that has done it. I think my story can help other guy that want to start transitioning.

I want tell them that, with courage and perseveration, you can reach what you want and you can be happy.

The Storycode tells about a guys that was face to face with his fears: to like himself, to be accepted, to continue to sing whith the voice changing...and he did it!

I hope it can help people that feel theyr body not belong to them, and find dangerous solution like suicide.

With my story I say that everybody can win a gender disorder.

Voice changing, in ormon therapy, is not easy, expecially for who sings as a job, like me.

My experience explain how I work about it, who I asked to resolve this problem.

This can be a valid help for who is afraid of voice changing in ormon therapy.

- To LGBT people and community, that probably live everyday the same situation as mine.

- To musician and singers, to who loves music and think music is a life reason.

- To people that don't accept who is different from them. I hope that reading my story, they realize that we are all the same, but we are also a little different each others.

The goal is at 8000 euros. This is the list of costs I have to have:

  • writer

  • book translator from italian to english language

  • book printing

  • musician and singers that rearranged my songs

  • recording studio

  • cd printing

  • qr code generator

  • design

  • delivery

If you send money, you'll receive something in return.

You can find the list on the right of the page.

If I reach the goal, I can make and post the videoclip of the song “By My Side”

you can share my project on facebook, twitter or email it to your friends.

My first thanks to my family, that support me every day.

I say thanks to my friends, that accept me like who I am and they have totally respect of me and my decisions.

I thaks to all of people that inspire me every day.

Thanks to everybody are cooperating for this project.

And last but not least, I thank you that belive in me and support me.


ITA

    " I sogni non hanno sesso, hanno solo ali e voglia di volare..."

    La vita è una canzone, le note si alternano tra pause e melodie. Tutto scorre e se ne ne va, ma l'emozione che ti lascia ti rimbomba nella mente...

E' una storia d'amore, un viaggio alla conquista della musa amata da tutta una vita, attraverso la scoperta di sè, fino al cambiamento radicale e totale del proprio essere, mutando addirittura il proprio corpo, lottando contro un mondo fatto di pregiudizi. Tutto questo attraverso la musica.

La musica fa da colonna sonora ad ogni momento della nostra vita.

Lo Storycode è un libro, un romanzo autobiografico, con due cd musicali al suo interno e diversi qrcodes, sparsi tra le pagine, che rimandano a slideshow di foto della mia vita, dalla mia nascita ad oggi.

E' un progetto innovativo e molto articolato che richiede molto tempo e denaro ed è per questo che sono qui a chiedere il vostro aiuto per portarlo a termine.

Questa storia parla di Enrico, un musicista, nel mezzo del percorso di transizione FTM da donna a uomo, con tutte le difficoltà che il cambiamento fisico porta con sè. Trova difficoltà soprattutto col suo lavoro di cantante, quando non riesce più a gestire la voce che cambia.

Non si perde d'animo e trova le soluzioni per non perdere ciò che ama fare.

Spesso i ricordi della donna che ama riaffiorano nella sua vita e nella storia ci sono svariati flash back che spiegano la sua infatuazione già dall'infanzia per la stessa ragazza.

Per diversi motivi, Enrico, dovrà rinunciare a lei per gran parte della sua vita.

Ma, con la consapevolezza di sè e di ciò che vuole, ad un certo punto riuscirà ad avere coraggio e dirle ciò che prova...

Il protagonista della storia sono io, Enrico.

La storia è scritta da Ferruccio Scarpella, uno scrittore italiano che sta trasferendo nero su bianco i miei racconti e i miei sentimenti.

La storia è tratta dalla mia biografia, perciò da fatti reali.

Sono un cantante e musicista transgender italiano. Ho iniziato il percorso di transizione due anni fa, quando ho voluto andare a fondo ad un disagio che durava da tutta la vita.

La musica è sempre stata la parte più bella di me. Sono un cantautore.

Amo la musica, adoro comporre, creare le parole. Fare musica per me è esprimere ciò che ho dentro, fissare le mie emozioni e interpretare me stesso.

Compongo musica da 10 anni, ma mi piace anche interpretare canzoni di altri artisti.

Studio musica da quando ho 6 anni e...non ho ancora smesso! Canto, suono la chitarra e il pianoforte. Mi piace tutto ciò che è musica e che fa muovere a tempo corpo e anima.

All'interno dello Storycode ci sono due cd, uno registrato 3 anni fa, con la voce da donna (pre-t) e uno, che sto ancora registrando, con la voce da uomo di adesso.

Per la realizzazione dei cd mi avvalgo di collaborazioni con musicisti e cantanti bravi e affermati del nord Italia, che danno il loro contributo agli arrangiamenti e di sale registrazioni professionali, per avere la miglior qualità audio possibile.

Il primo cd "DO"è composto da 10 canzoni, di cui 8 cover e 2 inediti scritti da me:


  1. don't you remember (adele cover)

  2. sunrise (norah jones cover)

  3. thinking about you (norah jones cover)

  4. listen to your heart (roxette cover)

  5. smooth operator (sade cover)

  6. a night like this (caro emerald cover)

  7. kiss kiss (holly valance cover)

  8. la notte (arisa cover)

  9. do

  10. la mia musica


Il secondo cd "TRY TO DO IT" è composto da 9 canzoni inedite:

  1. by my side

  2. senza nomi

  3. vento

  4. semplice

  5. cosa non darei

  6. everything of your life

  7. rosso

  8. girotondo

  9. sempre

cliccando il video sottostante puoi ascoltare un mix di canzoni dei due cd, per comprendere la differenza di voce.


Se richiesto, posso inviare la traduzione dei testi delle canzoni dall'italiano all'inglese.

All'interno della storia nel libro ci sono spesso riferimenti alle mie canzoni. Ho pensato di associare ad ogni riferimento un QR Code attraverso il quale, posizionando lo smartphone e cliccando con l'applicazione corrispondente, si potrà vedere una slideshow di foto in differenti momenti della mia vita. In questo modo il lettore potrà soddisfare la sua curiosità vedendo i miei cambiamenti e farà così parte anch'esso della storia.

Lo Storycode non è un semplice libro, non voglio che la mia storia sia solo letta, ma anche vista ed ascoltata, coinvolgendo così tutti i sensi del lettore, in un' esperienza innovativa.

Credo che lo "storycode" sia un incoraggiamento per tutti.

Ho deciso di scrivere la mia storia perchè prima di iniziare il cambio di genere da donna a uomo, ero spaventato e mi sarebbe piaciuto leggere le esperienze di chi ci era già passato e credo che leggere la mia esperienza possa essere d'aiuto ad altri ragazzi nella mia stessa situazione. Voglio far sapere loro che con la perseveranza e il coraggio, si ottiene ciò che si vuole e si può essere felici.

Lo "storycode" è la testimonianza di una persona che ha fatto i conti con le sue paure: di piacersi, di essere accettato, di continuare a cantare nonostante il cambio di voce... e che ce l'ha fatta.

Spero che possa aiutare le persone che non sentono che il loro corpo gli appartenga e non sanno da che parte cominciare, spesso cercando soluzioni pericolose, arrivando anche al suicidio.

Con la mia testimonianza voglio dimostrare che tutti possono farcela e che i disagi possono essere superati.

Il cambio di voce in terapia ormonale non è facile da gestire, soprattutto se cantare è la tua professione, come nel mio caso. Questa esperienza spiega come ho fatto a superare questa difficoltà, che tecniche ho utilizzato e a chi mi sono rivolto. Questo è sicuramente d'aiuto per chi, come me anni fa, abbia accantonato l'idea del cambio di genere per paura di non potere più cantare.

Mi rivolgo alle persone LGBTQ, che probabilmente ogni giorno affrontano ciò che ho passato io.

Mi rivolgo ai musicisti, ai cantanti, a chi ama la musica, a chi fa della propria arte la ragione di vita.

Mi rivolgo alle persone che faticano ad accettare chi è diverso da loro. Vorrei che leggendo la storia capissero che alla fine siamo tutti uguali, anche se tutti un pò diversi.

Il goal è di 8000 euro. I costi che devo sostenere sono i seguenti:

  • scrittore

  • traduttore libro da italiano a inglese

  • stampa del libro

  • musicisti per arrangiare le canzoni

  • sala registrazione per la massima qualità audio

  • stampa dei cd

  • qr code generator

  • grafica (video, sito, storycode)

  • distribuzione

Per ogni donazione che fai, hai qualcosa in cambio.

Puoi trovare la lista completa a destra della pagina.

Al raggiungimento del goal avrò la possibilità di fare e pubblicare il videoclip della canzone "BY MY SIDE"

Puoi pubblicizzare la mia campagna sui social network, facebook, twitter, oppure mandare email ai tuoi amici ai quali potrebbe interessare il progetto.

Il ringraziamento più importante e caloroso che mi sento di fare è sicuramente alla mia famiglia per il sostegno e l'amore incondizionato che mi hanno sempre donato.

Ringrazio i miei amici che hanno accettato, anche con sforzi notevoli, di chiamarmi Enrico fin dall'inizio del percorso di cambiamento che ho intrapreso.

Ringrazio tutte le persone che mi hanno ispirato, anche inconsapevolmente, e che continuano a farlo.

Ringrazio tutti coloro che stanno collaborando con impegno, dedizione e passione alla realizzazione di questo progetto.

Grazie di cuore a tutti voi che, dandomi fiducia, contribuite.

La musica è sempre stata la parte più bella di me. Sono un
cantautore.
Amo la musica, adoro comporre, creare le parole. Fare musica per
me è esprimere ciò che ho dentro, fissare le mie emozioni e
interpretare me stesso.
Compongo musica da 10 anni, ma mi piace anche interpretare canzoni
di altri artisti.
Studio musica da quando ho 6 anni e...non ho ancora smesso! Canto,
suono la chitarra e il pianoforte. Mi piace tutto ciò che è musica
e che  fa muovere a tempo corpo e anima.
All'interno dello Storycode ci sono due cd, uno registrato 3 anni
fa, con la voce da donna (pre-t) e uno, che sto ancora registrando,
con la voce da uomo di adesso.
Per la realizzazione dei cd mi avvalgo di collaborazioni con
musicisti e cantanti bravi e affermati del nord Italia, che danno il
loro contributo agli arrangiamenti e di sale registrazioni
professionali, per avere la miglior qualità audio possibile.  


Il primo cd "DO"è composto da 10 canzoni, di cui 8
cover e 2 inediti scritti da me:

don't you remember (adele cover)


sunrise (norah jones cover)


thinking about you (norah jones cover)


listen to your heart (roxette cover)


smooth operator (sade cover)


a night like this (caro emerald cover)


kiss kiss (holly valance cover)


la notte (arisa cover)


do


la mia musica


Il secondo cd "TRY TO DO IT" è composto da 9 canzoni
inedite:

by my side


senza nomi

vento
semplice

cosa non darei


everything of your life


rosso


girotondo


sempre



cliccando il video sottostante puoi ascoltare un mix di canzoni
dei due cd, per comprendere la differenza di voce.

Se richiesto, posso inviare la traduzione dei testi delle canzoni
dall'italiano all'inglese.All'interno della storia nel libro ci sono spesso riferimenti alle
mie canzoni. Ho pensato di associare ad ogni riferimento un QR Code
attraverso il quale, posizionando lo smartphone e cliccando con
l'applicazione corrispondente, si potrà vedere una slideshow di foto
in differenti momenti della mia vita. In questo modo il lettore potrà
soddisfare la sua curiosità vedendo i miei cambiamenti e farà così
parte anch'esso della storia.

Lo
Storycode non è un semplice libro, non voglio che la mia storia sia
solo letta, ma anche vista ed ascoltata, coinvolgendo così tutti i
sensi del lettore, in un' esperienza innovativa.


Credo che lo "storycode" sia un incoraggiamento per
tutti.
Ho deciso di scrivere la mia storia perchè prima di iniziare il
cambio di genere da donna a uomo, ero spaventato e mi sarebbe
piaciuto leggere le esperienze di chi ci era già passato e credo che
leggere la mia esperienza possa essere d'aiuto ad altri ragazzi nella
mia stessa situazione. Voglio far sapere loro che con la perseveranza
e il coraggio, si ottiene ciò che si vuole e si può essere felici.
Lo "storycode" è la testimonianza di una persona che ha
fatto i conti con le sue paure: di piacersi, di essere accettato, di
continuare a cantare nonostante il cambio di voce... e che ce l'ha
fatta.
Spero che possa aiutare le persone che non sentono che il loro
corpo gli appartenga e non sanno da che parte cominciare, spesso
cercando soluzioni pericolose, arrivando anche al suicidio.
Con la mia testimonianza voglio dimostrare che tutti possono
farcela e che i disagi possono essere superati. 

Il cambio di voce in terapia
ormonale non è facile da gestire, soprattutto se cantare è la tua
professione, come nel mio caso. Questa esperienza spiega come ho
fatto a superare questa difficoltà, che tecniche ho utilizzato e a
chi mi sono rivolto. Questo è sicuramente d'aiuto per chi, come me
anni fa, abbia accantonato l'idea del cambio di genere per paura di
non potere più cantare. 



Mi rivolgo alle persone
LGBTQ, che probabilmente ogni giorno affrontano ciò che ho passato
io.
Mi rivolgo ai musicisti, ai
cantanti, a chi ama la musica, a chi fa della propria arte la ragione
di vita.
Mi rivolgo alle persone che
faticano ad accettare chi è diverso da loro. Vorrei che leggendo la
storia capissero che alla fine siamo tutti uguali, anche se tutti un
pò diversi.Il goal è di 8000 euro. I
costi che devo sostenere sono i seguenti:


scrittore


traduttore libro da
	italiano a inglese


stampa del libro


musicisti per
	arrangiare le canzoni


sala registrazione per
	la massima qualità audio


stampa dei cd


qr code generator


grafica (video, sito,
	storycode)


distribuzione



Per ogni donazione che fai,
hai qualcosa in cambio.
Puoi trovare la lista completa a destra della pagina.Al raggiungimento del goal
avrò la possibilità di fare e pubblicare il videoclip della canzone
"BY MY SIDE" 



Puoi pubblicizzare la mia
campagna sui social network, facebook, twitter, oppure mandare email
ai tuoi amici ai quali potrebbe interessare il progetto.

Il ringraziamento più
importante e caloroso che mi sento di fare è sicuramente alla mia
famiglia per il sostegno e l'amore incondizionato che mi hanno sempre
donato.
Ringrazio i miei amici che
hanno accettato, anche con sforzi notevoli, di chiamarmi Enrico fin
dall'inizio del percorso di cambiamento che ho intrapreso.
Ringrazio tutte le persone
che mi hanno ispirato, anche inconsapevolmente, e che continuano a
farlo.
Ringrazio tutti coloro che
stanno collaborando con impegno, dedizione e passione alla
realizzazione di questo progetto.
Grazie di cuore a tutti voi
che, dandomi fiducia, contribuite.

story:
We're funded! Visit us at www.mayafilippo.com to see what we're up to :)

***

What People Say

"I think Alinka Rutkowska hit the ball out of the park with this series, and this book in particular." Katelyn Hensel of Readers’ Favorite

"Alinka Rutkowska has created a wonderful combination of information and a positive message in her adorable children’s picture book." Melinda Hills of Readers’ Favorite 

"Alinka Rutkowska has done a fantastic job reaching children in an emotional, but understandable way when explaining social actions and feelings when in public places, new places, or when meeting new people."  Michelle Robertson of Readers’ Favorite

What is This About?

In a Nutshell

This book is for you if you want to share with your children your love for traveling and exploring the world with all its diversity. It helps form the young readers’ character, develop a positive attitude and the ability to solve problems with mutual respect. This book is not only about adventure and travel. It’s also the ultimate guide to a joyful life.

Idea

No matter who we are, we are all unique. With this new picture book we want to increase the little ones' cultural awareness, show them how to cherish unique backgrounds as well as maintain a positive attitude and conviction that the world is theirs if they only believe. The Maya and Filippo children's book is the perfect starting point for young readers to develop an excitement for the world with all its diversity and a desire to experiment before drawing conclusions.

You

We are celebrating uniqueness. Be part of this project and change the world with this new children's book. By participating in this project you will give life to the first of a series of Maya & Filippo's adventures. The two fictional characters have the capacity of transforming the way children see the world. You also get some sweet rewards (only our smart and good-looking Indiegogo supporters will get these perks!). Together we can make this happen.

The Book

"Maya & Filippo Make Friends in Auckland" (illustrated by Konrad Checinski) is about two curious children who travel around the world on a cruise ship full of surprises. They visit different ports of call and learn about different customs and traditions. They observe, experiment, feel, think and believe. This book is for anyone who wants to see the world through the eyes of a child: uninhibited, curious, hopeful, full of life, excitement and ideas. 


Five Star Review From "Readers' Favorite"

Two children have the opportunity to see how someone’s behavior affects others in this cute children’s story, Maya and Filippo Make Friends in Auckland, by Alinka Rutkowska. This young brother and sister discover the relationship between happy thoughts and good experiences after comparing their unhappy thoughts with the unpleasant behavior of two old women who are on the same bus. When they decide to concentrate on the things that make them feel good, their day turns around and they enjoy their trip to Auckland. This also provides an opportunity for them to learn a little about the city as they make friends and see some interesting things. The day gets even better when they return to the cruise ship that is their home, to find their favorite dessert and a positive affirmation from their mother waiting for them.


Alinka Rutkowska has created a wonderful combination of information and a positive message in her adorable children’s picture pop-up book. This story demonstrates that there are different ways of looking at things and that attitudes can affect the quality of an experience or a day. As a child hears this story, the lesson learned by the characters of Maya and Filippo is shared in a way that allows a young reader to relate easily to it. A positive connection is made using a situation almost any child would encounter; so instead of being told how to behave, the child can repeat the action in his or her own experience. This is a great teaching tool for children to understand the power of positive thinking and the impact of negativity.

So, here's what the cover is going to look like now!

Author

Alinka Rutkowska is an international business school graduate who after several years of working in big corporations left it all behind to take a gap year - and never came back. Her travels, fondness for books, love for children and belief in the power of a positive outlook gave life to the adventures of Filippo and Maya. Her desire is to finalize the project she originated.

Rewards and Funds Breakdown

What's in it for you:

Apart from making the world a better place (Karma will notice), depending on your level of membership you get (if you want to):

  • An online preview of the book before anybody else in the world sees it.
  • Your name as contributor on the book's website.
  • A link to your website from the book's website.
  • A pdf version of the book, which you can store on your computer and reading device for all eternity.
  • The paperback delivered to you anywhere in the world.
  • A digital collection of black and white drawings from the book, which you can print out and your kids (or grandkids) can color.
  • A signed paperback with a PERSONALIZED dedication delivered to you anywhere in the world.
  • Book themed thank you shopping bag, in which you can carry your signed paperback.

  • You get listed as sponsor inside the book. 
  • You get lunch with the author (no fast-food).
  • You could even get listed as sponsor of the whole book series.

Below is the expenses breakdown in percentage:

The making:

  • Artwork and professional design: 65%
  • Professional copy-editing: 1%
Marketing

  • Press release: 5%
  • Review copies: 5%
  • Online book clubs presence: 11%
  • Established editorial house review: 7%

Indiegogo fee: 4%

Donation to New Zealand's youngest readers: 2%

If we get more - we will delight our readers with an exciting website (one of those that have animations and sparkle), we will participate in book fairs (get a booth) and attend writers' and illustrators' conferences.

If we get less - we will be disappointed (no use in denying that) and we will have to look for other ways of funding.

It's more than a book. It's a whole series! What we manage to save on producing and marketing the first one, we will spend on giving life to the following adventures:

You Make The Difference

By participating: 

  • You become the force fueling children's cultural and geographic literacy. 
  • You help the little ones fall in love with reading. 
  • You open their hearts to other nationalities. 
  • You allow them to discover their true selves and to listen to the child inside them.
  • You promote the spirit of adventure.
  • You make the world a better place.

Tell Your Friends

There's nothing better than word of mouth, so:

  • Tell your friends, parents, sisters, brothers, cousins, uncles, aunts, co-workers, neighbors and gym club members.
  • Tell the guy sitting next to you on that subway ride, tell the lady from your knitting club. Tell the guy in the supermarket standing behind you in line to the cash register. 
  • Share it with your Facebook friends.
  • Tweet, tweet, tweet!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you for believing in us.

story:
The Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat - October 22nd-25th, 2015



My name is R.J. Cavender and I love working with horror writers.

That's why I'm hosting this second writers retreat at the historic and haunted birthplace of Stephen King's The Shining, The Stanley Hotel in Estes Park, Colorado.

If you want to join us, simply register by choosing a package here on this campaign and I'll send you the code to receive the group discount rate when you make your hotel reservations.

*Editing Packages and Event Registration does not include your hotel room or transportation fees. Hotel room rates are listed at the bottom of the page.*

If you register now, you have an entire year to make your travel plans. And your registration does include all our group discount perks, select editing packages, inclusion on any outings/trips over the weekend, and a guaranteed tour of Room 217.

Join us on our Facebook group page and help us plan the trip together for 2015: https://www.facebook.com/stanleyretreat




I'll be setting up daily critique groups and nightly meet-up times, giving those interested a chance to hang out with fellow authors. But these aren't mandatory, and if you'd just like time alone to write, you can do that too! We don't want to set a rigid schedule or any programming that would take away from your writing time, since this is a retreat and not a convention or conference. So no dealers room, and limited programming. Instead we're offering a unique experience with a great group of authors and publishing professionals, in a fantastic hotel with a history steeped in horror (fiction?)

Each package includes different perks that should fit the need of all authors, whether you're looking for some feedback and a polishing of your work...or you're just needing a great place to write and get away. Let us host your once-in-a-lifetime writing escape, and we'll promise you a great time in a scenic and spooky locale.

For the last few years I've served as the pitch session coordinator for two horror writers conventions, one of which I was also a co-chair. So I've had some solid experience seeing how hosting events operates from the inside. And with the first Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat being a successful event, we've decided to return in 2015 for a weekend we'll all remember for years to come. I hope you find this idea as exciting as I do, and I truly hope you'll join us for this unique and haunting writing experience! The Stanley Hotel is truly amazing...





Group discount tickets will be available through the hotel for the Friday night Murder Mystery Dinner at The Stanley Hotel and the annual Shining Masquerade Ball on Saturday night, as well! Group rates are also available for ghost tours of the hotel and paranormal investigations.

Event registrations/packages are transferable, but non-refundable. If you're not entirely sure if you can make it, please don't register. Funds for this event will be spent as they come in, securing rooms, vehicles, and other event expenses. Cancellations will create problems, so commit to this now...don't flake out...and we'll see you then!

Fees for cancellation with the hotel and every last detail to reserve rooms are listed below. Confirmation of perk/package redemption will be within 24-hours, with instructions on how to redeem your room discounts at The Stanley Hotel once you've registered.

We hope to see you in October!




+Guest of Honor Authors+ appearing @ Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat 2015:

JACK KETCHUM

http://www.jackketchum.net/


JOSH MALERMAN

http://www.harpercollins.com/cr-107479/josh-malerman


RICHARD CHIZMAR

https://www.facebook.com/richardchizmar


TRENT ZELAZNY

https://www.facebook.com/trentzelazny


KEALAN PATRICK BURKE

(Due to impending deadlines, Kealan Patrick Burke has had to cancel.)


DANIEL KNAUF


http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0460567/


And don't forget about our pre-event party in Denver!
Wednesday we'll be staying at the La Quinta Inn - Denver Central.

laquintadenvercentral.com

We'll be making a field trip over to Caregivers for Life Medicinal and Recreation Marijuana Dispensary for those who'd like to buy some goodies for their trip! It's LEGAL in Colorado, but feel free to ask me about any details...I'll be sure to answer any questions you may have about recreational marijuana and CO laws. 21+ Only for this event. (Consume responsibly and at your own risk.)

http://caregiversforlife.net

Later on Wednesday we'll be heading to 13th Flood Haunted House Denver, one of the best haunted attractions anywhere!

www.13thfloorhauntedhouse.com


About Your Hosts/Editors


R.J. Cavender is an Associate Member of the Horror Writers Association and the thrice Bram Stoker Award®-nominated editor of the +Horror Library+ anthology series from Cutting Block Press. Horror Library IV (co-edited with Boyd E. Harris) won the 2010 reader's choice Black Quill Award from Dark Scribe Magazine  in the Best Dark Genre Anthology category.

R.J. is also a publishing consultant and co-editor of the Bram Stoker Award-nominated Horror For Good: A Charitable Anthology, which includes stories from award-winning authors Jack Ketchum, Ray Garton, Ramsey Campbell, and Benjamin Kane Ethridge. His latest project for Dark Regions Press is The Midnight Meat Train: Special Definitive Edition by Clive Barker.

R.J. Is the managing editor of horror at Dark Regions Press, editor-in-chief at the new Cutting Block Books, an acquisitions editor at Blood Bound Books, and pitch sessions coordinator for World Horror Convention.

R.J. lives in Tucson, Arizona. His Favorite novel is The Shining.


Chris Morey has edited the works of Joe R. Lansdale, Tom Piccirilli, Jeff Strand, Weston Ochse and Gord Rollo. Formerly the webmaster and Internet marketer for Dark Regions Press, he is now the owner and publisher of the press. He is the creator and editor of the Black Labyrinth imprint illustrated by Santiago Caruso, and is currently working on a hardcover project with Clive Barker. Chris has interviewed many renowned authors such as Ramsey Campbell, Rick Hautala, Mort Castle, W.H. Pugmire, Jeffrey Thomas, Simon Strantzas, Jeff Strand and many others. He has been interviewed by Dark Discoveries Magazine, Cemetery Dance Magazine, and Horror World.




Boyd E. Harris is the founder, co-editor, and former owner of Cutting Block Press, a small press company that specializes in anthologies of short and long horror fiction.  As publisher, his books Horror Library Volume 3, Volume 4, Volume 5, and Tattered Souls 2 were nominated for Bram Stoker Awards® for Superior Achievement in an Anthology. His last published anthology, Horror for Good: A Charitable Anthology was also nominated for a 2013 Bram Stoker Award.

Boyd has the exclusive distinction of being a Black Quill Award winning editor in two mediums, one for Dark Recesses Press magazine, and one for Horror Library Volume 4.

Boyd's work as editor has helped authors get stories optioned for films, as well as getting authors opportunities with larger publishers.

Boyd applies a theory that there should be balance between the storyline and the structure, and emphasizes the value of challenging a reader's imagination, while not allowing the read to become arduous. 




*Hotel Reservation Information* 


Attendees will be responsible for phoning in their reservations at The Stanley Hotel reservation line at (970) 577-4040 Monday – Friday 9am-4pm.

To receive special group rates, attendees must give the group discount code they received upon registering through this campaign.

Individuals will be responsible for paying their own room, tax and incidental charges. Guests will call The Stanley Hotel to make a reservation from the group room block and will be required to pay a deposit equal to 1 night  room rental.

Group rate of $179.00 per room, per night will be applied to guest’s entire 4-night stay-- October 22rd-25th, 2015. Single or double occupancy. 

Individual Cancellation Policy: Individual cancellations received within 30 days of arrival will be charged at the full rate for the entire stay, whether or not the group block commitment has been met or exceeded.

Cutoff Date

The block of rooms will be held until September 22, 2015.  Those rooms not reserved prior to this date will be released for general sale.  Reservations requests after this date will be taken on a space available basis at the higher of the contract rate or rate available at that time.  Should such requests be accepted, such room nights will be credited to your block for purposes of any calculation of attrition.

Room Assignments

The reservation department will attempt to accommodate specific requested room types, but cannot guarantee specific room types, locations, or room numbers.  Requested room types that are not included in the group block will be charged the prevailing  guestroom rate at the time the reservation is made.

Pre/Post Group Rates

The group rates will be honored on space available basis for group attendees up to 3 days before or after the group’s scheduled stay.

Check-in/Check-out/Change Rooms

Check in time begins at 4:00 pm.  Room availability cannot be confirmed until that time.  Check out time is 11:00 am. 

No Shows & Early/Late Departures

Rooms which have been reserved by and whose occupants fail to show on scheduled day of arrival will be billed for the total lodging amount for the contracted time.  Early departures and/or late arrivals will be charged the contracted nightly rate for the entire reserved stay.

Splitting Room Charges

If group attendees are to pay for their own rooms, tax and incidentals AND are sharing rooms, the following must be considered: The Stanley Hotel is unable to divide certain charges (telephone calls, restaurant charges, incidentals, etc.).  It is the responsibility of the individual whose name appears on the reservation folio to finalize all charges between the occupants BEFORE check out.

It is the responsibility of the group leader or meeting planner to inform all attendees of the above.

Package Delivery and Storage

All incoming boxes will incur a $5.00 per box handling fee.  All outgoing boxes will incur a $5.00 per box handling fee in addition to the shipping charges (if the hotel incurs these shipping charges) and must be made via FedEx or UPS with appropriate tracking information.  These charges will be billed to the Master Account.

Materials for your function may be sent to The Stanley Hotel no earlier than 72 hours prior to the beginning of your event. All packages must be properly addressed to the both client and the conference services manager; they must also outline the name of the group/event and the dates of the function.

Shipment contents and delivery schedules are not the responsibility of The Stanley Hotel.  Return shipments must be completed within 48 business hours after the close of the event; clients are responsible for packaging and completing all shipping documents prior to departure from the hotel.

groups and nightly meet-up times, giving those interested a chance
to hang out with fellow authors. But these aren't mandatory, and if you'd just
like time alone to write, you can do that too! We don't want to set a rigid
schedule or any programming that would take away from your writing time, since
this is a retreat and not a convention or conference. So no dealers room, and
limited programming. Instead we're offering a unique experience with a great
group of authors and publishing professionals, in a fantastic hotel with a
history steeped in horror (fiction?) 

Each package includes different perks that should fit the need of all authors,
whether you're looking for some feedback and a polishing of your work...or
you're just needing a great place to write and get away. Let us host your
once-in-a-lifetime writing escape, and we'll promise you a great time in a
scenic and spooky locale. 

For the last few years I've served as the pitch session coordinator for two
horror writers conventions, one of which I was also a co-chair. So I've had
some solid experience seeing how hosting events operates from the inside. And
with the first Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat being a successful event, we've decided to return in 2015 for a weekend we'll all
remember for years to come. I hope you find this idea as exciting as I do, and
I truly hope you'll join us for this unique and haunting writing experience! The Stanley Hotel is truly amazing...
Group discount tickets will be available through the hotel
for the Friday night Murder Mystery Dinner at The Stanley Hotel and the annual
Shining Masquerade Ball on Saturday night, as well! Group rates are also
available for ghost tours of the hotel and paranormal investigations.
Event registrations/packages are transferable, but non-refundable.
If you're not entirely sure if you can make it, please don't register.
Funds for this event will be spent as they come in, securing rooms, vehicles,
and other event expenses. Cancellations will create problems, so commit to this
now...don't flake out...and we'll see you then!

Fees for cancellation with the hotel and every last detail to reserve rooms are
listed below. Confirmation of perk/package redemption will be within 24-hours,
with instructions on how to redeem your room discounts at The Stanley Hotel
once you've registered. 

We hope to see you in October!
+Guest of Honor Authors+ appearing @ Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat 2015:JACK KETCHUM 
http://www.jackketchum.net/JOSH MALERMAN 
http://www.harpercollins.com/cr-107479/josh-malermanRICHARD CHIZMAR https://www.facebook.com/richardchizmarTRENT ZELAZNYhttps://www.facebook.com/trentzelaznyKEALAN PATRICK BURKE(Due to impending deadlines, Kealan Patrick Burke has had to cancel.)
DANIEL KNAUFhttp://www.imdb.com/name/nm0460567/


And don't forget about our pre-event party in Denver! Wednesday we'll be staying at the La Quinta Inn - Denver Central.
laquintadenvercentral.com
We'll be making a field trip over to Caregivers for Life Medicinal and Recreation Marijuana Dispensary for those who'd like to buy some goodies for their trip! It's LEGAL in Colorado, but feel free to ask me about any details...I'll be sure to answer any questions you may have about recreational marijuana and CO laws. 21+ Only for this event. (Consume responsibly and at your own risk.)
http://caregiversforlife.net
Later on Wednesday we'll be heading to 13th Flood Haunted House Denver, one of the best haunted attractions anywhere! 
www.13thfloorhauntedhouse.com

About Your Hosts/Editors R.J. Cavender is an Associate Member of the Horror Writers Association and the thrice Bram Stoker Award®-nominated editor of the +Horror Library+ anthology series from Cutting Block Press. Horror Library IV (co-edited with Boyd E. Harris) won the 2010 reader's choice Black Quill Award from Dark Scribe Magazine  in the Best Dark Genre Anthology category. R.J. is also a publishing consultant and co-editor of the Bram Stoker Award-nominated Horror For Good: A Charitable Anthology, which includes stories from award-winning authors Jack Ketchum, Ray Garton, Ramsey Campbell, and Benjamin Kane Ethridge. His latest project for Dark Regions Press is The Midnight Meat Train: Special Definitive Edition by Clive Barker. R.J. Is the managing editor of horror at Dark Regions Press, editor-in-chief at the new Cutting Block Books, an acquisitions editor at Blood Bound Books, and pitch sessions coordinator for World Horror Convention. R.J. lives in Tucson, Arizona. His Favorite novel is The Shining. Chris Morey has edited the works of Joe R. Lansdale, Tom Piccirilli, Jeff Strand, Weston Ochse and Gord Rollo. Formerly the webmaster and Internet marketer for Dark Regions Press, he is now the owner and publisher of the press. He is the creator and editor of the Black Labyrinth imprint illustrated by Santiago Caruso, and is currently working on a hardcover project with Clive Barker. Chris has interviewed many renowned authors such as Ramsey Campbell, Rick Hautala, Mort Castle, W.H. Pugmire, Jeffrey Thomas, Simon Strantzas, Jeff Strand and many others. He has been interviewed by Dark Discoveries Magazine, Cemetery Dance Magazine, and Horror World.Boyd E. Harris is the founder, co-editor, and former owner of Cutting Block Press, a small press company that specializes in anthologies of short and long horror fiction.  As publisher, his books Horror Library Volume 3, Volume 4, Volume 5, and Tattered Souls 2 were nominated for Bram Stoker Awards®  for Superior Achievement in an Anthology. His last published anthology, Horror for Good: A Charitable Anthology was also nominated for a 2013 Bram Stoker Award. Boyd has the exclusive distinction of being a Black Quill Award winning editor in two mediums, one for Dark Recesses Press magazine, and one for Horror Library Volume 4.Boyd's work as editor has helped authors get stories optioned for films, as well as getting authors opportunities with larger publishers. Boyd applies a theory that there should be balance between the storyline and the structure, and emphasizes the value of challenging a reader's imagination, while not allowing the read to become arduous.  *Hotel Reservation Information*  Attendees will be responsible for phoning in their reservations at The Stanley Hotel reservation line at (970) 577-4040 Monday – Friday 9am-4pm.To receive special group rates, attendees must give the group discount code they received upon registering through this campaign.Individuals will be responsible for paying their own room, tax and incidental charges. Guests will call The Stanley Hotel to make a reservation from the group room block and will be required to pay a deposit equal to 1 night  room rental.Group rate of $179.00 per room, per night will be applied to guest’s entire 4-night stay-- October 22rd-25th, 2015. Single or double occupancy.  Individual Cancellation Policy: Individual cancellations received within 30 days of arrival will be charged at the full rate for the entire stay, whether or not the group block commitment has been met or exceeded.Cutoff Date The block of rooms will be held until September 22, 2015.  Those rooms not reserved prior to this date will be released for general sale.  Reservations requests after this date will be taken on a space available basis at the higher of the contract rate or rate available at that time.  Should such requests be accepted, such room nights will be credited to your block for purposes of any calculation of attrition. Room AssignmentsThe reservation department will attempt to accommodate specific requested room types, but cannot guarantee specific room types, locations, or room numbers.  Requested room types that are not included in the group block will be charged the prevailing  guestroom rate at the time the reservation is made. Pre/Post Group Rates The group rates will be honored on space available basis for group attendees up to 3 days before or after the group’s scheduled stay.Check-in/Check-out/Change Rooms Check in time begins at 4:00 pm.  Room availability cannot be confirmed until that time.  Check out time is 11:00 am.  No Shows & Early/Late DeparturesRooms which have been reserved by and whose occupants fail to show on scheduled day of arrival will be billed for the total lodging amount for the contracted time.  Early departures and/or late arrivals will be charged the contracted nightly rate for the entire reserved stay. Splitting Room Charges If group attendees are to pay for their own rooms, tax and incidentals AND are sharing rooms, the following must be considered: The Stanley Hotel is unable to divide certain charges (telephone calls, restaurant charges, incidentals, etc.).  It is the responsibility of the individual whose name appears on the reservation folio to finalize all charges between the occupants BEFORE check out. It is the responsibility of the group leader or meeting planner to inform all attendees of the above. Package Delivery and Storage All incoming boxes will incur a $5.00 per box handling fee.  All outgoing boxes will incur a $5.00 per box handling fee in addition to the shipping charges (if the hotel incurs these shipping charges) and must be made via FedEx or UPS with appropriate tracking information.  These charges will be billed to the Master Account.Materials for your function may be sent to The Stanley Hotel no earlier than 72 hours prior to the beginning of your event. All packages must be properly addressed to the both client and the conference services manager; they must also outline the name of the group/event and the dates of the function. Shipment contents and delivery schedules are not the responsibility of The Stanley Hotel.  Return shipments must be completed within 48 business hours after the close of the event; clients are responsible for packaging and completing all shipping documents prior to departure from the hotel.

story:
I'm Hoping To Employ An Editor For My New Book

I'm Kylie Sturgess, podcaster for the Token Skeptic, blogger on Patheos and writer for the Skeptical Inquirer website's "Curiouser And Curiouser", occasional radio presenter, social media maven, TEDxPerth presenter ... and mostly harmless.

I'm the author of one self-published book on skepticism, secularism and atheism, published in 2013, called The Scope Of Skepticism: Interviews, Essays and Observations From the Token Skeptic Podcast .

In 2014, I worked on creating the second book, which is still untitled. However, the chapters are written, the book is planned out... and I'd like to make it better than the first book.

That's where you come in. 

I'm passionate about getting skepticism, science and rationalism beyond the "choir" (although choirs in themselves are awesome to be in and without them, how do you think choral singing started? Penguins miming to a backing track?) - and for most of my career, I've contributed my time, money and energy to just that. I fund pretty much all of my travel, get some great help with my podcast, but a book is a different kind of project.

I've written one book of interviews, essays and reflections, and I'd like to do the same thing again. Not just "things already found online", but some unpublished work and unprinted interviews or extended ones.

But I'd like a better product this time round, and an editor seems the best way to make that happen.

The book is going to happen, as it's already written. 

What I'm after is some help to improve it - and an editor can do that.

What I Need & What You Get

Here's the deal:

I've contacted a great editor, who has done fantastic work for atheist and secular authors in the past - they're happy to take on the project (which was my first big step!). I'll be putting the final touches on my book so they can have it by the end of September.

  • What can you get? Credit in the book! Copies of the "audio version" of the book! Copies of the book, either electronic or paperback, and I'll get merchandise if I hit some stretch goals.
What happens if I don't hit my goal? Doesn't matter. 
All that money goes to the editor, and they'll do the best they can with the time they have and the funding I can get them. I'm a student and I'll do what I can with what I can afford.
This book is going to be made, I'd just like to make it better.

Why A Book?

The last book, The Scope Of Skepticism: Interviews, Essays and Observations From the Token Skeptic Podcast, got some great reviews and a lot of likes from people who might not ordinarily think that there's such a range of thinkers and issues out there. 

It'd be great to reach more people, with a edited product that reflects the high regard I have for the people who do so much for worthy causes.

I've interviewed artists, musicians, comedians, activists, educators and more - if you'd like to get an idea of the content, you can just check out the Curiouser and Curiouser column, where some (not all!) of my interviews are housed.

Risks & Challenges

Maybe I won't make enough money to hit the goal? Well, I've put in too much time over the past two years with my work to let that stop me.

But every cent goes to the editor, who was the one who cited a reasonable cost for their valuable time, which is the goal set here.

Any extra? I'll contact a great designer and see if they can help polish the final product. Even if I end up doing much of this myself, I'll be hugely grateful for you for helping employ people to get this book out.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign! Social media loves the noise of good causes and you can do that with ease.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! 

Any further questions, just hit me up at tokenskeptic at gmail.

story:
"HAROLD, the Most Beautiful Christmas Tree in the Whole Wide World!" is a children's book, authored by Alison Fast and illustrated by Wendy Paterson, with the goal of publication by Christmas 2015.

Owing to the success their first book, "Marigold and the Faraway Tree," released in November 2014 by Penguin Random House, Alison and Wendy are teaming up again to produce their next title!

The story of Harold is inspired by a true-life Christmas Tree lot in Larchmont Village in Los Angeles.

Thousands of trees are sold each holiday season.

All eyeballs are on families scanning the lot for the tallest, fullest, prettiest trees, with big red bows. That's where Harold comes in...

(EXCERPT)

"Harold was a tree that had little hope of going home with anyone.

His branches were a little STICKY

His trunk was a little CROOKED

His needles were a little DRY

He was at the very back of the lot where almost no one ever came to visit.

Harold sighed and his branches sagged a bit.

No, he did not have very good looks.

Nor a pretty bow.

But he made a silent wish just then, 'And if I find a family tonight, GOLLY GOSH, I'll give them all the LOVE I have to give.'"

HAROLD is a story that will inspire people to remember what is truly important for the holidays.

If you believe in homegrown stories, full of imagination and kindness, support a tree to tell its story.

His name is Harold. And he will help you to have a tickle of a time for the holiday.

"LIKE" and "SHARE"

Facebook.com/HaroldTheChristmasTree

AUTHOR

Alison Fast is a documentary filmmaker who loves storytelling across all mediums. Her inspiration comes from traveling, spending time in nature and leading community-based storytelling workshops. She lives in Los Angeles. "Marigold and the Faraway Tree" was her first children’s book, published in November 2014 by Random House.

ILLUSTRATOR

Wendy Paterson is a former teacher and archeologist, who lives with her two children in Cape Town, South Africa. She works as a freelance illustrator from home and draws inspiration from the beauty of her surroundings and the funny things children do and say. "Marigold and the Faraway Tree" was her second children’s book.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, thank you for visiting our ART DECADES funding page!  My name is Jeremy Richey and I am the author of various film blogs including Moon in the Gutter and Fascination:  The Jean Rollin Experience.  My work has also appeared in the pages of such publications as SCREEM, RUE MORGUE and THE DIRECTORY OF WORLD CINEMA. 
ART DECADES is an upcoming quarterly print publication that will feature a variety of critical, historical and personal articles on everything from film to music to fashion, and beyond, from a large number of writers from all over the world.  ART DECADES will also feature exclusive interviews with various up and coming and established artists, filmmakers, performers, musicians and photographers.  Issue #1 of ART DECADES will be released in November of 2014 and will be available to order from Amazon, Barnes and Noble and our official website. 

What We Need & What You Get

Since we are going to be using Amazon's Createspace print on demand service the majority of our cost will be upfront.  The funding we are asking for is for the publishing software (Adobe InDesign and Photoshop), a new laptop and hard drive specifically for ART DECADES, website and promotional costs and various expenses for photoshoots, interviews etc. 

Ideally, we hope to reach our full goal.  This will allow us to get all of the above and the fees to Indiegogo will be cut in half.  The project will proceed even if we do not hit our goal and all funds gathered will go towards the publishing software as that is the key to making this happen.

We are offering a number of rewards for contributors and you will have our eternal gratitude.

The Impact

This is a lifelong dream of mine and promise that it is going to be a very special publication.  Here are some of the amazing artists and writers that have signed on for Issue #1:


INTERVIEWS AND PROFILES:

Celia Rowlson-Hall (Award winning choreographer, filmmaker, model and writer)


Nicholas McCarthy (Director of THE PACT and the upcoming HOME)


Oren Shai (Director of the upcoming film THE FRONTIER)


Melissa Crouch of Pumpkin Hollow:  A Dark Celebration of Halloween)


Tess Alexandria (Musician, Singer, Songwriter and all around Badass)


Jill Nelson (Author of JOHN HOLMES:  A LIFE MEASURED IN INCHES, GOLDEN GODESSES and the upcoming 1976:  TAPES FROM CALIFORNIA)


Chappo (Acclaimed Brooklyn-based rock group)

Jeanie Laub (U.K. based painter and photographer)

Marcelline Block (Author and Editor)


WRITTEN CONTRIBUTIONS:

John Amero with April Hall (From the podcast THE RIALTO REPORT)

John Levy (Filmmaker and co-founder of LA BELLE AURORE Films)

Tara Hanks (U.K. based blogger, novelist and author of THE MMM GIRL and WICKED BABY)

J.D. Lafrance (Blogger, critic and creator of RADIATOR HEAVEN)


Kent Adamson (Filmmaker and co-creator of the upcoming DETOUR documentary)

Brian Harris (Writer, editor and co-creator of WENG'S CHOP)

Tim Paxton (Writer, editor and co-creator of WENG'S CHOP)

Salem Kapsaski (U.K. based Filmmaker at Apres Vague Productions and director of SPIDARLINGS)

Bryce Wilson (Blogger, critic and creator of THINGS THAT DON'T SUCK)

Aaron W. Graham (Critic and filmmaker)

Laura Helen Marks (Film-Scholar, teacher and writer)

David Arrate (Film-Historian, writer and creator of MY KIND OF STORY)

Steve Langton (Blogger, writer and original old-school U.K. Punk)

Erich Kuersten (Blogger, critic and creator of ACIDEMIC)

Jared Auner (Blogger, critic and DVD producer)

Neil Fulwood (U.K. based blogger and poet)

Brandon Colvin (Filmmaker, writer and director of FRAMES)

Derek Hill (Blogger, critic and author of CHARLIE KAUFMAN AND HOLLYWOOD'S MERRY BAND OF PRANKSTERS)

Heather Drain (Blogger, critic, film-historian and creator of MONDO HEATHER)


Sheila O'Malley (Blogger, critic and creator of THE SHEILA VARIATIONS)

Dave Stewart (Blogger, critic and creator of BLOODY TERROR)

Budd Wilkins (Blogger, critic and writer at SLANT)

Derek Botelho (Critic, film-historian and author of the upcoming THE ARGENTO SYNDROME)


PHOTOGRAPHY, MODELLING AND CREATIVE DESIGN:

Kelley Richey
Whitley Brandenburg
Rhiannon Lake Mills



Please help spread the word by sharing this page and video via Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Blogger or any other social networks you might use.  Thanks for reading and thanks for the support!

story:
Im "Expeditionsstil" mit dem Fahrrad nach Island

Sir Ernest Shackelton suchte Männer für seine Südpolexpedition mit folgender Anzeige:
„Männer für gefährliche Reise gesucht. Geringer Lohn, bittere Kälte, lange Monate kompletter Dunkelheit, ständige Gefahr, sichere Rückkehr ungewiss. Ehre und Anerkennung im Erfolgsfall.“

Für die Islandreise wird es weder einen Lohn noch Ehre und Anerkennung geben. Dafür aber hoffentlich atemberaubende Natur, viele neue Erfahrungen, Eindrücke und unvergessliche Erlebnisse die man sich selbst erarbeitet hat.

Philipp und ich sind begeisterte Radfahrer, die bereits einige kleinere und größere Projekte verwirklicht haben. Unsere aktuelle Idee ist eine Reise nach und durch Island im "Expeditionsstil", d.h. wir nehmen unser Gepäck und unsere Nahrung größtenteils mit und werden zwar einer festen Route um Island herum und durch das Hochland folgen, uns allerdings auch von den Ereignissen leiten lassen.

Im Vordergrund stehen das wortwörtliche "Erfahren" von Entfernungen, Weite, Einsamkeit.

Am Ende wollen wir unsere Erlebnisse in Buchform (eBook, evtl fest gebunden) und als Fotovortrag dokumentieren und der Öffentlichkeit zugänglich machen. Ein Fotokalender bzw. Poster sind ebenfalls angedacht. 

Warum wir eine Kampagne machen

Expeditionen sind teuer!

  • die Fahräder müssen "islandfit" gemacht werden
  • das Fährticket kostet pro Person 460€
  • Island selber ist teuer, da hohe Umsatzsteuer, und alles wird per Schiff importiert
  • Fahrräder müssen teilweise umgebaut werden
  • wir müssen viel Material mitnehmen, da das Wetter auf Island recht rau werden kann
  • Verdienstausfall für sechs Wochen

Wir sind überzeugt vom Prinzip von "Geben und Nehmen" - und würden gerne diejenigen "mitnehmen", denen dieses einmalige Erlebnis verwehrt bleibt. Deswegen gibt es die Idee, die Reise ausführlich zu dokumentieren und euch so zu beteiligen. Eure Gegenleistung ist eine kleine Spende für unsere "Expedition".

Was wir zurückgeben

Jeder einzelne Euro hilft uns, unser Projekt zu verwirklichen. Wir wollen die Reise im Internet und in Buchform veröffentlichen und so unsere Erlebnisse allen zur Verfügung stellen. Des Weiteren haben wir einiges an Know-How gesammelt, was Fahrräder betrifft.

Kann ich euch sonstwie helfen?

Selbstverständlich! Wer nichts zahlen möchte oder kann, aber trotzdem von unserem Vorhaben überzeugt ist, kann ungemein helfen:

Macht das Projekt bekannt!
Wie jedes Projekt, lebt auch dieses von seiner Bekanntheit. Teilt es anderen Leuten über Email, Twitter, Facebook mit. Oder erzählt ihnen davon.

Positiver Zuspruch hebt die Motivation. Gerade in der Planungsphase hat uns immer auch die Frage begleitet: können wir das überhaupt machen?

Im "Expeditionsstil" mit dem Fahrrad nach Island
Sir Ernest Shackelton suchte Männer für seine Südpolexpedition mit folgender Anzeige:  „Männer für gefährliche Reise gesucht. Geringer Lohn, bittere Kälte, lange Monate kompletter Dunkelheit, ständige Gefahr, sichere Rückkehr ungewiss. Ehre und Anerkennung im Erfolgsfall.“Für die Islandreise wird es weder einen Lohn noch Ehre und Anerkennung geben. story:
If you believe that a strong idea can push boundaries, you will support our project!

We are a group of authors from Serbia, with a desire to demonstrate the beauty of fantastic literature we love and create, to the greatest possible number of people. Nowadays, that is not easy. Money is the main obstacle that separates young people, talented but still not very well-known authors from the ultimate goal - the hard copy publication of their work. That didn’t stop us believing in the power of working together, so we have established an informal group and wrote a collection of short stories. Unfortunately, at this time, we are not able to find a publisher who would publish our work without financial participation. This is why we need your support.

 

Our latest project, free ebook collection of short stories "Something breathes in my cake" is downloaded more then 3000 times. Here are some pictures from the promotions.

 

 

The V Collection (Zbirka V – fantastične priče iz ravnice)

The V Collection is a collection of short horror and science fiction stories interrelated with the motifs of Vojvodina (a region in Serbia) in which they are placed. Nine authors presented a fantastic view of their environment, an area they love and where most of them live. The collection consists of a total of 22 stories from 9 authors.


Andrea Baskin presented three mainly different stories about paranormal creatures which live among us or are trying to use or investigate our species.

Saša Robnik submitted a few short stories of urban fantasy and post-apocalypse, interspersed with some horror, serenity and humour.
 
Boris Mišić has two groups of stories, the first one follows the adventures of a young witch in a changed world in the near future, in an environment of urban fiction; the other brings a mix of fantasy and horror elements with real places, the theme of war and the memories of the past intertwining with reality where the homeland and the new home of the hero are fighting for a place in his soul, reflecting the inner life of characters in these stories.
 
Radoslav Slavnić submitted three stories: "Golden Child" (science fiction story about youth and the phenomenon of ghost lights), "T-contract" (Faustian body horror about the truth behind modern medicine) and "Rotting Meat and Blood cookies" (family horror story with traditional and folk elements).

Ivica Milarić is represented by a story set in the future, after the cataclysmic events that disrupted the regularity of all life on Earth. In the ever-changing state of chaos, the main protagonist of the story, a member of a street gang, spends his days in his native city, completing various tasks and preparing for the big trip that should take them to a much better place. At the same time, foreign beings whose intentions are terrible and incomprehensible, are involved in this process.

Goran Segedinac tells us in his three stories about dark family secrets, the horror of the primordial embryo that lurks in every earthly form and trauma that will remain with us in the afterlife.

Damir Mikloš tells us about the cyclic nature of history, the ebb and flow of human fears, the powerful force of nostalgia and human need for belonging.

Darko Tuševljaković presents a story about a not-so-normal love story and an obsession that ends up in a grape field.

Oto Oltvanji presented a story about lies, family and hiding secrets.

In this moment we are awaiting two more authors to join us. We will keep you informed about it.

 

The importance of your support.

Though some of the included authors are well-known and award-winning, we as a group are still unestablished. The importance of your support is invaluable. You will help us to build a new identity, and gain a reputation as serious artists, which will significantly improve our chances to publish future work. We do not want to dwell on this project - although this will be our first community work in print, we are constantly working on other projects in order to present our readers our work. One of them is the e-collection called “Something breathes in my cake”, a set of stories set around the new year's eve, which has been downloaded more than 3000 times. However, we are aware that we still do not have it in printed form, which would be the copestone of our collective effort. Our long-term goal is to build a respectable literary circle around which we will gather more young artists that can experience their first publications through it.

 

How  we would use the money

The book will be published in Serbian.

- Hiring an editor to prepare our texts.
- Paying publishers to publish our book (preparation, layout, printing, distribution).
- Creating promotional materials (posters, flyers, low-budget ads).
- Organizing promotional activities to present our work, share experiences and encourage other authors not to give up the seemingly insurmountable obstacles. 

If we collect less then the amount we asked for, we will make a more favorable campaign and reduce the circulation of the book.

 

Every penny means a lot to us. We are fully aware that we will never be able to repay you, but we gladly offer these perks for your efforts:

$ 1 - Your name in the status of our FB page (Esnaf V)

$ 5 - Your name in the list of donors on our internet forum www.esnafv.com

$10 - V collection wallpaper , with a personal inscription

$15 - Your picture on our Facebook pages in the "Donors gallery"

$ 30 - E Book Collection V in a PDF or ePub format (serbian)

$ 50 - Your name will be printed at the end of the book where we thank all the people who helped us, as well as written on the internet forum on the list with the other donors

$ 100 - Acknowledgement on our FB page, your name will be written in bold and among the first at the end of the book where we thank all the people who helped us, also on our internet forum, and you will also get a signed copy of the book (free shipping included.)

$ 250 - Your name and a photo with a special thank-you on the beginning of the book, a few words about you (3-4 sentences) and a free copy of the book (free shiping included)

$ 300 - Get a story with YOU as the leading character!!! (You can choose the author who will write it). The story will be included in the V collection!
P.S. : We can't guarantee a happy end. :-)
You will also receive a T-Shirt with collection V print and a signed copy of the book (Serbian language - free shipping included)

 

Other ways you can help

Spread the word :-)
