story:
My daughter, Kathi was diagnosed with Intracranial Hypertension when she was 17.  She doesn't always look sick, but she suffers from constant head pain, dizziness, nausea, whooshing in her ears, and vision issues.  She has lost her peripheral vision and has black spots in her normal visual field.  Because of her extreme dizziness, she tends to fall over without warning from time to time.  Sometimes, I'm there to catch her; other times, she just falls.  As her disease has progressed, she's also begun to experience what we call "jittery legs" -- her legs just suddenly start jumping around, out of her control, while she's walking.  That gets kind of scary because when she can't control her legs they sort of fly out from under her and she falls.

Kathi's an active college student.  She takes classes four days a week, and she's majoring in Zoology and Music.  On her Good Head Days (GHDs), that's not too bad.  But on her Bad Head Days (BHDs), it's grueling.  And dangerous.  I can't be there on campus with her because I have to work (I'm a single mom).  There aren't always railings for her to hold onto when she's walking from class to class, and her friends are on different schedules so they can't be there to walk with her.  

Kathi has been approved for a service dog through a service dog organization in El Cajon, CA.  This organization doesn't charge its recipients for their dogs and the training that goes with them, but they do work on a donation basis.  Kathi's dog will cost $10,000 to raise and train for Kathi's specific needs.  The organization relies on donations to pay for this, and it often takes 3 years before those funds are raised. 

Kathi really needs her dog now, though, so she can continue to go to school.  Three years is just too long especially with her condition worsening the way it is.  She's been working hard since April to help the service dog organization raise the money.  So far, she's raised $4,000 with the help of our family and friends through donations, Pampered Chef and Origami Owl fundraisers, and making & selling her own jewelry.  Here we are in August, the new semester has started, she's back in school, and we're still $6,000 short of her goal.

Please help Kathi get her service dog.  Any size donation will help, and we will be so grateful.  And if you prefer to donate anonymously, please send me an email at DeiGratia1186@gmail.com for instructions.  

Thank you,

Pia

story:
An Issue that Hits Close to Home

According to the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism, an estimated 6.6 million children under the age of 18 years live in households with at least one alcoholic parent.

Estimates are that over 11 million children under age 18 are children of alcoholic parents and that as many as 43% of the US adult population has been exposed to alcoholism in the family. Research findings suggest that these children are at risk for a range of cognitive, emotional, and behavioral problems. Sadly a lot of these children grow up with shame, feeling unloved, guilt, depression and a variety of other issues because of their parents drinking.

Alcoholism in families is a worldwide issue. I was born and raised in the Bahamas and my dad was an Alcoholic. He was an absent figure in my life. On December 27th, 2010 he lost his life due to health related issues because of his years of alcohol abuse.

I have lived through the pain, the heartache and all the feelings of being a child of an alcoholic parent. I could have turned out to be an alcoholic myself, but I am not.

At 21, it is my goal to address the issue of Alcoholism in families. I want to share my story with young adults, teenagers, parents and anyone who have ever been affected by having a parent that suffered from addictions such as Alcohol Abuse. 

My Story: Life Doesn't JUST Go On...

Life Doesn’t Just Go On… is a Memoir of my life that shares my story of growing up with an Absent, Alcoholic Father. I speak about the things I experienced as a child to the things I dealt with as a teenager, to the time now that I am a young adult dealing with life after my father's death. I speak a great deal about my spiritual journey, in losing my faith and finding it again, tackling grief, self growth, and personal healing.

The significance of this Memoir Life Doesn’t Just Go On… are the poems that are featured at the beginning of each chapter and the letter that I wrote to my dad just a month before his death. 

The Impact

I feel that too many times in life people aren't able to come to a place of peace
with their parents or loved ones when they have been hurt. They aren't given the chance to fully heal through what it is that they are going through or went through. I have said the words, "I hated my dad, he’s nothing more than a sperm donor, he’s dead to me" and so on… Sometimes I feel that a person just needs to know that they are not the only one out there going through or experiencing something and this why I want to share my story. I want to be the example and the voice for that one person and many others, so that they can  know that they are not alone.

Your Support

Life Doesn't Just Go On will be published through Signalman Publishing. The manuscript is completed and ready to print. My initial goal is to raise $380 so that Life Doesn't Just Go On, can be printed and distributed before Christmas, but IndieGogo has a minimum fundraising goal of $500.

Breakdown

-$180.00 - Final Downpayment of the Basic Publishing Package

-$195.00 - Full Cover Design Fees

-$125.00 - Shipping Fees of Autographed Books & Thank You Notes

=$500

Your contribution will go towards printing, distribution, design and shipping fees.

Don't forget to visit the galley to view the book's design as well as the publishing invoice. Thank you in advance for your support!

story:
Who we are & Our mission

We are a small church, called the Power of Praise Church, located on the University of Southern California (USC) campus in Los Angeles, CA. This summer, from August 1st to 8th, we are planning a mission trip to Vietnam. We will spend time with the children of Lai Daihans abandoned by their Korean fathers who fought in the Vietnamese war. About 10-15 members of our church will go to Vietnam to teach English, build friendships, and share the love of Jesus.  

For the trip, each person will need ~$1,500 for the round-trip airfare, lodging, and meals. In total, we would need $30,000. We hope to raise $6,000 through IndieGoGo.com.

Please support our very first mission trip to Vietnam and pray that God will work through us in His own way. We appreciate your help and will pray for you. We will also send you photos taken during our trip.

 

We can provide documents for tax reimbursement upon request.

story:
Story of My Book

What We Call Love is a multiple POV book about five black and brown teenagers from the city of Chicago. Specifically it is about the individual journeys of each as they navigate relationships with their families, with each other, and with themselves. It’s a story that addresses the usual problems teenagers go through but in the perspectives of individuals who are targeted every day in the United States by the color of their skin.

My name is Esther Huescas, and I am the author of What We Call Love. I wrote this book because I grew up loving coming of age love stories, fell in love with the characters, and became invested in them. As a Mexican-American woman with brown skin, I never was able to see myself as the protagonist. On the off chance that one of the main characters was a person of color, the movie adaptation would end up white washing them. What We Call Love is the book I wish I’d had the opportunity to read while growing up. As a minority in this country, I should be able to have a main character that looks like me, one that has a chance at happily ever after.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the importance in having a story where minority youth discover love and themselves. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to reminisce about what it feels like to be young and falling in love, escape from your everyday worries, learn from the characters the importance of allowing yourself to love. 

In my book, What We Call Love, you will learn about the lives of Mariposa, Serenity, Jayden, Elijah, and Raymond. They are five teenagers from the city of Chicago. Mariposa and Elijah, 18-year-old Mexican twins, live on the northwest side of Chicago. Jayden is a 19-year-old Dominican from the west side. Eighteen-year-old Serenity is African American and lives on the city's south side. Raymond, a Nigerian from the north side, is 19.  

The story takes place in the beginning of the summer of 2019, after Mariposa, Elijah, and Serenity graduate high school. The majority of the story, with the exception of the last two chapters, takes place within one day during one summer night party. 

Mariposa and Jayden have a complicated, romantic past, and they spend the book trying to figure out their feelings for each other and their future. Elijah struggles with being honest with himself and his sister. Serenity and Raymond had been dating for over two years and are in the perfect relationship in the eyes of everyone around them. Throughout the novel they navigate what college and moving away means for their relationship. Overall, it's a story of the five friends growing up in a city full of distractions and hope. 

You will love this book if you want to feel the butterflies of young adult love.

What We Call Love speaks to minority inner-city youth who grapple navigating relationships and discovering their passions and dreams.

Ultimately, I hope that What We Call Love inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
  • How did your first and most prominent example of love (parents, family, television, music, etc) shape how you view and define romantic relationships?
  • How do you believe stressors, such as poverty and racial inequality, impact romantic relationships?
  • How are young minorities impacted when they do not see themselves as protagonists in mainstream literature?
I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing love, socioeconomic inequality, gun violence, gang violence, and systemic racism will change us all for the better. 

The Book - What We Call Love

The book is written in 3 Parts.... 

Part 1 contains the Author’s Note + Chapters 1-5. In this Part the reader will be introduced to all five main characters of the novel. The five characters are Mariposa, Serenity, Jayden, Elijah, and Raymond. The reader will learn about where they stand when it comes to love and what they wish to become. The characters are all getting ready for Serenity’s 18th birthday party in Part 1.

Part 2 contains Chapters 6-10. The reader learns about the characters’ complex relationships with each other, and some characters share how it felt when they began to fall in love. The party they all attend starts in Part 2.

Part 3 contains Chapters 11-18. In these chapters, the party and the problems that arise from it are what changes the five friends. Part 3 is the most honest because until this point they have not been truthful with themselves about what they want going into the future. Some of them stay in love, while others learn to first love themselves. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go toward the following:
 

The Editor and I will work together to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020.

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copy editing for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
 

A personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover.

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author


My name is Esther Huescas, I am a 19-year-old Mexican-American woman from Chicago, IL. I am a first-generation American who majored in Psychology at the University of Illinois in Urbana Champaign. I work as a part-time research assistant at the Attachment, Personality, and Emotion Lab for the college’s Psychology Department. 

I wrote this book because I believe it is necessary and honestly overdue. I learned English and subsequently how to read when I was in second grade. I found my love for books throughout that hard process. My love of reading grew as I got older, and I fell in love with coming of age novels. What I found, though, as a young woman of color, is that I never saw someone who looked like me on the cover of books about love. I want a younger generation of girls who looked like me to know that they are also worthy of being the main character. Eventually, I hope to inspire someone to write their own novel one day.

I volunteer as a reading tutor for bilingual children at a local elementary school in Champaign. It has felt extremely full circle to be able to introduce to children the world of literature. In my free time I enjoy music, specifically going to concerts. My love for music is something that I am sure readers will notice once they begin to read What We Call Love.

My goal with this book is simple. To generate awareness on important issues that affect minorities, through stories of love.

For more information you can connect with Esther at huescasesther@gmail.com and @estherhuescas on Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #whatwecalllove and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Love,
Esther Huescas

story:
My story

  • Three years ago I was simply a girl who was passionate about the sea and sailing as well as theatre, lighting design and drawing. One day I realised I wanted to get into a big adventure, after a year of search and volunteer work I found Draken. A viking ship. Going across the North Atlantic.
  • While sailing I was writing and drawing every day to record the daily routine and observations of life onboard and nature surrounding us. The adventure became one of my most life changing experiences. Going through my notes and putting them into a book helped me to adjust to land life when I got back. It was also a way to preserve precious details of the experience and emotions while they were fresh in my memory!
  • After 2 years I finally decided to publish this book based on my journals so I could share this story with you. Now the only thing I need to accomplish the goal is to make sure there are people who are interested in this project and find the financial support to make it real!

 

The book

The book is in English.

A working title of the book is 3 o'clock Mackerel time.

The book will be hardcover and contain about 64 pages with text and drawings/sketches on every page. Most of them I made on the ship and some were made later as illustrations.

The book is based on my sailor's journal. It tells the story of 21 days at sea, crossing the North Atlantic on the Draken Harald Harfagre, sailing from Norway to Newfoundland. It tells about our daily routine onboard and the way we adopted to the challenging conditions, the nature we encountered and things I learnt. The narration is divided in 21 day

 

A short extract from the book:

Living on the ship you get used to the idea that there’s no such thing as a simple, one-move action. Everything has to be planned, choreographed and given at least triple the amount of time to which you’re used to whilst on land. Making a cup of coffee might take about 10 minutes. Going to the heads takes up to 20. Simply walking from one end to another (which is less than 34 metres distance) can easily take about 3 to 5 minutes.

With every other step you think a few steps ahead, you need to maintain your balance, make sure to avoid all the lines and blocks flapping in the air, be ready for seaspray and expect the unexpected. With all that considered, you leave a little room for your dance through the ship to appear in the least bit graceful.

 

From now on we have two people to watch out for icebergs. We’re getting closer to the ice. No ships, no buoys, not a single sign of human intervention. It is a new and very special feeling when being on bow duty your main mission is to spot a white giant. A little white dash on the canvas of the sea, which can bring big troubles to our little wooden “canoe” if missed by the radars and the sharp eye of the lookout.

 

The story is written in English because I lived through the experience mainly speaking English and using English (as well as Swedish and Norwegian) sailing terms. Though, I am considering printing a Russian version too.

 

The campaign

For those who contribute, you have a few cool perk options. Starting from a single postcard to the physical printed copy of the book, with a hemp line from the ship as a bookmark!!

By the time the campaign finishes (May 2019), the final version of the layout will be ready. 

I will print as many copies as possible, based on the money raised and number of books claimed here. The quality also depends on the financial support I receive.

The goal I've set is flexible. It's based on covering all the expenses: the Indiegogo fee, credit card fees, editing and layout made by professionals, printing in offset and having about 500 copies in the end. If the campaign does not reach the goal, I might reconsider quality and quantity.

Though the book WILL BE PRINTED in any case.

I would be really grateful for any support and interest in the project! Thank you and fare winds to everyone :)

story:
Åren som försvann "The years that disappeared"- a short summary in english, then a presentation in six acts in swedish.

 

"Åren som försvann" or in english "The years that disappeared" is an upcoming book written in Swedish about Malin, when it begins she is a 25-year-old top student with her whole life ahead of her. But she has lived for a long time with great stress she herself was not really aware of, and which the story will tell us a bit about in broken chronology. This together with her being a sensitive person, this causes her to suffer from psychosis. A glass window is smashed so that her knuckles bleed, she suffers from delusions where reality is mixed with imagination. Without being a part of what is happening around her, she has ended up in a psychiatric ward, surrounded by people with startling symptoms who have sometimes been ill for much longer than herself. Sometimes not.

 

After a while she gets better bur it is a long road back to a normal life, with internships with vague purposes, with medicines, with visits to psychologists, but also unexpected, interesting meetings. Against impossible odds, she finds a way out of her illness and can both find her way back to working life and find the love of her life. The book is not only an exciting autobiographical description of a young woman's struggle to take back her life, it also provides a unique description of what it is like to be mentally ill and how Swedish healthcare works from a patient's perspective. Not to mention the way out from the illness and back to a normal life.

 

This is my own story that I have made into a book.  The main reason I have behind that I do this is because that I really want to break the stigma of mental illness. To take a current example from Sweden, when I saw this year's "Swedish Eurovision on TV, I felt really anxious for a moment when the artist Måns Zelmerlöw came in singing on stage about another artist called Christer Björkman, joking about him having a psychosis. So, nowadays in prime time on Swedish television, one can joke about psychosis, when there is so much else that everyone knows that it is not okay to joke about. Such as race, gender and disabilities. Which I really think we shouldn't, as long as we are not joking about ourselves. But nearly no one dares to be the face of psychosis or mental illness- And I say the reason is not only that many people are too sick. The reason is definitely also the stigma.It has taken me 13 years to finally speak. 

 

And now.

A longer text In my mother's tongue Swedish (the book is written in Swedish).

*********************

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Åren som försvann är en kommande bok som handlar om Malin, när vi kastas in i handlingen är hon en 25-årig toppstudent med hela livet framför sig. Men hon har levt länge i en inre stress hon inte själv varit riktigt medveten om, och som även berättelsen ska komma att i bruten kronologi förtälja en del om. Tillsammans med hög sårbarhet gör detta att hon drabbas av psykos.

En glasruta krossas så knogarna blöder,  hon drabbas av vanföreställningar där verklighet blandas med fantasi. Utan att vara med på vad som händer omkring henne, har hon hamnat på en psykiatrisk avdelning, omgiven av människor med  häpnadsväckande symptom som ibland varit sjuka betydligt längre än hon själv.  Ibland inte.

Sedan följer den långa vägen tillbaka till ett normalt liv, med praktikplatser med luddiga syften, med mediciner, med psykologbesök, men även oväntade, intressanta möten. Mot omöjliga odds hittar hon en väg ur sin sjukdom och kan både hitta tillbaka till arbetslivets och finna sitt livs kärlek.

Boken är inte bara en spännande självbiografisk skildring om en ung kvinnas kamp för att återta sitt liv, den ger också en unik skildring i hur det är att vara psykossjuk och hur den svenska sjukvården fungerar ur ett patientperspektiv. För att inte tala om vägen ut och tillbaka.

 

En kort sammanfattning

Jag heter Malin Lindmark och är den som skrivit boken Åren som försvann som den här kampanjen samlar in pengar till. Ursprungligen kommer jag från Borås, men är numera bosatt i Göteborg. Här bor jag med min man och min son, född januari 2019.

Skrivandet har varit min följeslagare större delen av livet, och jag har författat allt ifrån diverse ifrågasättande insändare till smärtsamma och underfundiga dikter. Numera är jag leg. gymnasielärare i svenska, svenska som andraspråk samt konst och kultur och sedan 2016 undervisar jag vuxna i svenska som andraspråk.  

Åren som försvann är min första roman och självbiografi som skildrar några svåra år i mitt liv. Min förhoppning är att den ska kunna ge hopp till andra som genomlever liknande svårigheter och att det kan finnas ett ljus i slutet av tunneln.

 

Dags att bryta stigmat kring psykisk ohälsa

För att ta ett aktuellt exempel så när jag såg årets melodifestival på tv, kände jag för ett ögonblick en sten i bröstet när Måns Zelmerlöv kom in sjungandes på scenen om Christer Björkman, "...han hade fått en psykos..". Att man på detta sätt på bästa sändningstid i Sveriges television kan skämta om psykossjukdom, när det är så mycket annat som alla vet att det inte är okej att skämta om längre gör mig bedrövad. Men det säger också något om varför min bok verkligen behövs.

Jag har själv funderat på hur kollegor och bekanta kommer att reagera om de läser min bok? Kommer de tänka annorlunda om mig om de får veta min bakgrund som före detta psykossjuk? Kommer de ifrågasätta min kompetens som lärare? När jag blev gravid med vår son för ca tre år sedan blev jag återigen påmind om min bakgrund. Jag önskade få samma behandling som alla andra gravida kvinnor, jag ville helst fokusera på lyckan men inte. För säkerhets skull skickades jag att prata med en psykolog under graviditeten. Utan att jag själv önskat. Jag tänkte, ska jag aldrig bli kvitt det här? För att inte tala om när han precis fötts. Då var det ännu värre. Man sprang i dörrarna för att titta på mig och se om jag började få symptom, pratade också med min man om mig bakom ryggen. 

Jag tror att jag är helt rätt person att skriva den här boken. Jag är en isbrytare och samtidigt en historieberättare. Min bok innehåller inte bara allvarliga saker. Där finns också mycket värme, humor, relationer och kärleksintriger. Jag tror och hoppas att den som läser den kan bli lika underhållen som informerad. Den läsaren skulle kunna vara du.

 

Vad vi behöver & vad du får

Det råder ingen tvekan om att den här boken kommer att ges ut i december 2021.

När jag hade skrivit klart boken skickade jag mitt manus till sju mindre förlag, fyra av dem ville oberoende av varandra ge mig chansen. Till slut bestämde jag mig för ett samarbete med Tallbergs förlag. Jag gillade deras profil och hur de i flera av sina böcker tagit ställning och lyft fram personer ur andra utsatta grupper i samhället.

Det är pga covid-19 man har fått utöka antalet hybridkontrakt och därför erbjuder de ett sådant.

Det går ut på att jag kommer att stå för ungefär en tredjedel av kostnaderna med boken själv (tryckkostnaderna som är på 40 000 kr) och förlaget står för resterande två tredjedelar som är att ge ut boken som tryckt bok och e-bok, registrera på bokinfo, korrekturläsning, sättning, marknadsföring, lagerkostnad, distribution och försäljning (enligt förlagets uträkning kommer detta att hamna på ca 100 000 kr första året). Vi siktar då på att ge ut boken i 1000 exemplar.

Jag har satt som mål att enbart samla ihop till min del av kostnaden, som är 40 000 kr, men det är ett flexibelt mål. Om inte alla pengarna kommer in genom den här kampanjen kommer boken att ges ut ändå. Då skjuter jag nämligen själv till det som saknas. Så viktigt är det här projektet för mig. Jag gör inte detta för att bli rik, utan i första hand för att jag anser att budskapet i boken är viktigt. Dels vill jag berätta min historia, men jag tror och hoppas också att min berättelse kan hjälpa andra som drabbats av svårigheter. Visa att det finns ett ljus någonstans där i slutet av tunneln.

Genom att förbeställa boken genom min Indiegogo-kampanj kan du förutom att känna att du är med och stöttar en viktig och ovanlig berättelse också få chansen att se ditt eget namn tryckt inne i boken, kanske med en kort hälsning från mig. Du kan vara en av de första att äga ett signerat exemplar, och om du känner dig riktigt generös, kan du även få träffa mig personligen via zoom och på en halvtimmes videodejt med mig. Då får du ställa frågor om boken och annat som rör mitt författarskap.  

 

Nyttan som boken kan göra 

Den här boken är viktig därför att det är en av få skildringar av en psykossjukdom ur ett patientperspektiv. Den är också viktig eftersom den vill belysa att det faktiskt kan gå bra efter en sådan upplevelse. Att det med rätt stöd går att bli frisk, komma in på arbetsmarknaden igen, finna kärleken och skaffa barn om man så kan eller önskar. Helt enkelt leva ett normalt liv. Vad det nu är? Ja, det kan finnas olika livsåskådningar. Men det viktigaste är : Du kan få må bra och leva i harmoni. Det finns hopp. Dessutom kan boken vara ett viktigt komplement till facklitteratur för de som ska arbeta inom sjukvården eller till anhöriga till personer med psykisk ohälsa. 
 

Risker & utmaningar

Som med alla projekt kan det finnas risker. En sådan risk är t.ex. att boken inte blir klar i tid. Den risken är dock väldigt liten. Manuset är färdigskrivet och jag har redan ett väl etablerat förlag (Tallbergs förlag) i ryggen som kommer ge ut boken, så snart de fått betalt. Vilket de får när kampanjen är avslutad. De har lovat mig att boken ska kunna levereras i december, förhoppningsvis innan julafton och jag litar på deras kompetens.

En annan risk är förstås att jag inte får in tillräckligt med pengar. Men i sådana fall kommer jag skjuta till de pengar som behövs ur mitt eget sparkapital för att boken ska bli av. 

En annan utmaning är att ge kampanjen tillräckligt med spridning. Jag är en flitig användare av de flesta sociala medier och kommer att använda de kanalerna för att synliggöra kampanjen. Min man Marcus Malinda Lindmark har också lovat att hjälpa till att sprida informationen om kampanjen till alla han känner.   

 

Andra sätt du kan hjälpa till

Du kanske känner att du tycker det här är ett viktigt projekt, men din ekonomi tillåter dig inte att vara med och bidra. Jag förstår. Jag har också haft perioder i livet då jag haft ont om pengar. Det är bland annat det jag skriver om i boken. 

Jag skulle dock uppskatta om du ville vara med och sprida ordet. Dela en länk hit till kampanjen i sociala medier du använder t.ex. Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn eller Instagram. Det kanske bara tar dig någon minut att göra, men för mig kan det göra stor skillnad.

Åren som försvann "The years that disappeared"- a short summary in english, then a presentation in six acts in swedish.
 
"Åren som försvann" or in english "The years that disappeared" is an upcoming book written in Swedish about Malin, when it begins she is a 25-year-old top student with her whole life ahead of her. But she has lived for a long time with great stress she herself was not really aware of, and which the story will tell us a bit about in broken chronology. This together with her being a sensitive person, this causes her to suffer from psychosis. A glass window is smashed so that her knuckles bleed, she suffers from delusions where reality is mixed with imagination. Without being a part of what is happening around her, she has ended up in a psychiatric ward, surrounded by people with startling symptoms who have sometimes been ill for much longer than herself. Sometimes not.
 
After a while she gets better bur it is a long road back to a normal life, with internships with vague purposes, with medicines, with visits to psychologists, but also unexpected, interesting meetings. Against impossible odds, she finds a way out of her illness and can both find her way back to working life and find the love of her life. The book is not only an exciting autobiographical description of a young woman's struggle to take back her life, it also provides a unique description of what it is like to be mentally ill and how Swedish healthcare works from a patient's perspective. Not to mention the way out from the illness and back to a normal life.
 
This is my own story that I have made into a book.  The main reason I have behind that I do this is because that I really want to break the stigma of mental illness. To take a current example from Sweden, when I saw this year's "Swedish Eurovision on TV, I felt really anxious for a moment when the artist Måns Zelmerlöw came in singing on stage about another artist called Christer Björkman, joking about him having a psychosis. So, nowadays in prime time on Swedish television, one can joke about psychosis, when there is so much else that everyone knows that it is not okay to joke about. Such as race, gender and disabilities. Which I really think we shouldn't, as long as we are not joking about ourselves. But nearly no one dares to be the face of psychosis or mental illness- And I say the reason is not only that many people are too sick. The reason is definitely also the stigma.It has taken me 13 years to finally speak. 
 
And now.
A longer text In my mother's tongue Swedish (the book is written in Swedish).
*********************
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Åren som försvann är en kommande bok som handlar om Malin, när vi kastas in i handlingen är hon en 25-årig toppstudent med hela livet framför sig. Men hon har levt länge i en inre stress hon inte själv varit riktigt medveten om, och som även berättelsen ska komma att i bruten kronologi förtälja en del om. Tillsammans med hög sårbarhet gör detta att hon drabbas av psykos.
En glasruta krossas så knogarna blöder,  hon drabbas av vanföreställningar där verklighet blandas med fantasi. Utan att vara med på vad som händer omkring henne, har hon hamnat på en psykiatrisk avdelning, omgiven av människor med  häpnadsväckande symptom som ibland varit sjuka betydligt längre än hon själv.  Ibland inte.
Sedan följer den långa vägen tillbaka till ett normalt liv, med praktikplatser med luddiga syften, med mediciner, med psykologbesök, men även oväntade, intressanta möten. Mot omöjliga odds hittar hon en väg ur sin sjukdom och kan både hitta tillbaka till arbetslivets och finna sitt livs kärlek.
Boken är inte bara en spännande självbiografisk skildring om en ung kvinnas kamp för att återta sitt liv, den ger också en unik skildring i hur det är att vara psykossjuk och hur den svenska sjukvården fungerar ur ett patientperspektiv. För att inte tala om vägen ut och tillbaka.
 
En kort sammanfattning
Jag heter Malin Lindmark och är den som skrivit boken Åren som försvann som den här kampanjen samlar in pengar till. Ursprungligen kommer jag från Borås, men är numera bosatt i Göteborg. Här bor jag med min man och min son, född januari 2019.
Skrivandet har varit min följeslagare större delen av livet, och jag har författat allt ifrån diverse ifrågasättande insändare till smärtsamma och underfundiga dikter. Numera är jag leg. gymnasielärare i svenska, svenska som andraspråk samt konst och kultur och sedan 2016 undervisar jag vuxna i svenska som andraspråk.  
Åren som försvann är min första roman och självbiografi som skildrar några svåra år i mitt liv. Min förhoppning är att den ska kunna ge hopp till andra som genomlever liknande svårigheter och att det kan finnas ett ljus i slutet av tunneln.
 
Dags att bryta stigmat kring psykisk ohälsa
För att ta ett aktuellt exempel så när jag såg årets melodifestival på tv, kände jag för ett ögonblick en sten i bröstet när Måns Zelmerlöv kom in sjungandes på scenen om Christer Björkman, "...han hade fått en psykos..". Att man på detta sätt på bästa sändningstid i Sveriges television kan skämta om psykossjukdom, när det är så mycket annat som alla vet att det inte är okej att skämta om längre gör mig bedrövad. Men det säger också något om varför min bok verkligen behövs.
Jag har själv funderat på hur kollegor och bekanta kommer att reagera om de läser min bok? Kommer de tänka annorlunda om mig om de får veta min bakgrund som före detta psykossjuk? Kommer de ifrågasätta min kompetens som lärare? När jag blev gravid med vår son för ca tre år sedan blev jag återigen påmind om min bakgrund. Jag önskade få samma behandling som alla andra gravida kvinnor, jag ville helst fokusera på lyckan men inte. För säkerhets skull skickades jag att prata med en psykolog under graviditeten. Utan att jag själv önskat. Jag tänkte, ska jag aldrig bli kvitt det här? För att inte tala om när han precis fötts. Då var det ännu värre. Man sprang i dörrarna för att titta på mig och se om jag började få symptom, pratade också med min man om mig bakom ryggen.

Där finns också mycket värme, humor, relationer och kärleksintriger. Jag tror och hoppas att den som läser den kan bli lika underhållen som informerad. Den läsaren skulle kunna vara du.

story:
FY Poetry Slam

The FY Poetry Slam is the first ever National Poetry Slam team to be formed through online competition!

  • Unlike most slams that charge an entry fee at the door we are free for anyone on the internet. This is great but does put us at a disadvantage when it comes to raising funds.
  • By donating you'll help make our internet dreams a reality!

We're asking for $2,065

Here's what that money goes toward:

  • Our registration, membership, coaching and tournament entry fee.
  • The cost of one hotel room for the week.
  • If we go over this goal we can actually afford to pay for the poets travel  expenses.

The Impact

  • Your donation helps prove that online slamming can be a viable method to bring artists together. 
  • Our slam provides a space for people who might not normally have access to poetry slam.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Follow us and help spread the word on twitter @FYPoetrySlam, Tumblr fuckyeahpoetryslam.tumblr.com and Facebook.com/fypoetryslam
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the word!

story:
I've written a book to help people conquer their nicotine demon forever.

I just need your help with this last step - in exchange for which I'll give you the book at a special pre-launch price and various other good things... Please donate to help with publishing and marketing. It will make a big difference to me and even $10 would be great!

I've spent the last four years helping people quit smoking and now I'd like to be able to help a lot more. In fact, I'd like to help millions to quit if possible. 

Everyone knows how hard it is for people to quit smoking as well as the consequences of not being able to do so, if only from the shocking anti-smoking campaigns on TV - and the fact that six million people die from it every year. What many people don't know is how tobacco has been manipulated and enhanced so that now only 2.5% people who try and break free on their own are able to succeed. 

My book ‘Quit Smoking Now and Forever: Releasing the Nicotine Demon’ provides a way out for all the people who want to quit, of which there are estimated to be 28 million in the US alone.

After working on it for a little over a year the entire text is finally finished and ready for publication. Yippee!

It totals almost 40,000 words and includes tons of information on cigarettes, how tobacco has been manipulated to get people so addicted, how to quit (using herbs, hypnosis, homeopathic remedies, food, breathing techniques etc.) and how to stay free forever. It is designed to speak to the conscious as well as the subconscious mind - as it's the latter that keeps people smoking despite wanting to quit. The book is full of powerful visualizations which can be listened to online and also includes 3 video EFT or Tapping sessions, an explanation of how to do basic EFT (Tapping) at home, as well as an quit smoking hypnosis mp3 which can all be downloaded from the website. 

If someone reads the book, follows the instructions and experiences the mind changing hypnosis and EFT sessions they will be able to quit smoking. Given 60% of smokers are destined to die 10-15 years before their time from a smoking related disease, helping someone quit would be a very good thing.

The book has been professionally edited and the front cover has already been designed (as you can see above). All that remains is to raise the money to get it published (and online and in the stores) with First Edition Design Publishing - a great self-publishing company. I also need a professional website where people can access the quit smoking hypnosis mp3, the "Tapping" videos, the visualization mp3s and the forum. 

As far as marketing goes I still need to create 4 videos for the on-line marketing campaigns (which are already written and which I can film myself), get them edited (which needs to be paid for) , edit the 3 EFT videos, set up a sales website for the book, and pay for some Google and Facebook Ads.

Rather than do a less than perfect job or have to wait until I have all the money necessary to go ahead (or worse, have to borrow the money from the 'banksters'), I am offering the book at a special pre-release price and asking for your assistance even in the case you have no personal use for the book. Even $10 would be great! For each donation I am offering something in return. I hope you like your gifts of thanks. 

With the help from backers like you the book will get to the people who need it, sooner rather than later - and it will get done right. Thank you in advance for your support and I hope to be able to return the favor one day for a crowd funding project of your own.

This is how the book starts.... 

“There was a young lady named Mae

Who smoked without stopping all day;

As pack followed pack,

Her lungs first turned black,

And eventually rotted away.”  Edward Gorey, Floating Worlds                                                

“Giving up smoking is the easiest thing in the world. I know because I've done it thousands of times.” Mark Twain

I dedicate this book to all the people in the world who go through addiction and come out the other side wiser and stronger.

Contents:

Author’s Note

Introduction Chapter 1: Seeing their chains

Chapter 2: Seven thousand chemicals 

Chapter 3: Nicotine - the drug 

Chapter 4: What kind of smoker are you?

Chapter 5: Tricking your subconscious mind 

Chapter 6: Making you sick 

Chapter 7: The nicotine demon 

Chapter 8: Ending the relationship 

Chapter 9: Funeral for a friend 

Chapter 10: Craving is an emotion 

Chapter 11: So many benefits to quitting 

Chapter 12: Becoming a non-smoker 

Chapter 13: The plan 

Chapter 14: 17 herbs to help with quitting

Chapter 15: Help with quitting from 10 homeopathic remedies

Chapter 16: Vitamins and foods to make quitting easy 

Chapter 17: Nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) 

Chapter 18: Pharmaceutical smoking cessation aids 

Chapter 19: What about e-cigarettes? 

Chapter 20: Reward or punishment 

Chapter 21: Introducing Tapping 

Chapter 22: Breathe fresh air 

Chapter 23: The day before

Chapter 24: One day at a time 

Chapter 25: Keeping you on track 

Chapter 26: Quitting smoking with no weight gain 

Chapter 27: Note for recovering alcoholics and drug addicts 

Chapter 28: Tips for cleaning out your lungs 

Chapter 29: Staying quit forever and ever 

Chapter 30: A demon or just uncle Bob? 

Chapter 31: Breathe in the love 

Chapter 32: I salute you! 

Chapter 33: Contract never to sign

Appendix I: Tapping Instructions 

Appendix II: Tapping for fear of quitting 

Appendix III: Tapping for craving 

Appendix IV: Tapping for people who ‘love’ to smoke 

Appendix V: List of all additives in cigarettes

Author’s Note 

The nicotine demon works by hijacking your brain, your body, your mind; some would say, even your soul. This dark creature surrounds you in a gray cloud where you can wander for years, sometimes not even realizing you are lost. Until for some reason, one day, you awaken and find yourself hankering after bright sunshine again. 

All this time he’s been fooling you into thinking you needed him - even that you liked him - while behind the scenes his dark smoky tentacles have been slowly sucking the life out of you. In the same way that real parasites like a tapeworm gives off chemicals to make you desire the kind of food they want to eat, the nicotine demon manages to convince you that you are the one choosing to smoke, rather than it needing you, its host, to keep it fed. Adopting this perspective is the first step to victory. 

Once you know you have a nasty parasite living inside of you, controlling you, you can’t help but develop a strong urge to get rid of it. In fact I suspect you would do whatever was required to get it out of your body as fast as possible! This book is about exposing the nicotine parasite (or nicotine demon as I like to refer to it), getting you 100% motivated to do whatever it takes, and giving you the remedy to conquer it forever. 

Introduction 

Bravo for deciding to quit! Bravo for deciding to kick your nicotine addiction! Bravo for choosing to be free! Bravo for having the guts to stand up to the nicotine demon! Going back to being a non-smoker is the best decision you will ever make, and with the help of this book and its associated content you will succeed. 

 In many ways I’m a lot like you. I used to be a smoker. I really liked it actually. I totally bought into the “cigarette in one hand, glass of wine in the other” thing. I thought I was rather sophisticated; especially with those little brown cigarillos I used to smoke during the time I lived in Paris. Then a number of things happened.......................... (ah, you'll have to buy it if you want any more!)

Risks and challenges of the project

I don't actually see any risks. There is a huge market for the book and with the right marketing (I'm paying for classes on launching on the internet with PLF4 by marketing wizard Jeff Walker) it will be very successful I'm sure. There is no other book (program) quite like it. 
Except for creating a few videos the program is ready to go out into the world! 
My only challenge has been getting this last bit of money together to get the book published and launched. Depending on how much money I can raise, the publishing will happen first, then the professional videos and then the marketing.

Perks of supporting me 

Pre-launch price for the book: $19.95 (instead of $24.99), plus $3.99 shipping

$10 donation gift: Time to really get some sleep! For a donation of $10 or more I will send you a powerful mp3 of a hypnosis session for deep relaxation and sleep (created by me) to your email address.

$29 donation gift: A higher vibration! With this donation I give you an mp3 of a hypnosis session for deep relaxation and sleep AND an mp3 of a series of positive statements for contemplation (including powerful subliminals) designed to increase your vibration and understanding of who you are.

$100 donation gift: The book package! For this generous donation I will give you the $29 gifts and a 2 signed copies of the physical book, including shipping, with my thanks!

$250 donation gift: Wow, thank you! If you in, or can make it to Key West, it would be my pleasure to invite you for dinner at our house. I will also send you the book package AND offer you a personal Skype session with me to be used for hypnosis and EFT for releasing negative emotions, habits or for past life regression for yourself or a friend. I'll also put your name on the acknowledgements page of the book (if received by time of publishing).

If you are not able to help financially, I completely understand but I would love it if you could help get the word out for me and share this on Facebook etc.

four years helping people quit smoking and now I'd like to be able to help a
lot more. In fact, I'd like to help millions to quit if possible. 
Everyone knows how
hard it is for people to quit smoking as well as the consequences of not being
able to do so, if only from the shocking anti-smoking campaigns on TV - and the
fact that six million people die from it every year. What many people don't know is how tobacco has been manipulated and enhanced so that now only 2.5% people who try and break free on
their own are able to succeed. 
My book ‘Quit Smoking Now and Forever:
Releasing the Nicotine Demon’ provides a way out for all the
people who want to quit, of which there are estimated to be 28 million in the
US alone.
After working on it
for a little over a year the entire text is finally finished and ready for publication. Yippee!
It totals almost
40,000 words and includes tons of information on cigarettes, how tobacco has
been manipulated to get people so addicted, how to quit (using herbs, hypnosis,
homeopathic remedies, food, breathing techniques etc.) and how to stay free
forever. It is designed to speak to the conscious as well as the subconscious
mind - as it's the latter that keeps people smoking despite wanting to quit.
The book is full of powerful visualizations which can be listened to online and
also includes 3 video EFT or Tapping sessions, an explanation of how to do
basic EFT (Tapping) at home, as well as an quit smoking hypnosis mp3 which can
all be downloaded from the website. 
If someone reads the
book, follows the instructions and experiences the mind changing hypnosis and
EFT sessions they will be able to quit smoking. Given 60% of smokers are
destined to die 10-15 years before their time from a smoking related disease,
helping someone quit would be a very good thing.
The book has been professionally edited and the front cover has already been designed (as you can
see above). All that remains is to raise the money to get it published (and online and in the
stores) with First Edition Design Publishing - a great self-publishing company.
I also need a professional website where people can access the quit
smoking hypnosis mp3, the "Tapping" videos, the visualization mp3s
and the forum. 
As far as marketing goes I
still need to create 4 videos for the on-line marketing campaigns (which are already written and which I can film
myself), get them edited (which needs to be paid for) , edit the 3 EFT videos, set up a sales website for the book, and
pay for some Google and Facebook Ads.
Rather than do a less
than perfect job or have to wait until I have all the money necessary to go
ahead (or worse, have to borrow the money from the 'banksters'), I am offering the book at a special pre-release price and asking
for your assistance even in the case you have no personal use for the book. Even $10 would be great! For each donation I am
offering something in return. I hope you like your gifts of thanks. 
With the help from
backers like you the book will get to the people who need it, sooner rather
than later - and it will get done right. Thank you in advance for your support
and I hope to be able to return the favor one day for a crowd funding project
of your own.
This is how the book starts....  
“There was a young lady named Mae
Who smoked without stopping all day;
As pack followed pack,
Her lungs first turned black,
And eventually rotted away.”  Edward Gorey, Floating Worlds    
                     
                     
“Giving up smoking is the easiest thing in the
world. I know because I've done it thousands of times.” Mark Twain
I dedicate this book
to all the people in the world who go through addiction and come out the other
side wiser and stronger.

Author’s Note 
The nicotine demon
works by hijacking your brain, your body, your mind; some would say, even your
soul. This dark creature surrounds you in a gray cloud where you can wander for
years, sometimes not even realizing you are lost. Until for some reason, one
day, you awaken and find yourself hankering after bright sunshine again. 
All this time he’s
been fooling you into thinking you needed him - even that you liked him - while
behind the scenes his dark smoky tentacles have been slowly sucking the life
out of you. In the same way that real parasites like a tapeworm gives off
chemicals to make you desire the kind of food they want to eat, the nicotine
demon manages to convince you that you are the one choosing to smoke, rather
than it needing you, its host, to keep it fed. Adopting this perspective is the
first step to victory. 
Once you know you have
a nasty parasite living inside of you, controlling you, you can’t help but
develop a strong urge to get rid of it. In fact I suspect you would do whatever
was required to get it out of your body as fast as possible! This book is about
exposing the nicotine parasite (or nicotine demon as I like to refer to it),
getting you 100% motivated to do whatever it takes, and giving you the remedy
to conquer it forever. 
Introduction 
Bravo for deciding to
quit! Bravo for deciding to kick your nicotine addiction! Bravo for choosing to
be free! Bravo for having the guts to stand up to the nicotine demon! Going
back to being a non-smoker is the best decision you will ever make, and with
the help of this book and its associated content you will succeed. 
 In many ways I’m
a lot like you. I used to be a smoker. I really liked it actually. I totally
bought into the “cigarette in one hand, glass of wine in the other” thing. I
thought I was rather sophisticated; especially with those little brown
cigarillos I used to smoke during the time I lived in Paris. Then a number of
things happened.......................... (ah, you'll have to buy it if you want any more!)
Risks and challenges of the project
I don't actually see
any risks. There is a huge market for the book and with the right marketing
(I'm paying for classes on launching on the internet with PLF4 by marketing
wizard Jeff Walker) it will be very successful I'm sure. There is no other book
(program) quite like it. 
Except for creating a few videos the program is ready to go out into the world! 
My only challenge has been getting this last bit of money together to get the
book published and launched. Depending on how much money I can raise, the publishing will happen first, then the professional videos and then the marketing.
Perks of supporting me 
Pre-launch price for the book: $19.95 (instead of $24.99), plus $3.99 shipping
$10 donation gift: Time to really get
some sleep! For a donation of $10 or more I will send you a powerful mp3 of a
hypnosis session for deep relaxation and sleep (created by me) to your email
address.
$29 donation gift: A higher vibration! With this donation I give you an mp3
of a hypnosis session for deep relaxation and sleep AND an mp3 of a series of positive statements for
contemplation (including powerful subliminals) designed to increase your vibration and
understanding of who you are.
$100 donation gift: The book package! For this generous donation I will give you the $29 gifts and a 2 signed copies of the physical book, including shipping, with my thanks!
$250 donation gift: Wow, thank you! If you in, or can make it to Key West, it would
be my pleasure to invite you for dinner at our house. I will also send you the book package AND offer you a personal Skype session with me to be used for hypnosis and EFT for
releasing negative emotions, habits or for past life regression for yourself or
a friend. I'll also put your name on the acknowledgements page of the book (if received
by time of publishing).
If you are not able to help financially, I completely understand but I would love it if you could help get the word out for me and share this on Facebook etc.

story:
Short summary

In the first half of 2015 as SGM Lifewords we sent out over 100,000 Bible booklets to support outreach initiatives in Brazil. Our literature makes its way to prisons, hospitals and all kinds of other places where there are people in need. Feedback from local Christians is very encouraging: God’s Word is touching hearts and changing lives.

Above you can see Christians who use You Matter (Você é importante) – a popular outreach booklet for youngsters and adults alike – to share God’s love with patients in Brazilian hospitals. They are just one example of the many outreach initiatives where the booklet is used.

You matter re-tells the story of the prodigal son in a cartoon-like format. You can preview the English version here (Portuguese version is here). The Portuguese version has been printed before and proved extremely popular, especially among children and young people. All copies have been distributed, but demand for this title is still very high.

What we need

To print 15,000 copies, we need 2,500 USD.

Here is a breakdown of the cost for publishing the booklet:

  • Printing: 2,350 USD (the cost of producing 15,000 copies of Portuguese You matter).

  • Administrative costs: 150 USD (the cost of managing the project, including Indiegogo charges).

What if we do not get there

If we are unable to raise the whole amount, we will continue collecting funds for this project in other places until funding is secured. Then the print order will be placed. On the other hand, if we raise more than our target figure, we’ll be able to print more copies. Demand is high, so we know that all copies will be used well.

The impact

By providing Christians in Brazil with You Matter, you will help them emphasise God’s desire for reconciliation with the people they are trying to reach. Everyone needs forgiveness and a chance for a new beginning – that is what this booklet is about.

In our experience, many of the most missionally minded people are opportunity rich, but cash poor. Christians in Brazil are enthusiastically taking the Gospel to those around them, but often lack the means to provide evangelistic or discipleship literature to those they reach. Together we can provide some tools to help them to be more effective in their calling.

Risks & challenges

The booklet is already available for print. There is really only one risk involved in publishing You matter, and that is printer error.

Quality control, however, is something that we prioritise. We always carefully check each print run and if necessary we ask printers to tweak colours or make other improvements before accepting the final output. Many years of publishing experience effectively eliminate this risk.

Other ways you can help

Sometimes money is not the only way to help! Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about this campaign within your circle of influence to help us reach our goal. Thank you in advance for your help!

About SGM Lifewords

SGM Lifewords’ vision is to present the life-giving words of the Bible – to see hearts changed and lives transformed. We achieve this by freely resourcing people all over the world to share their faith through literature ministry and programmes. Our work started in 1888 and since then we have published well over a billion Bible resources in more than 1,000 languages worldwide.
